Amnesia is by far one of the worst anime I've ever watched. 
I don't know if I missed something or if I just don't understand reverse harem but this was one of the worst anime I've ever watched. 
Let's start with the story. 
Basically it's about a girl with no memories who die every fourth episode and restart from August 1 with a new boyfriend. 
I guess the story had potential but it didn't even get close to the greatness it could have achieved. 
I thought it was going to start up all tangled, which it did, then sort out into a massive mind blow.The only blow I got was an explosion of disappointment because it turned out to be one of the most pathetic love stories I have ever encountered. I would love to go in to detail but since you're not allowed to write spoilers in a review I can not tell my most delicious insults towards this shallow and superficial 3 episode love that goes on between the characters..... Oops! 



Now let's move on to the characters shall we? 

The first thing i want to comment on is that the anime does a great job satisfying all the shippers and bringing out the characteristics of the boys by allowing the main character  2 - 3 episodes to get to know them. That way the fan girls can fan girl over their tragic personalities and i can puke on how ridiculously stereotypical they are. 


We have Mr. Braincells who is socially awkward and doesn't understand love.

The mysterious negative emo with a broken home.

An extremely energetic big brother type and not to forget 

the disgustingly slimy womanizer who tries to make you feel sorry for him because all the girls fall for him. 


(so far this anime still sounds kind of interesting... damn...)


No offence to those who had a favorite boy. I'd by lying if I said I didn't.  After all I'm a girl and most of us are infected with shipping disease. There has to be a couple right? 


Oh! there is also a supporting character that is supposed to be helping the main character to get through her amnesia but he pops up for 2 minutes every 4 episodes and gives almost no help at all. Well... maybe he does. He tells her when to talk and run at least because apparently, she doesn't know when to do that. Which brings me to the worst, saddest, most pathetic female lead in the history of anime.  


She was so pathetic she didn't even deserve a name and there fore, I can not insult her by using her name because she really doesn't have one. 


Out of all the important memories you'd want to return, your name should be a priority right? Neither did anyone else bother to use it at any point during these 12 episodes....hmmm... *suspicion rises* 


Now let me sum up her personality in three simple words you probably learned in kindergarten and if you ever watch the show, you'll realize how spot on I am: 


Walking, talking, rock. 


Sometimes she wasn't even talking at all. Just making weird little shy girl sounds. That didn't bother me as much as the fact that she couldn't do anything by herself though. She couldn't even think by herself. In a dangerous situation she did nothing unless someone told her what to do. If you ever want to complain about something objectifying women, complain about this. She was just like an object and not more interesting than the hat she is always wearing on her kawaii little head. 


Which brings me to the art style.

I did not love the art style since I'm not particularly fond of hair sticking out of their heads like spiky antennas or the weird three colored eyes that makes it look like they are constantly sleepy or bored but after a while it became oddly satisfying and I started to realize the slight charm hidden behind those weird goth clothes. 


I can not comment on the soundtrack very much since it wasn't very memorable and the opening and ending didn't really interest me so i can't comment on those either since I always skipped. 


So to end my positive review: 

This anime wasn't as good as it could have been since it had a weak story line and a bad ending not to mention the superficial bonds that were created between the boring, spine less characters that couldn't convince me one bit when they confessed their love all over the place. They couldn't even manage to carry out the one thing the whole anime was about (giving her her memories back)

The art style was peculiar but oddly satisfying while the soundtrack wasn't memorable at all. It was bad from episode 1 and it was a drag getting through the episodes although they were only 12. 

The ending was a twist but it was not believable enough to even deserve a reference and if you like this anime and think I'm wrong and made a bigger mistake than Microsoft Office when they gave birth to Clippy, I am not sorry, i just didn't like this anime.

Ok, so I finally just finished Amnesia.  In my attempt to watch every episode I awaited for each episode of her confusion for me to be a little less confused.  I tried to make sense of what was going on and where they were going to go with the story, and then I saw the end.  I was actually disappointed that I had wasted my time watching it.  
Story:  You can't really explain much of the story without ruining the horrible "mystery" I suppose.  Heroine has amnesia, who knew right...in which every episode is her trying to figure outwhat's going on, and who she's with.  Yes, it's a reverse harem.  The story to me was awful.  They could have put a lot more effort into creating more drama and mystery, but you were left more with a scratching your head in a bad way wondering what's going on rather than a cognitively stimulated way.  And then the end came. Then the end came and I felt like it dragged on forever.  I sat literally wondering, "When is this going to be over, and are they going to actually do something."


Art: The art isn't bad, it's colorful, and bright.  However, the characters eyes are left with you wondering if they have some "special" power...but maybe that's just the style they used.


Characters:  The characters in this story were terrible.  I felt like some were randomly thrown in and the connections they had to the MC were completely irrelevant or stupid.  A lot of the characters had no back story, especially the Heroine, the one you probably could have used a little bit of a back story on.  You don't get much however.  Their interaction with each other is unnatural and odd.  The characters in this series disappointed me greatly.


Overall:  I didn't really do enjoyment because I don't feel like I enjoyed much of this anime at all.  I can say if you want an anime with sustenance do not watch this anime.  If you want an anime with a good mystery that leaves you wanting more, this isn't it.  If you want a dull and boring anime that has bright and pretty colorful characters you can stare at that really don't mean anything, then this anime is for you!  My overall experience of this anime is poor.  I was hoping by some means they would thrill me somehow with the end, and really come out with some amazing plot twist or something...but that didn't happen for me.

Amnesia: I Wish I Had It After This
Actually, you know what, I'm pretty sure I'll be contracting amnesia when it comes to this series because it is one of the more forgettable pieces of work I've seen so far this year. It was incredibly underwhelming. It's sad to see Brains Base put out such a terrible piece of work, especially considering how well they've done with series' like Natsume Yuujinchou, Baccano, Spice+Wolf and Durarara. This series doesn't even come close to capturing the same magic as those series. So where did this series go astray? Honestly, it fails when it comes to its plot andits characters. 


Amnesia is about a girl who wakes up on August 1st only to find out that she has amnesia (go figure) and doesn't remember anything prior to the date she awakened. As soon as she wakes up, she discovers she can see a strange, fairy-like being known as Orion that no one else can see, as Orion tries to assist this girl in trying to recover her memories. As the series progresses, the protagonist continues to get into accidents only to awaken on August 1st all over again, except she seems to awaken in an alternate dimension where her relationships are slightly different.


This series was painful to watch for many reasons. The first being the characters are downright terrible. The protagonist isn't even given a name throughout the series. I'm assuming the biggest reason is due to Amnesia being an adaptation to a visual novel where you program your own desired name. Having a nameless protagonist works fine in a visual novel...but not an anime. The protagonist felt detracted from the rest of the characters because she had no name or at least wasn't referred to by name. It's just hard to get invested in a nameless character. The least Brains Base could've done was give her a name. Can you imagine if Aniplex didn't name the lead protagonist in the Persona 4: The Animation? It would be so much harder to get invested in "Yuu Narukami's" character because it would be detracting that the other characters won't refer to him by name. At any rate, to get back on topic, that's still no excuse for the rest of the characters. Besides Ukyou, all of the characters felt bland as cardboard and that might be an insult to cardboard. All of her potential love interests were either uninteresting or just had unappealing personality quirks. Still, as much as I disliked all of the characters, the protagonist ground my gears the most. While I realize she had amnesia and that can throw off how you would normally act, her thoughts and actions were completely illogical. Her methods of trying to get her memories back were extremely round-a-bout and it seemed like whenever she decided on doing something, I smacked my forehead out of frustration and screamed "idiot!" at my computer screen. The protagonist was a weak character with almost no redeemable qualities whatsoever. She acted illogically, she had zero personality, and the series provided very little motivation to her character whatsoever. I haven't seen a lead female protagonist in an anime this bad since watching Felicita in Arcana Famiglia. 


The plot and story was abysmal. I will admit that this series did have a nice mystery element at first. It was really the only reason why I even kept watching because I was intrigued as to why she would continue to wake up on August 1st and I was intrigued as to why she kept ending up in different dimensions. However, the payoff was far from satisfactory and I felt duped by the time it was all said and done. The explanations that were given to us in the end were baffling at best and all-in-all, I was still left with more questions than answers. On top of that, I found this series to be riddled with cliches and the scriptwriting to be downright piss poor. 


The animation is sadly one of the better aspects of this series and even then, I wouldn't call it "good." From a technical standpoint, the animation isn't bad. I just found the character designs to be dreadful. Overall, I just couldn't get past how ridiculous the character and costume designs were for each character. While I am aware that the series was trying to implement a "playing card" atmosphere for each character, how they were designed was off-putting and somewhat corny. One of the more off-putting aspects of it was how the characters never changed clothes. They continuously looked and dressed the same throughout the entire thing. The ONLY costume change I can recall is the lead protagonist in her normal everyday clothes and her night gown. That's it. Again, much like the character name, that is something that might work in a visual novel, but not an anime. 


I will say ONE good thing about Amnesia. It did have some really good music composition. This was Yoshiaki Dewa's first series in regards to music direction and I must say, he did a remarkably good job. The theme songs by Yagi Yanagi and Ray were both really well done and they were the few bright spots I can say about this series. 


All-in-all, I have only a few words to share for Yoshimitsu Ohashi (Director) and Brains Base. This was terrible. This was an absolutely terrible attempt at adapting a visual novel that probably would've been difficult to adapt in the first place. They committed several cardinal sins in the adaptation process and some of which are downright unforgivable. The best way I can describe it on the whole is lazy. This series was lazily written and lazily produced. It didn't try to tell a compelling story. It didn't try to create an engaging romance between the protagonists and the love interests. It didn't try in almost every aspect of anime production. I cannot recommend this series to anyone and I can assure you this is probably going to end up on my Worst Animes of 2013 list. If there was ever an example of how to NOT adapt a visual novel to anime, Amnesia is probably the best example I can think of.

Well it's kinda strange and interesting at the same time, when the girl goes into an accident she goes back to august 1st and dates another guy like when she dated Shin and now she's dating Ikki i guess her memory stopped at August 1st and thus when ever she goes into an accident she then go back to August 1st. She's supposed to regain her memories back so that she could continue her life and never get back to August 1st again...

---Status: 4/12 episodes | Overall rating: 7,3
Okay, I take back what I've said before. Amnesia is better than the animes I compared it with. Finally it seems to get really interesting and exciting because of this time leap and time switch confusion. Well, the girl is still lifeless but the riddle becomes quite interesting. It's pretty cliché shoujo atmosphere but at least that's not everything and there are many open questions which make you want to know more about the circumstances. 
And I kind of enjoy Shin's dominat temper towards her. ;) Furthermore, I'm curious about the attitude of the other male characters when theybecome a part of her life in this time leaping world. ;)


--- status: 3/12 episodes | Overall rating: 5

Amnesia reminds me of Neo Angelique Abyss and Kimi ga Nozomu Eien: 

The heroine is mentally absent, puzzled, confused, obedient, submissive, has a lack of own opinions, no temper and is boring. There's nor charm nor allurement. There's a supporting character (in Kimi: the sister | in Amnesia: the ghost) who is kind of annoying. In Angelique and Amnesia you can find many pretty boys but this cannot replace any content. 


At least there's a ray of hope and that's why I think this series might get interesting. Her boyfriend, Shin, says the heroine's personality is different from before. Usually, she'd get angry if he kissed her or become upset when he did this and that - but this usual reaction was missing and he remarked it. So maybe she had a personality and is on her way to get it back? 


Also some characters might get interesting and that's why I'll watch it for a while. There still might be some potential but I don't expect much of it.


However, the art is really beautiful and the character's two-colored eyes are pretty creative.

Anime so bad it's worth watching!
Heroine has no personality at all, just a blank sheet of paper which can communicate by sounds of inhaling air. Every other character is a cliched, yet another typical shoujo persona: super-cheerful female friend, the dark and mysterious bishounen, the caring and funny childhood friend, you know - the usual stuff.
The story? Romance them all and find out whom you like the most! And die once in a while. Literally.
The music is bland and forgettable, but I liked the opening and ending. 
If you like facepalming yourself few times per minute while watching some poorly animated, wanna-be-deep-and-mysterious anime, this isthe thing you're looking for. Great for watching with friends! Just bring gallons of alcohol and make shots every time our nameless heroine says "eeh". Have fun, I certainly do!

Story: 5/10
- Given that the anime made the viewer (that is me) wanting to keep watching until the mystery unraveled.
This anime brings a lot of emphasis into the protagonist of the story, who is a lost girl with no memories of herself at all. In the anime, she produces a scarce personality where the guy characters could do ALMOST anything to her without a  fight. She does not feel any specific emotions throughout the story and she lacks character. She would react with a character the same way with another because of this lack of personality. Although she has amnesia, this lost attitude iswhat made the other characters seem more important than the 'Heroine'.


Art: 10/10


The art in this anime was amazing. The eyes of the characters were colourful and brought a lot of life into them. The male characters were given a slim overall body shape and the main female character was given a (I guess) an average look.


Sound: 7/10


I loved the specific ending's music box melody, the ending theme, the opening theme. The music box melody gave a lot of feelings and emotions in the anime. As for the opening and ending theme, they were produced very well that was quite catchy for me.


Character: 6/10


Although I did not like the Heroine's personality, I liked her innocent and caring self. It sometimes made me think that it's too unreal to be true, even with amnesia. 


As for the male characters, I did not like most of them due to their assertiveness throughout the story (except for one). However, I like the uniqueness of each of the male characters and how each of them are valued differently by the Heroine.


 Enjoyment: 6/10


I enjoyed when the Heroine is able to develop through the story. She produces a more distinct self as the anime goes on. I also enjoyed how she reacts with the various male characters in the plot. However, the ending seemed rushed, where most of the mystery unravels at the end of episode 11. 


Overall: 6/10

- I would recommend this to viewers who likes mystery in a way; however, make sure to not be too surprised at the end of the anime.

Hi this is my first review i decided to write this as this Anime seems to have very few good review's when i think i does deserve.

Art 10/10

Here is a review coming from some of the first  who actually watched all episodes. I've anxiously waited for the final episode... Amnesia is a series full of mystery and internal struggle on the canvas of alternative world traveling,all while adding a drop of romance to finish the cocktail. It begs its viewers to do some detective job in order to understand it, I know this because I had a hard time at first putting all the  facts together or you can say I'm somewhat of a dummy.
Here is a personal opinion that I assume nobody gives a damn about:
Great story, very intriguingart concept for both background and characters. Epic OST's (some of the best I've heard). Also characters are totally different from one another except they have this air of coolness about them.\n
General opinion\n
A very dramatic piece of art that shows how much someone can do to accomplish a wish out of love.\n
Hope you like it... and if you don't,well, bummer.

First of all, I can't understand why people give this Anime a bad review after watching 1-3 episodes. A lot of people mentioned the reason they dropped it is the story line being too confusing to understand. Now, if you would read the synopsis of this anime, you could guess that it won't be easy to understand, especially since it's not fully aired. Just because you can't comprehend, it doesn't mean the story is bad. A lot of animes start off weird and slowly explain what's going on. No one can expect to fully understand what is happening in Amnesia after 6 Episodes.  I'lltry to keep spoilers as low as possible here. 


Now to the review itself, what actually got me drawn to this Anime was the (for me) outstanding and appealing art style. It is obviously a Shoujo-Anime so the target audience is mainly female. I've seen a lot of people describing the main character, Heroine, as dull, boring, quiet and a bit silly. I think she is a cute and kind character and it is pretty obvious, that after losing all her memories, not knowing who she is, where she is and what her relationships with any of the people she meets are, she is just being cautious and doesn't know how to interact properly. Especially in the following episodes where she is waking up in a new world (always on the 1st of August) with mixed up memories and relationships again (mostly without Orion's guidance) she gets confused. 


However, I'm not too judgmental of it yet since I've watched a lot of Animes that start explaining what's happening in the last few episodes. 

Of course after watching 6 episodes so far you can guess that it has a lot to do with Ukyo (the green haired dude who is friendly to her but seems a bit vicious when he's alone) and my guess is that before she's being sent  to another world, she always dies in the previous one (various incidents that could cause death'). This is merely an assumption though.


Anyway, can't wait for the next episodes! Absolutely love the idea so far, will see what they make of it.

Amnesia was anime which I accidentally stumbled upon and at first glance it seemed like something which I would particularly enjoy, but little did I know it was a reverse harem, so for me this was a major disappointment.
Story 4/10
Like many harems and reverse harems, Amnesia lacked a stable plot line and there were massive gaps which were never filled at the end of the anime. The story itself sounded intriguing, but as I continued through the episodes I found myself wondering how each one will match up to the description which I read. It did however match up to its main genre, a reverseharem which is one positive thing about this anime. 


Art 7/10


This was one of the main reasons I decided to finish this anime, the art was not brilliant, but I enjoyed the card theme which was displayed throughout the anime and I have to admit, the outfits were somewhat amazing. Other than that the manner in which the characters themselves, excluding the outfits, were somewhat normal, but all in all the art did give this anime some form of value.


Sound 8/10


Along with the art the sound, especially the opening song, did do their job somewhat well and I was impressed by the effort they placed within the music. I have to say the sound of the anime usually makes or breaks it for me and what can I say, even though this anime fell under the genre I would usually avoid, it did have great sound sound quality. 


Character 3/10


This was, well, extremely poorly done. There was little if none character development and the main character just made me frown. She was barely spoke and never really truly developed. If it had not been for the great music and the intriguing art theme I would not have been able to finish this anime.


Enjoyment 3/10


I did not at all enjoy this anime, but it had a few humors moments which made it somewhat enjoyable. But all in all this was not an anime for me.

All I see is people complaining but I didn't think it was horrible. Honestly when I started it I was hoping for a bit more action. The characters themselves looked like they'd fit an action/ fantasy anime more than this. 
     The art was pretty amazing if I do say so myself but the story line was lacking. The first episodes I found incredibly boring but it picked up in the end. The characters personalities didn't match their looks and yes this is pretty much a huge reverse harem for girls who like attractive boys inanime. \n
     I'm a bit disappointed really, I was expecting so much more out of this anime than I got and the sad thing is that the author could have done so much more with it. I gave it a 6 because I did enjoy it to some degree it just didn't meet my expectations.

WOW so many reviews giving this show such a negative publicity !! Well the show is not at all poor in any sense.
Writing this review after watching 7 eps. and I have to say, I totally look forward to this show every week. In fact its hard to wait for a week actually to see what's gonna happen next.
Story [10/10]: I loved the concept of the show- A girl, who, every time she experiences some kind of shock wakes up, finds her surroundings changed. How she and the people around her respond to it is the essence of the story till now. I loved thedirection of this show. The scenes change at a very good pace which keeps the mystery alive in each episode. And especially the last scene cut at the end of Ep. 7. It was so subtle!


Art and Animation [10/10]: Full marks here as well :) The characters are all gorgeous and the backgrounds are well suited to all the scenes. Animation is top notch for me as well.


Sound [8/10]: The OP and ED are both very groovy. The background music isn't too much noticeable.


Character [8/10]: I loved the way the girls character was handled. Her responses to all the things she experiences was very well crafted. As for the guys they are not bad. All are suspicious looking at the beginning but you get a flavor of their personalities with each episode. When the protagonist is in a particular world with one guy, the others dont even appear anywhere. This can be both a positive or a negative point - The former -> since it helps in highlighting the incidents of a particular world where one of them is the girl's partner. The latter -> Since the creators of the show could have added many situation in which such interactions of the girl would be complicated by including the other characters influence to the flow of events. But again I am satisfied fully with watching what I am shown :)


Enjoyment and Overall [9/10]: I am enjoying every bit of this show. Its got all the right amount of mystery to it And the pace of the show is good as well. So completely recommended to watch *thumbs up*

I always watch anime with a friend / friends, and many of my male friends didn't really enjoy this anime as much as my female friends did, so I'm going to assume that this is an anime most girls would enjoy. Here is my point of view on this anime:
[STORY] - 10/10
-----------
For one, the story is centered around a girl which we have no idea what her name is, and we just decided to name her 'Heroine' for some odd reason. I for one found that pretty interesting because they lasted 12 episodes and an OVA without mentioning her name, which I was pretty impressedby. The plot of this story was also very interesting to me, because it was shoujo and reversed harem. The heroine of this story was being protected by several handsome male leads, and I found that very romantic. The ending was also very surprising, but you'll have to watch for yourself to see what happens.


[ART] - 10/10

-----------

The art in this anime was very clear and high quality. Not much to say here, really. They were also very detailed when it came to lighting, and when the scenes took place in the dark, you could still clearly see what was happening without having to be 1 inch away from the screen trying to figure out what was going on. 


[SOUND] - 9/10

-----------

The theme song of this anime, Zoetrope, is one of my favorite anime openings. No... it is my favorite out of all the openings I have watched. Many of my friends explained it as "mysterious", meaning that they were very curious on what the anime was about, adding that the animation of the theme didn't include any spoilers (in my eyes), while several other openings of other anime did. I've also watched both dubbed and subbed of this anime, and the dubbed version of several characters were kind of timid, but it still showed the character's true colors and personality. 


[CHARACTER] - 10/10

-----------

The character designs of this anime is one of my favorites. I loved the design of the characters' eye colors and hair highlights, especially the clothing. The clothing was very interesting, especially Shin's style of clothes. It really showed that it was like a fantasy. Orion was also a very interesting character to look into. Even though he didn't appear much in the anime, he was also very cute and really made me curious on where he was when he disappeared from couple episodes.


[ENJOYMENT]  - 10/10

-----------

I personally enjoyed this anime a lot, but I have read the reviews of this anime, and not many people actually liked it as much as I did, which really shocked me. Again, I feel like this anime is more enjoyed by a female audience rather than a male audience, although some males would probably still like it. 


[OVERALL]  - 10/10

-----------

This anime is one of my top favorite romance / shoujo animes. I have watched a lot of romance and shoujo animes, but none of them were as mysterious as this anime. I also personally really dislike comedy, which in this case, really made me like this anime a lot. 


FINAL SCORE:

10/10

You. Yeah, you. Are you a lonely teenage girl who doesn't care about anything but sexy bishies? You are? That's good man, that's real good! If you aren't, please turn away and forget that this exists. After watching this you wish to have amnesia to forget it.
NOTE: This anime is based on a dating simulation for girls. I must say, the opening got me already interested. Expect for the fact she was kissing with every guy, it looked really interesting. So did the beginning. The main character is seen trying to escape a building about to collapse. She is then seen working in a cafe,where she apparently has a black-out. And... that's all we get to know in the entire anime about her. I mean, it's about amnesia and all, but that's not a reason to give your characters no backstory or even a NAME. So I guess we just call her 'Heroine'. And if that is not enough yet, she seems to be okay with everything. She can't express herself, and sometimes has problems saying yes or no. At some times the guys even got a bit rapey, but she seems to be completely okay with that and doesn't protest. Either way, the story. It was an interesting concept, Heroine has amnesia and a mysterious pixie named Orion shows up and helps her recover her memories. BTW, the memories are not from her childhood and such, but from her boyfriend. Ughh... first 10 episodes, no progress at all. No plot and very confusing. And then two last episodes, SUGAR RUSH! Since I can't really tell more unless I start telling spoilers, let's move on.\n
I already said what I thought about the Heroine. Most boring, idiotic and foolish character in a long while. The other characters (In other words, the bishies) are pretty much the ones you find in dating games. The popular one, smart one, shy one, crazy one and mysterious one. They don't have much backstory either actually, and sometimes really treated the Heroine as shit. But you already know she loves being pushed around. Though as I female, I must admit I did like their design a lot. They all looked unique and their eyes...oh god. Might be the best thing in this anime. Might be the best anime eyes I've ever seen. But one thing bothered me.. were these the sons of Slenderman? They really had such long legs it scared me.Okay, this is a reverse harem, but it did not feel romantic at all. Maybe it was because she had amnesia, but it felt like they were two strangers kissing. It's not like she really build a relationship with one of them.\n
The sound is good, I already said I loved the opening. Voice actors sound okay, Heroine had kind of an annoying voice though.\n
So, in other words, even for a dating simulation adaption, this was horrible. You might watch because the guys are pretty cute and sexy, but if you're not interested in that you will not find anything of interest. You will start crying because of the stupidity of the Heroine, and your brain will hurt from the confusing (if it actually is there) plot. I say it again, if your dream is to be surrounded by hot guys, this is perfect for you.

What was I about to say??????????Oh, I'm here to make a review, man this amnesia thing is getting into me. So, at lot of people say that this anime is the worse at the start of 2013, well, they're half right, considering the fact if one focuses too much on the characters' flamboyant goth attires which would make one think that this anime was all art and not much content. But, if one drops this anime too early, then he or she doesn't know what he or she misses. Though, this anime was once an "Otome game" it wasn't a surprise that the director, YoshimitsuOhashi did it that way where we the audience would be taken for a ride as the main character Heroine travels from one alternate world to the next trying to find out what's really going on with her memories as well as the various arc that comes with every plot from one alternate universe to the next. I'm a bit disappointed with the following: Orion's inability to physically help the main character, Kent's one time arc with the main character and Touma's animalistic treatment of the main character. It was nice to know that even though that this anime revolves around Heroine, she was kinda cutsy but I hate the clothes she was wearing, she basically this kind of a woman who is the very epitome of unconditional love and compassion though that scene with Touma was something that shouldn't happen to a sweet character like her. It was good that the anime did ended with a bit of suspense on the side with Ukyō and it looks that where this anime's writer,  Touko Machida was counting on, but as this anime ends, we're life with a sort of cliffhanger as to which world did she choose to go to, end.


So, here are my category ratings for this anime:



Story: good 7.


I like the way that this anime's plot was confusing at first, that's if one was to drop this anime prematurely. But as it progresses the picture becomes clear.


Art: poor 3.


Ay, yay, yay, what can I say, this was probably the most unnecessary overdecorated anime I've ever seen, it like putting too many condiments and spices in the food that you no longer taste the food.


Sound: fair 6.


I just have no comment about the sound, since Orion's seiyuu was a chica, then studio Brains Base should've consider making Orion's gender a chica as well.


Character: good 7.


I guess for a chica who was as sweet as kind as her, she really did carried the anime direction very well, though, I would've wish that she has the guts to stand up against Ikki's bitches.


Enjoyment: very good 8.


It was something that one can  look forward of watching it and can't wait for the ending. It was also nice that there is this little cliffhanger of which the main character has to choose as to which world does she want to returned to, as long as it ain't Touma's world.  


Overall: very good 8.


It was a blast to watch it, the mystery, romance, shoujo, reverse harem and suspense did played well. The End.

This anime is very confusing but good.  The main heroine is I guess in two different reality as she suffers through "amnesia".  It's like she doesn't know if she's dreaming or awake.  She doesn't know which reality is the true reality.  It's based off an otome game so it's a reverse harem.  It's cool but very confusing.  However the art is amazing.  The detail on the eyes are cool, I've sort of observed that all otome game adapted animes have detailed art.  So if you like reverse harems or otome games, this is a good one!

STORY:
The story of Amnesia isn't exactly your typical romance, it is a tale of a girl trying to find her happiness with a different guy every few episodes. I thought the plot of Amnesia was pretty mediocre, admittedly I enjoyed the first few episodes but after continuing I found it pretty boring and VERY repetitive to say the least. There isn't much I can say about the story of Amnesia without me sounding like I'm completely hating on it; overall I believe the story was ok and will give it the credit of being fairly original.
ART:
The one thing I'd like to praise this anime foris the art, I thought all the character designs from the clothes to the facial features were detailed and beautiful. Amnesia had artwork better than alot of the more popular anime out there in all honesty.


SOUND:

The sound isn't amazing nor is it awful, the opening I thought was very good and I really enjoyed it, however the ending didn't quite live up to the opening. The background sound wasn't very memorable and was pretty average.


CHARACTERS:

Each of the main characters had a fairly in depth background story minus the Heroine considering her amnesia. All the characters were pretty decent until I realized that half of the main characters were deranged, one being OVERLY protective and the other being bipolar; the female lead lacked personality for me and was very bland not to mention useless. The other two remaining main characters were likable to me. 


ENJOYMENT:

As I said earlier I enjoyed the first few episodes of Amnesia but found it hard it enjoy the rest. I found it a little irritating to complete the rest of the anime. I may have even really liked the anime if it wasn't so mad, far fetched and repetitive.


OVERALL:

Overall I believe Amnesia was a pretty dull anime which lacked interest, a relatable or fun story and likable characters. The first few episodes seemed promising but after that it seemed to unfortunately go down hill which resulted in me not liking the remainder of the anime.

Amnesia as you guys probably know, is an adaption from the game Amnesia, which is an otome game
if you've never played one before you should know 2 things about them:
1) the story is about a girl having the chance to choose out of many hot guys, one to fall in love with etc, you make choices and go down a road with certain chara's , you got many possible endings according to choices you make etcetc google for more inf
2) games like Amnesia are designed in a way that 'you' the one whom plays the game , will be able to imagine yourself AS thegirl in the game, as

'the HEROINE' 

does that name sound familiar? it does right 

As matter of fact, to create such an effect, the girls 'heroines' are almost always (I've only played a few so I can't say all xD) really weakly expressed 

because it's you! , you yourself make the choices , so ofcourse it's not that weird that she does not have a name

it's so that you can imagine yourself to be her, or well that's the purpose of the game and, 

this is why in almost all otome game made anime, the maingirls 

are really weak in character, cause it's only the guys of the game that actually have one planned out before them

so for the producers to give her personality and somehow, make a good storyline out of all the possible ones 

is not what you can call easy


This whole weak main character thing becomes an achillis heel in many of these anime and often ruins the whole thing BUT

 In Amnesia , the girl actually has a reason to be timid, shy, confused, have a weak presence etc ,cause she has 'amnesia' or whatever kind of memoryloss she is suffering from (I can't say she never annoys me but, I can manage to relate to her, if you imagine yourself to be in that situation .....)


As for the anime itself

as for now, I've watched 9 episodes and though I can't say 'I enjoyed myself 100%  watching every episode' or 'can't wait to see the next episode' or sth along those lines

for an otome anime, I don't think it's bad at all, I expected more because I really love the game and was really looking foreward to it 

but, hey! they kept the original designs of the characters intact

and well, I think they really work! I love the eyes, love the clothes , love their voices and all

the guys are just, all , perfect in a way so, no complaints about that one

even if the story lacks, we still have candy for the eye and ears... I guess... 

so overall I'm very satisfied with the art in that aspect (the surroundings , background, movements,... ain't all that much but , I don't really care, it's not a sports anime or anything)


though for some of you , the pacing might seem to go slow, actually , everytime an 'arc' with a guy ends , I'm like 'allready?' 'was that all?'

I have no idea where they're trying to go with this show (what kind of ending are they gonna make cause the game has loads of endings) and 

it might turn out being just another cheap-plot girly fluff 'I love you let's be together forevah and evah' anime 

I'll be crossing my fingers till the last episode for it to be worth it xD


I love the opening theme and vid, love the ending vid , 

so in short:


Amnesia has a nice package of good designs , pretty boys, great and fitting voice actors nice art and pretty good sound


even if the story's not really worth it, maybe the guys are? xD

and well, if you compare it with other otome anime , it ain't all that bad 

there's only a few otome I actually managed to watch completely, 

and even less I actually managed to love, so I've learned not to expect too much when one is gonna air

I strongly advice you guys to play the game though :D

Okay, so rather than a review this is me rambling about the show, so SPOILER WARNING.
Tl;Dr: Character diagnosis for MC: actually braindead, worst Otome-game-heroine syndrome I've ever seen; Watch out for the edge in this Animes character design or you might accidentally cut yourself; Natural Selection should just end MC and her stupidity already; Literally no survival instinct whatsoever
I've never written a review before and I never wanted to. But this fucking Anime managed to make me do it so at least that's something I can give this flaming pile of shit credit for.
The story is rather simple: A girl has amnesia, as the titlewould suggest and gets into parallel universes of her life, which is always just slightly different, every time she dies. As I am typing this the Story-idea actually sounds interesting holy shit, but don't be deceived. While the idea is good in my opinion the end result is not. Some people would excuse this with the Anime being based on an Otome-game, which honestly are always not that thought out story- and characterwise, it's still not an excuse to produce absolute shit. The only thing that somehow saved the story for me that the spooky mystery of all this was explained in the last two episodes and made sense more or less. But still it was only more or less, so still pretty much shit.


The characters, their behaviour and their actions made me so angry and annoyed that I had to leave my Computer regularlly to calm down. Holy Gucamoly. It pissed me off so much. Simply said the characters were all, with out an exception flat and simply stupid. None of their actions made sense.


Okay, so this is were the actual rambling begins. I made notes while watching this. I wrote everything down that annoyed me or made no sense and I can tell you that it's a lot. I also just want to say that I know the names of the characters I just refuse to call them by them. Except for our Heroine who's name maybe got lost in translation or in the German subtitles, but it was not said once there, so I honestly don't know if she has a name or not.


So first off the characters are all assholes. And I don't mean that they behave rude or anything. I mean that every character who noticed that MC had amnesia just didn't really seem to care about it. The worst with this was the Red dude. He noticed immediately and even called her out on it, and I would say that you could expect from your partner that they would try to help you with this huge fucking problem. But not Red dude. He made it all about himself and he only talked about himself and his own struggles with his girlfriend having amnesia instead of being there for her. And this was the case for most of the characters. Everybody only talks and only cares for themselves which seemed weird to me because they all were MCs boyfriend in one parallel universe.


Also when MCs hair was cut off by these totally creepy Fanclub members of Blue dude everybody acted like they cut off a limb or something, but the hair grew back in a matter of seconds. This was probably just a production mistake or laziness from the production team, but still her hair was immediately back to the same length. Made me laugh out loud so that's at least something positive.


One fucking HUGE point are the characters clothes. Like, all of them. What the actual fuck are they wearing. Like, you see all these background characters being dressed normal and then you see the main cast and just wonder why no one is calling the police on them.


Green bois cloak is so damn ugly I actually have no words. And the best part is that he is some kind of Doctor in Mathematics and just sits in his office with this hideous long leather cloak. How to any of his colleagues take him seriously? How does he work in this? Is it actually comfortable? Why are there so many straps on the cloak ( I counted 20) and how long does it take to close them all when putting this thing on? I have so many questions.


Yellow bois clothes are arguably the most normal. The only thing weird about it is the ripped yellow cloth tied around his waist but that's about it. But don't worry kids, all the weirdness that would have went into his outfit went into his character so that's something to be happy about.


Blue dudes clothes are no better, I mean, his jacket is just weird and looks like he's some kind of steampunk butler and he ALSO has a useless strap on his arm (one character designer seems to have a thing for these somehow which only adds to my confusion). His shirt is okay, still not something I'd buy but hey, each their own. But why is he wearing gloves all the time? Why is everybody else wearing gloves all the time? They do mention several times that it's really cold for August but it can't be that fucking cold 'cause all the girls are walking around in their kawaii fucking skirts. But what's most hideous about Blue dudes outfit is for one his hair clipper and his fucking drawn on Spade under his eye. Actually no, that's not the worst. The worst is his fucking shoes. On one side he wears a regular normal looking black shoe. But that wouldn't be edgy enough right? This is too normal for all the lonely teenage girls who are watching this garbage. On his other foot he wears a fucking thigh high boot. Nothing sexier on a man than that right Ladies?


But beware. This is topped by Red dude. His outfit is probably the worst. Not only does he wear a long ripped shirt, skinny jeans which are red on one side and black on the other, gloves because how else could it be and an actually rather normal looking leather jacket. He also wears a useless beltstrap hanging down to one side 'cause fashion and two straps around his neck, one black and one red. BUT that's not all. He doesn't wear one but TWO thigh high boots which are as everything else on him, red and black. This is so fucking edgy I think I cut myself.


Photographer dudes clothes are also a thing for itself. He wears this long ass coat which has an asymmetrical hemline and some kind of skirt over his simple trousers (because trousers alone would be TOO simple) which seems to be connected to his coat somehow. Must be a pain in the ass to take a piss while wearing this thing. He also wears some kind of hat, a vomit coloured shirt and a tie that's always knotted loosely. Why wear a tie to begin with if you don't wear it properly at least once goddamnit? Because fashion. But the best thing about his outfit are his stilettos. He walks perfectly on these heels which actually surprised me. I love them.


As I mentioned before, MC travels into a slightly different parallel univers every time she dies which actually sounds like a good idea. The problem with this is HOW she always dies. I guess the writer of this either had really no idea how to let MC die almost every two episodes basically or they just don't know how humans behave. Maybe they're an alien. Don't want to discriminate. Her first death is her literally RUNNING of a cliff. Suicide? You think. No, she's just stupid.

For her second death she gets run over by a car. Alright. This is acceptable. Or it would be, if she wasn't almost run over by a car in nearly every episode. So what can we say? She's just stupid.

The third death is HIGHLY stupid since MC drowned. Well, now you may think that she simply can't swim and maybe that's the case but I don't know because it was never clarified. She simply fell into the water and did not move anymore, sinking like a stone. Someone who can't swim would at least TRY to keep their head over water. So she's just stupid.

And well for her fourth death she didn't even actually die. She just let go of Green bois hand. And while this was actually a nice transition to her being in a world where she's with Yellow boi it simply doesn't make sense. How does her letting go of a hand is equivalent to her dying? Damn dude must have died a lot in my lifetime then.


An other stupid thing was that no one would recognize Blue dude when he put on his sunglasses. As if no one would recognize his motherfucking ugly clothes. Clark Kent much? And an OTHER thing related to this is Blue dudes absolutely creepy Fan-Club. I know that there are some people like that, like Sasaengs in K-Pop and stuff but damn. Instead of calling the police on them like any normal being would Blue dude actually chills with them. Understandable, right? They only tried to kill MC for talking to him like two or three times. Totally normal.

You know, I actually kinda liked Blue dude in the beginning. Sure, he's a stupid whore but in comparison to the others he seemed rather normal. What killed his character for me was the explanation as to why all the girls want a piece from him. It's because he wished for it as he saw a shooting star when he was six. If shooting stars actually worked like that I'd be fucking rich by now. Well, this could be excused with "Neil-sama trying to fulfill humans wishes", but I don't actually think that that's the reason they added this to his character, as he himself says that it's more like a burden, so that would go against everything Neil is trying to do. I just think that it's a lazy excuse.


The only thing pretty about this Anime is how the characters eyes are coloured and even that was ruined for me because of Blue dudes fucking stupid shooting star story and the effect his "magical eyes"™ have on girls.


Yellow boi was the most sympathetic character to me in the beginning. But ooooooooooh boi that is not the case. He's an actual psychopath which goes very well with MCs braindeadness. Like, when the little Fairy mate tells her not to eat or drink anything Yellow boi gives her because he's drugging her with it. What does our bright light do? Takes a huge fucking sip of that drugged coffee. Tasty. 

The best part of MC being held in Yellow bois apartment against her will was when Red dude showed up because he suspected that something was wrong. He even questioned wether MC actually wants to be there. Any normal being would now, that a friend is there who not only noticed himself that something is wrong but also would surely help them, tell them that they don't actually want to be there and that tehy're being drugged. Or maybe not that but at least the first part. What does MC say instead? "Please don't fight". 

Like honestly at this point it's just Natural Selection. I actually WANT her to die, because she is simply too fucking stupid to be kept alive.

And honestly, Yellow boi went out of his way to buy a huge fucking metal cage to keep MC in, so he could at least bought one were he has a little slot to slide in MCs meals and clothes and all that other shit, so he wouldn't have to open the door all the way everytime he gave her something. But oh well MC never even tried to do something or fight back so why waste money on something like that, right? MC also seems to develop a Stockholm Syndrome while she is held in Yellow bois apartment, which is even ENCOURAGED by the little Fairy mate. Like, he lets her out only once, says one nice thing and she's immediately like "Alright mate let me touch you". And the best part is that all of Yellow bois clearly psychopathic behaviour is excused by everyone who knows about it with "He's actually just trying to protect her". Like, yah, may be, but the cause doesn't excuse the action. 

The mos stupidiest part was when MC managed to escape from Yellow boi. Not only did she take the time to put on her own clothes again, 'cause hey, why hurry right? But she ALSO was stupid enough to instead of going to the police go to her own apartment, where the psychopath can find her easily AND has a doorkey for which he actually MENTIONED before.


A huge thing that bothered me about this Anime was that every bruise or cut MC got was treated like they found out that she had cancer or was stabbed in the guts or something. MC also has a thing for tripping over nothing which is very kawaii desu ne and desirable and not stupid A T  A L L, am I right? But oh well, that's the case in most Animes so I won't whine too much about it.


Up until this point  I actually thought that Fairy mate was the character that was the most normal and logically thinking, but no. He supports MC in her Stockholm Syndrome which also puts him on the "braindead List". So far every single character is on it.


What bothered me the most about MC was something I noticed while she was caged by Yellow boi. Her survival instinct are completely absent. I even would say that they go into negative numbers. Like, honestly. Everytime she activally does something to safe her own life it's because someone TOLD her to do it and not because her own instincts tell her to. If it was up to her she would just fucking sit or stand there, no matter what happened. She seems to be actually braindead. Most of her lines consist of "Uhm..." and "Huh...?", which makes for a very interesting and immersible character. 10/10. 

And well, as was said before, MC actually deserves to die in my opinion because she's so fucking stupid, braindead and nothing but a bother to those around her. So next time there's a car again that almost drives her over there shouldn't be someone who pulls her back.

MCs stupidity really shines when she meets Photographer dude. Fairy mate tells her that he probably has a split personality, because the dumb shit wouldn't notice herself even if her life depended on it (which it actually does, but as we established before MC has no survival instinct so maybe that's the reason), and Photographer dude even tells her himself not to trust him and not to meet him alone, because while one side loves her the other personality is trying to kill her. Well, MC being MC doesn't listen to any of them, because there are no survival instincts in her to tell her to do so and literally does everything she was told not to do. So in the last episode I hoped so hard that she would finally die for good even though I knew that an Anime like this would never end like that. Her running to the top of a tower while the building was burning still made me kind of hopeful, because again, that's just a plainly stupid thing to do.


And of course she doesn't die, everybody gets saved and I lost my last three braincells because of this shit. Maybe I am now as braindead as MC. Who knows. 


I will hate the first of August forever now because of this shit. Thank you very much.

Story
I don't want to spoil anything about the anime (or the mystery) so I will just tell that this series follows a young lady and she wakes up and doesn't remember anything or anyone. I think the story was medíocre because it doesn't follow her memories about her real life (something like her parents, her childhood), it just focus on "who da hell is her boyfriend?", but I kinda liked the way she was in a lot of parallel universes, and I didn't like the end of the series, it wasn't like an anime ending, it was like an otome game ending.
5/10
Art
The art was good,it is bright and have a lot of colours, it's like the art of the otome games, but I didn't dislike it at all.\n
6/10\n\n
Sound\n
I didn't like the voice of the Heroine, it was so annoying. But I didn't disliked the soundtrack, I love the opening "Zoetrope", and I like the music in the background, it all kinda fits in the anime.\n
6/10\n\n
Character\n
I didn't like the characters. They just are all like the characters in otome games, there's a "badass" one, a "popular with the girls" one, the "smart" one, the "funny" one and the "mysterious" one. And the Heroine, I know that she has amnesia, but she doesn't have a personality, she can't say 'no', it really is annoying.\n
3/10\n\n
Enjoyment\n
I didn't enjoy it at all. I guess it wasn't that good, but it wasn't so bad that you can't watch this, if you're an otome gamer and you like that stories of reverse harem, I guess you couldn't enjoy this anime.\n
4/10\n\n
Overall\n
I guess it is a 4/10, if you like otome games and reverse harem stories, try it, but if you don't do not watch it.

Thus, another anime that proves that you can NOT compress a VN into 12 episodes.
Story:
Despite the fact that this anime does contain more plot than your average shoujo it still fell short. It did deviate from your average shoujo to some extent: MC is in college instead of high school, it had a bit of mystery, it had (a little bit) more for it going on other than picking the cutest boy, and so on. The problem is that this really isn't the anime's doing, the reason the anime is partially interesting is because it's really just a shadow of its original. It doesn't reallyhelp that the story is similar to Madoka Magica either.


Though the anime may deviate somewhat to normal shoujo anime it also included lots of unnecessary elements. For an anime that promised a high suspense story the Maidcafe felt very out of place; and considering the character's wild outfits I was hoping for some grand supernatural plot. The only supernatural parts about the anime where Orion and [spoiler alert]---time traveling---[spoiler alert]. Finding this out made me very disappointed.


I also found it weird that of all the otome games Brains Base could adapt they pick this one. Unlike in most VNs where the true route has its own thing, for the true route to make sense here you have to go through all of them; did they really think that they could compress that much in 12 episodes? And unlike in a game it's crucial that MC is likable, so why did they pick the game where MC had no real personality to begin with? There's a reason they replaced Red for Ash in Pokemon's anime adaption you know.


Art:

If this anime where as pretty as the game I probably would have bumped up my overall score to 7. The atmosphere of the anime is a bit darker than your average shoujo, but again, this isn't really the anime's doing. I would have also bumped my overall ratings if it at least made up for it in really hot guys; tough they where pretty cute their unnecessary and out of place outfits made it hard to get really into them. In contrast to this I though MC's outfit was really cute. There isn't much to say about the anime's art really.


Sound:

The anime's OP was actually the thing that hyped me about this anime. It had a really kick-ass OP and ED. The anime's OST however is a different story. It's not painfully generic, and I don't hate it either; but the fact that I don't remember too much about it says something. Again, there isn't too much to say about the anime's music either.


Character:

Since this is a reverse harem anime consider this an extension of my story review.

Let's start with MC, she has virtually no real personality. Since the game's heroine had none to begin with they had to conjure one up for the anime, we ended up with a boring, quiet, and kinda stupid heroine.


The boys in the anime felt shallow. In a harem anime, each character having their own 'thing' is expected; but the anime never really explores the boys beyond their 'thing'. This is probably the cause of time constraints.


The worst characters where Shin and Toma. They treated MC like shit, seriously. Why does Japan love them so much?


Overall:

Tough the anime posed some interesting concepts and ideas it ultimately fell short, and is really nothing more than the shadow of its game. Its a very forgettable anime.

Playing otome games and many other games in the past, I have a slight feeling this entire story will be revealed from the dude with the long green hair who looks like N from Pokemon. 
Honestly, I have a love-hate relationship with this anime. The main character who has amnesia, followed by a fairy till episode 2, dates the main guys. Just your usual dating game.
I really love both the art and sound. The art is very colorful and the characters have very interesting character designs. I really love both opening and ending.
Honestly, "Heroine" made me half asleep during the first couple episodes. She talksvery softly and is very quiet, it's difficult to even know what she is saying. Yes, even with subtitles. The eyes of the characters are very interesting though. 3 different eye colors.\n\n
I will finish this show even if I do get sick of it. Find out who she really is and who is that green hair dude and his connection with "Heroine"\n\n
Overall 7

The best aspect about Amnesia is probably the artwork, which is very beautiful, but apart for that the series is unfortunately only reserved for teenage girls wishing they had multiple guys in love with them. The protagonist is like many in soujo animes, only a lot more annoyingly quiet, weak and emotionless. The story does not seem to go anywhere as everyday she has forgotten about the last-so most of the time it feels a bit pointless.. There are the occasional good patches that are unexpected, and a 'baddie' which energizes things a bit. I only kept watching because of the art and being abit of a secret reverse harem sucker as well as the fact it is a short seris, so you 'may as well.' \n
If you want to watch something for a some hot guys, go ahead, other than that its probably best avoided,

When I first heard that Amnesia will have their own Anime, I was really happy since who doesn't want to watch an anime with lots of bishounens?! And the whole amnesia thing the heroine got was kind a legit, who doesnt want to know how she got it or how she'll retrieve her memories back?. I waited for a month to watch this series and then I saw it ----- and was utterly disappointed -___________-
First of all the anime that crushed all my high expectations, bored me to death and confused me . Like who the hell wanna watch something that will confuse them?!. Iknow that all of us had smiles on our faces once we started watching this and then that smile slowly turns into a "comfused-what-the-hell-happened" look then into a frown. From the very beggining of this anime you'll already be confused and somewhat bored




Of course those who waited for this anime will sure be like "yosh!!! Its already airing!!yey!!!" Then it will slowly turn into a " what? What is happening?" Then into a "ohhhhhkay? That explains everything.... I think I now know what happened" then into a "what the hell just happened?! Why?! " and finally into a " kuso! Im done with this anime" that's how confusing this anime is.



Second the characters are "bad". Like who the hell would want a useless heroine? The heroine (she doesn't have a name) is so useless that the only thing she's good at is crying and getting into "accidents". She never disagrees to whatever the people are telling her and she NEVER asks anyone about the stuff thats happening. For her it's only natural to be repeating the same day with somoene else -.- . She just accepts the the whole repeating thing casually -.-




While the guys all have cliche personalities, yes , i know they're hot but their personalites are a no- go -_____-" What do I mean by cliche? Well there's the chick magnet, the guy who befriends and is nice to  everyone, the guy who always looks for logic a.k.a the smart guy, the loner who did something "bad" and finally the mysterious one. 



Cliche isnt it?



Lastly the pacing pf the story is soooo slow, the story is already at episode 10 or something and yet they're still not getting to the whole concept of this anime. It doesnt have a string that ties all of the loose parts together.  The story is so loose that they're like the molecules of gas, not compressed nor intact.




On the bright side, the art is amazing, the way they incorporate the clothes to the character, the characters hair styles and their eyes just look wonderful. Having hot guys will draw lots of fan girls to this anime. They're just so gorgeous but then again those hot guys won't be enough to save this anime from its downfall. 





To tell you the truth, I didn't enjoyed ths at all. I regreted watching and finishing this series hoping that something legit will happen and save this anime from its downfall but nothing happened. 



If you want to make your brain bleed from all the confusion , go ahead ! Try watching this! Try wasting  12 hours of your life into watching this.

WARNING: THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SOME SPOILERS but not really major ones but you have been warned 
Story: 7/10
I thought the story was well done for this kind of anime (although it could've been a lot better). It follows a girl who has lost her memories and time seems to go back to August 1st to a world that she has no memories of of course dating a different guy every time. I don't know if it's just me but I didn't find it confusing at all - it was actually quite predictable. The story itself was much more based on the actual storyline rather thanthe dating and romance side which is unusual for an otome game adaptation. After the first few episodes, I got a grasp of what's happening and that made it fairly easy to predict.\n
Art: 6/10\n
The art was very good and along with the story, is the best point of this anime. What was particularly nice was the character design. (I don't know why but for some reason the eyes were really off in most characters and that annoyed me which is why it isn't 8/10)\n
Sound: 5/10\n
The sound is like the anime overall - it had some good parts and bad parts but was all in all average and nothing really stood out for good or bad reasons\n
Character: 3/10\n
Alright this was the horrible point of this anime - The heroine who is unnamed throughout the series is dull, stupid and naive. Even after repeating the same thing over and over again, she never seems to learn anything and the creatrs seem to have just given up on her halfway. She also never seems to be able to stand up for herself or say 'no' to anyone.\n
Enjoyment: 4/10\n
Now, the enjoyment would've been higher if they had made the heroine better. She seemed to take all the potentially good parts out of it. As the story progressed, it dropped more and more clues (that were obvious in my opinion). Although it was all summed up on the last 2 episodes, I think that only the heroine didn't have any idea of what's going on.\n
Overall: 5/10\n
Overall, this anime is not good or bad and the anime has the same number of bad points as good points.

I am trying to think of the nicest way to put my review, but I find myself stuck on the fact the first episode of Amnesia drew me in, only to have the latter episodes highly disappoint me in the way it was executed. I mean, the art work is great, the plot premise is interesting as are the various characters. However, the more I watched the Anime the more I was reminded of Twilight. 
I'm not saying here that the character is a Mary Sue. She's honestly got enough fatal flaws going on and the scenario is believable. The characters can be related toa lot easier then with the Twilight saga, but the poor pacing was there through the entire thing. I think that honestly was the main thing that killed it for me, the fact that the pacing was horrible. That, and we didn't get to meet the characters as much as we could have.


To much just dragged on and on. There were periods of silence. By that I don't mean no sound, but places where no action happens, nothing happens. Said places could have been filled in with more character development, more hints, but on the flip side there wouldn't have been as much confusion for the plot line. Don't get me wrong here. I'm not saying that the material can't be confusing for the viewer, but you really should wrap it up somewhat towards the end. Of course, the mysterious aspect where you toss things at the various readers can also be one of the hardest to pull off.


I honestly don't think that whoever put the Anime together knew exactly what they were doing. I say Anime and not the otome game because I haven't played it and my review shouldn't be taken as a reflection on the game, though if the game is actually good, it's a major shame the Anime didn't do it any justice and may instead have tarnished its reputation. And no... it being an adaptation off an Otome doesn't excuse the poor pacing either. There were to many things I felt could have been edited and there are good adaptations off Otome.


Then there is the characterization. Don't get me wrong here, I liked the characters a lot. It felt like we barely got to meet them. In a way this is another way that it felt like Twilight. It felt like you were meant to self insert yourself as the main character and feel what she felt as you were going along, but the way the characters were barely touched upon made it feel like... I think the best way to put it is, in an Otome game you are able to make the choices, but in the Anime all the choices were made for you. You weren't able to explore and discover things. It's almost as if they tried to hard to capture the “essence” of an Otome game, forgetting that we're dealing with two different mediums here.


In the long run, I wanted a WHOLE lot more then what I got out of it and I felt the people plotting out the story line did a very bad job, which pretty much took every other persons work, the animators, the sound technicians, the voice actors hard work and pretty much threw it into the trash.

Amnesia is a story about a nameless female protagonist who travels to different worlds in order to recover her lost memories and also to find out more about the people around her and about herself.
In response to what most reviewers who gave Amnesia low scores, I decided to watch it. I wanted to watch it for the reason that I could prove to those people that this deserves at least an average score. 
Sadly, I didn’t feel it myself, too. There was nothing. There was no spark. As I was on episode 3, things started to get messy. I wanted to drop it as soonas possible. Still, I wanted to finish it, hoping to find some good parts. But, to no avail, I just had my hopes crashing down. 


Story: (2/10)

Story? As much as Amnesia has one, just forget about it. It was confusing. For me, all I witnessed was the protagonist’s desire and sickening thirst for almost all the male characters in the story. Imaginatively, if I may add.


One thing that really got to me, to the point of actually wanting to stop myself from watching this, was the cards. It had no connection whatsoever to the story. They added it not knowing it would just mislead the viewers even more, trying to make them think that those cards would make sense in the end. 


Also, as much as I love to solve mysteries, the mystery here isn’t worth solving. I don’t know if it’s because of the story that is out of order, or because it just can’t be solved.


Kento’s part of the story, which for me was probably the best and sweetest part of the whole series, only lasted for one episode. It was disappointing. And just as I was about to start to like it.


And what’s the deal with its ending? Where is the protagonist’s real world? What’s it like? Why the hell would they leave it unseen and unexplained?


Art: (7/10)

Regarding the animation, although it had bad parts where it didn’t feel right, it counterweighed almost all the negative parts of this anime. It didn’t deserve the amazing opening and ending animation it had. 


Sound: (5/10)

The opening theme ‘Zoetrope’ by Nagi Yanagi was good. It really complimented the opening animation. The same goes for the ending theme ‘Recall’ by Ray. And the soundtrack also consisted some good music.


Character: (2/10)

The main character, is very unlikeable, and is not, I repeat, IS NOT compatible with any of the male leads. None of them. There was also no good quality you’ll see from her. I would like to blame her loss of memories for it, but it just made her even less interesting. 


Ukyo. His story kind of reminds me of Homura’s story (from Puella Magi Madoka Magica), where she tries to save Madoka from dying plenty of times, only making her condition even worse. 


A likeable character? Just Kento. 


And lastly, what the deal with Orion anyway? He was useless. He didn’t give enough justice to the series, or even complimented the main protagonist herself. And Lord Neil is no better. Both were practically insignificant.


Enjoyment: (1/10)

With an annoying and infuriating female lead, a bunch of awfully weird-dressed guys, extremely bitchy and horrible female antagonists, non-important side characters, a mystery not worth solving, a story lacking sequence, and an unclear ending, I don’t think the word ‘enjoyment’ could be applied to this anime. Nuffsaid~


Overall: (3/10)

To watch Amnesia is up to a viewer. Don’t judge an anime by its opening theme because as much as that was very appealing, you wouldn’t get the satisfaction you’re after. Amnesia is just another anime ready to be criticized.

Amnesia is what I would call a big and utter disappointment. 
Let´s start with the story: As I began watching the first episodes I have to admit I quite liked it. Mistery was palpable and even though you had no idea of what was going on, the frustration and anticipation you got out of it was very enjoyable. BUT, as the story continued and the romantic interests changed but the "what the hell is going on" feeling didn´t, the enjoyable frustration quickly turned into mere annoyance. Everything happened so fast and so slow at the same time that getting a pleasurable feeling out of itwas almost impossible. 


The art was impeccable, absolutely beautiful and easy on the eye, this is what really made the series worth watching. All of the male main characters were just lovely especially their colorful bright eyes. Outstanding work indeed. 


The main male characters, although predictable, were absolutely to fall in love with; but the Heroine was just a pain! She was the typical oh so innocent type of girl with absolutely nothing to say and with a personality that can be described only as annoying. 


I really believe that the series would have been much better if it hadn´t been so rushed. It honestly had so much potential, but in the end it just let me down. The finale made me feel anything but unsatisfied, more episodes were  fundamental for it to be a great anime. 


Anyways, I didn´t hate it at all, it had its enjoyable parts and I recommend you to watch it in order to form your own opinion, as all things in life, it does have its pros, and if you like really light reverse harem (with almost no romance) you´ll enjoy it. 


Thanks for reading my review, I hope you find it useful. Feel free leave your comments and feedback :)

''What's going on? Where am I? Who.. am I?''
Story 6/10: Our Heroine (currently has no name) wakes up without any memories. She's totally confused and does not know what's going on. Beside her, lays a spirit named Orion. He states that it's his fault that she lost her memories. Orion said that she will travel to different worlds and one of the them will supposedly the ''real'' world. Heroine keeps traveling back to August 1st after a couple of days. And that happens continuously. The storyline is full of mystery, but I feel like the Heroine could of at least try to find out alittle bit about herself... Check her phone for family members.. her ID.. something like that.


Art 9/10: The art is really nice. Their eyes are really beautiful. But I feel like the boys' outfits can be a bit more..hmm, I don't know. I just don't like their outfits designs...


Enjoyment and overall 7/10: The mystery and suspension of this anime is what made me keep watching it. I honestly almost dropped this after the first 2 or 3 episodes. The one thing that I kind of hate is that the Heroine is weak and clueless. She could at least try to find out what's going on, instead of being scared and surprised every time.. But overall, I enjoy this anime. It's not of the best, but good enough for me to continue watching.


If you are a fan of mystery and reverse harem... then this is for you. But if you easily drop anime that are slow plotted and you really hate weak/clueless protagonists.. then I wouldn't recommend this.
