Hello folks~! Gongju Lee here!
I don't express my anime opinions openly usually, but Amnesia is one such anime that I cannot resist the urge to express my experience and thus provide a review of this anime. I'll try to break it down in categories of relevance, like story, art, character development and overall personal enjoyment. So without further ado, let's get started shall we?
~*~*~*~*~*~*~
ART:
It's bloody stunning. Seriously, the BEST thing about Amnesia IS THE ARTWORK. It was the gateway way to making me want to watch the series in the first place. The opening scene alone is just a great big dose of eye candyof bishounen and all the otherworldly "Alice-in-wonderland" card type scenario you can feast on. However, what's more impressive is definitely the interesting character design for the main characters. Each one is uniquely different from the others, but still run in the same card suit-type theme. It's very creative and still useful, because you can use it as a fallback if you have a hard time remembering who is who in this lovely reverse-harem. Also the coloring is BEAUTIFUL! It's definitely one of the consistent contents of Amnesia that I thoroughly enjoyed, episode to episode and was a driving force that kept me watching. I mean, did you guys look into those colorful bishounen's eyes? 



MUSIC:

The opening theme is definitely by far the best thing going for the soundtrack for this anime. I usually pride myself appreciating anime BG music, (i use them to listen as I study or to fall asleep to) but, sadly, the soundtrack to Amnesia is nothing too special. It's not bad by far, but it's not outstanding either. It does have it's share of 'sentimental' and 'emotional' background music that works well with the respective scenes, but for the most part, the soundtrack is forgettable but like I said, the opening theme is definitely a win point.



STORY:

This story is soooooo confusing and soooooo hard to follow. It literally jumps from one moment to the next and the transitions are so choppy, it's difficult to know when you've moved on to another scene or another part of the story all together. And also speaking of story, there's not really much story development going on at ALL for the like 10 episodes! And it's a 12 episode series!! I understand it's a reverse-harem, but it seemed like the focus of the story was more about the heroine trying to recover from her amnesia than with the relationship with the respective guys. And with that said, it should NOT have taken so long to actually develop the "story plot" of the series. I think because it was done in that manner everything was just rushed...and truthfully left you more confused than where you started in the beginning of the series.



CHARACTERS:

Ok. Let me get this out the way. I'm gonna break these characters down as gently and nicely as I can: THEY ARE ONE DIMENSIONAL AS THEY CAN GET.


The Herorine: MY GOD, she could not be any more bland. She's too submissive! She let's the other male guys push her around or boss her around or bloody just does the weirdest worst things to her, and she just takes it like, 'oh, it's okay. as long as you're happy.' It's disgusting. She doesn't think actively for herself to which results to her making way too many stupid decisions. And this woman only has two ranges of emotions: confusion and worry. I know it's based of a visual novel, so I, as a female viewer, am suppose to easily place myself in her shoes and pretend that all those lusty, desirable things the bishounen saying to her are meant for me. However that is simply not good enough. She doesn't really develop over the series and just remains this shy, submissive, emotional-less character that just doesn't make me feel empathy for her or her struggles throughout the series. It's kind of sad.


Shin: He's the tsundere and does tsudere things.


Toma: He's yandere and does yandere things.


Ikki: He's just the playboy who is misunderstood.


Kent: The smart one.


Ukyo: The weird one but weird for an important reason.


That's pretty much how the series played those characters up. The only reason why I reamed the main female character so much, is that she's suppose to be the main character, the one I care most about, but in the end, she's always outshine and out-empathized by the main male suitors around her. The development of their characters, as one dimensional as they are, was just that much more defined to provoke those kind of emotions out of the viewers but unfortunately not for her.

Fortunately, the characters do look pretty, but if you're looking for anything past the cover of those pretty books, you'll be sorely disappointed. The characters of Amnesia, ultimately are: bland and predictable but can provoke a good emotional moments that really holds you in and keeps you around long enough for the next episode.



PERSONAL ENJOYMENT:

As many bad things as I've said about it, I honestly enjoyed watching Amnesia. I think it could have been so much better than what it was. It left me in want because they ended up rushing the development of the story plot to like pretty much the last two episodes, that I wanted to experience more now that I had a better understanding of what the hell was going on. The art was simply BEAUTIFUL. I can't express that enough!! I already saw the art on merchandising and the visual game, and I though that the anime would bring that amazing quality down, but not at all. The anime was able to retain that beautiful artwork in the color and environment. Truly, a captivating sight. However, Amnesia definitely suffered more negatives than positives. The story was lost for ages, the characters were one dimensional, so much so it was almost annoying at one point, and the heroine is completely emotional-less and my issues with that characters are so great I just don't want to talk about her anymore. 



Amnesia is a decent reverse harem, especially one with beautiful art, color and environment, story is pretty much lacking in developing in a timely matter, the pacing is slow and the transitions are hard to follow. But despite the negatives overpowering the good, I still enjoyed it but unfortunately it left me wanting more...in a bad way...which in the end may be worse than not liking it at all.



OVERALL RATING: 5/10


The artwork is BLOODY CAPTIVATING: 3

The on and off emotional moments that capture the viewer: 1

The opening theme song is pretty catchy and saving grace of the OST.

I loved this anime, but I still had a few problems with it. 
For starters, she kept waking up on August 1st and died countless times, along with meeting an odd man with long green hair. It's kinda confusing watching an anime and when you finally understand what's going on, they confuse you all over again. This happened every single time the heroine was switched from dimension to dimension. Then, the last time she switches everything makes sense.  
The characters aren't the best thing either, since their stories change all the time and it's hard to tell who they really are at some pointsin the story. It's a little difficult to understand the plot, but the anime is still a good one, in my opinion.\n

A cliche story but it is the nature of an otome. Like going back from the start to have the route for each husbando or boyfriend. The story is interesting because it is mixed of time travel adventure. The main protagonist & antagonist are traveling to a different world line. I respect people's review why they hate this anime because of the final episode. I think they didn't know some of otome games. You have to analyze why this anime didn't show the chosen route of the heroine. It is made only 12 episodes. Books or mangas tell you the story. Anime series or moviemake you watch it; and Games make you become part of it. If you want to choose a husbando or boyfriend of the heroine, I highly recommend to play Amnesia: Memories game. It has a better story and the length of each story's route is very good than the anime series. And you can choose your final husbando/boyfriend it depends how you answer of each guys in their route. Anyway, I still love this anime series. If you will ask me, I want Kent and Ukyo's route hahahah! I wish to have Waka and Orion's route too LOLZ.

If you are curious about Amnesia plot, please play the game but don't watch the anime.
Is not that bad but its hard to adapt a game of more than 40 hours to 12 episodes of 20min each one. A lot of things are missing and its hard to understand the anime if u don't know about the game.
In conclusion, 
if u want to watch an anime for fun it's not bad, but if u don't like it it's normal because is a bad adaptation... 
If u watched the anime and u liked it play the game bcs u will love Amnesia even more.
And if udon't like it i recommend u to play the game anyway, in my opinion one of the best otome I played.

Amnesia is still ongoing.. So I can't say will the ending be good or not
But for now i wish it had more number of episodes
Because the story is grasping although its a bit confusing at the beginning.
The art and sound are really good 
But the character buildup is a little weak..maybe because of the limited number of episodes
Also..we still don't know the girl's name..which becomes irritating at times
But otherwise it's quite good
And the guys of this anime.... *__*
The story's pace improved after the 5th episode or so..when we know what is actually going on...and now I'm eagerly waiting for the last two episodes
Overall rating 8/10

Amnesia seems like a pretty polarizing anime; so hopefully my perspective will be of some use.
I fully understand why some people don't like this anime.  It might come off as your typical reverse harem girl fantasy.  Although, to be quite frank, there are plenty of far more annoyingly hyper-sexual harem boy fantasies out there. Either way, I understand why the reverse harem aspect causes it to lose some appeal.
Despite that, Amnesia is a genuinely good anime.  Is it the best anime ever? No. Does it have its flaws? Yes. But it is good.
For one, the art in Amnesia is one of itsmost enticing features.  The bright colors and unique fashions really put the viewer in another realm. \n
Furthermore, these male characters aren't flat, one dimensional beings who only exist to fawn after the woman. If anyone is one dimensional, it is the leading lady (she comes off as a little bit lifeless). A major part of the story is discovering the man beyond appearances. These characters are dynamic individuals. They are genuinely interesting.\n
Lastly, I mainly watched this show for its story line, not the cute boys (although, they were a bonus). \n
Every step of this story had me curious and interested.  The viewer may be disoriented at first. The story line is a little confusing as it deals with multi-dimensional travel.  But, that's part of what draws you in. Eventually, when you piece it all together, the whole confusing bit is more than worth while and comes off as a mystery rather than poor story telling.\n\n
Ultimately, Amnesia is a colorful adventure with a relevant message: Remember that every "cute boy" is only human and not everything is as it seems.

I absolutely love this Anime. Being a huge romantic, this show is just mind blowing. I absolutely love how they almost put you the viewer in the shoes of the lead by not giving her a name and always speaking to her as "you". I love all the characters, each one captivating with there own story.
I find the story to be mind numbing in a good way. Trying to figure out what is going on in this story is almost impossible but that's not because the writer failed at making it a good story. Its because the story itself is shrouded in mystery. This animewith transport you to this special world as you go on an adventure to try and figure out what the hell is going on.\n
I recommend this is you want an anime that is unpredictable and keeps you guessing, Full of romance, and a tun of mystery.\n

I haven't liked a shojo anime in a very long time and decided that I should try i out again. I'm very pleased that I watched Amnesia, and researched it before deciding to drop it or not. If you didn't know, this anime is based off of a dating sim video game for the PSP. With that in mind, I felt they did a great job with transitions that are like he video game genre. I felt a times, I was actually playing the game. These ratings are based on the fact that I'm getting back into shojo, as well as how hard it isto go from video game to anime.


Story: 8/10


The concept is clear in the beginning. Introduction to Heroine and how she doesn't remember anything, but as the episodes keeps going, the plot gets muddy and frustrating. I can tell you that I have five theories on why this was happening to her and it kept me watching. Going out of the anime category, I'm a giant fan of Doctor Who and Supernatural, so Amnesia's plot line was beautiful in it's own little way. There were obvious themes that are presented in shojo anime that I've seen hundreds of times, but the complete idea of why all of the cheesey romance is worth it all. The last episode was a bit disappointing and thought it would be interesting if there was an episode for each relationship with a male character. I give it a 8 simply because I didn't feel like it was "finished".



Art: 10/10


The only problem I had that some of the choices of how long the male characters were projected. I tend to like this kind of artistic style with the long arms and legs but I thought a few scenes were a bit too much. It honestly didn't hurt since I give it a 10. I loved the clothing and hair, as well as the backgrounds. I kept looking at how beautiful the pupils were as well. 



Sound: 9/10


The opening song hooked me instantly on episode one. I wasn't expecting to watch more than an episode or two, since the summary of it seemed a bit cheesey. But when the hook started, I was sold. I didn't think of the anime as a shojo frilly anime anymore but as a hardcore rip-your-heart-out tale. The voices are exactly like the ones in the video game, or wikipedia has failed me. Having voice actors for the video game also do the anime is a hard thing to do and I love knowing if I want the game, the voices will all be the same.


Character: 9/10


I decided to give this a 9 because I was waiting for the main character to develop more at the very end. I love how kind she is, even with Toma, although I frown upon her reasoning. The main character is -yes- bland but most dating game heroines are, also, she lost her memories. Memories are the reason why we react to things like we do, and giving us a bland heroine is acceptable, especially in this plot. The males all had obvious tropes. The childhood best friend, the rebel type, the socially inept, and the ladies man. I felt the male characters grew a bit more as "their" episode ended, which only kept me afraid of going to the next one. At the end, I didn't know which one I would "want" our Heroine to stay with and if they included an episode for each relationship/pairing, it would have been fantastic.



Enjoyment: 10/10


I rated this a 10 because it's a breath of fresh air. I don't tend to like anime with cliche tropes but the way this anime built up the ending is worth it. I enjoyed every moment in this anime, up to the very end. 


Overall: 9/10


Overall, I rate Amnesia a 9 for it's obvious trope characters with an interesting plot. I recommend this anime to anyone who likes a bit of timey wimey without an extreme complicated 100+ episode count. It's a fun anime with a whole bunch of feels.

Personally, I'm surprised by the low ratings because this is one of my favorite anime series of all time, next to Kuroshitsuji, Kamisama Hajimemashita, and a few others. I personally don't play otomes, so I don't know the origins of Amnesia.
However, I think this anime is one worth watching because each episode leaves you at a cliffhanger, making you want MORE. People are often irritated because the anime can in fact be confusing until the last few episodes, however I believe this adds to the suspense of the show. Once the pieces fit together near the end of the series, I knew I was definitelygoing to watch this series over and over again. Watching the series before it made sense and watching the series after it makes sense makes the show twice as enjoyable.


Amnesia is a reverse harem with four guys, and each has a few episodes devoted to their romance (although the romance is kept to a minimum, it keeps you wanting more). The show itself is exceptionally mysterious, which personally, I adore in any type of film.


Ratings:


Story: 8 -  I can imagine one can easily get lost if not paying attention.

Art: 10 - The art is outstanding, especially each character's eyes.

Sound: 9 - The quaint music adds to the suspense which I LOVE.

Character: 6 - The only reason this deserved a low rating is because the series was only 12 episodes, so it was hard to develop all of the characters thoroughly, especially in relation to the heroine. Personally, I believe Kent's character was the weakest. If the series had 24 episodes or more, I believe the characters would have been developed much better, and the anime would have thrived more.

Enjoyment: 10 - Once again, it's one of my favorite anime because of its mystery and suspense; you really have to think in order to completely understand what's going on. Additionally, I like having a little light romance. If you're looking for a purely romantic anime this may not be the anime for you.

Overall: 10- I know that I didn't rate every aspect of this anime as a 10, but I honestly believe it is an outstanding masterpiece.


Whether or not you like this anime really just depends on the type of person you are. I like watching shows that have some psychological/mysterious aspect, along with some romance, and that's exactly what Amnesia is.


I'm just beginning to rewatch the series for the third time.

Story : 3
Considering that this anime is based off an otome game, it isn't surprising that the story isn't executed very well. 
 You are instantly introduced to a girl who has no idea what's going on and neither does the viewer. It was a nice concept that could've had more potential - nearing further towards mystery elements than romance, but only near the end. Also, it took me a while to understand what was actually going on.
 It was only until near the latter half of the anime that I understood the concept. Perhaps that was their intention, but it felt quite poor. Maybeit was the fact that the anime was condensed into 12 episodes. For example, world's would shift just after 2 or 3 episodes or so, without going into enough depth about characters and each world gave you little hints -but didn't feel very intriguing. It felt like a missed opportunity to create some golden character development to the cluster of shallow characters in the anime. Although there were some obvious attempts, it felt poorly executed and rarely changed my perceptions of the characters.  And the logic in the anime was so frustrating at times.


Art : 9

Maybe I'm being too generous, but the only reason I watched the anime is for it's soothingly vibrant art style. The colours used were quite pastel-esque but there were some moments where bolder colours were used. Landscapes were quite general at times, however the quality of the art wasn't tainted. Perhaps the characters stood out a bit too much and was over the top - but it's not too much of a hindrance to the anime. However, I noticed that they've overused facets of characters outfits, perhaps to show that they're like all main characters or something, or to follow the card theme throughout the anime? For example,quite a few characters had a checkered patterns on a piece of clothing, lacking originality. This bit is subjective though. You'll know what you think when you see it.


Sound : 8

Once again, perhaps it's originating from my music tastes, but the music not only demonstrated the multitude of emotions throughout the show, but were also so catchy and memorable! (Namely the opening) I still have the opening and ending tune in my head to this day. It helped create scenes which, without decent music I would've probably skipped, although some songs were quite forgettable. Yet again, this is all mostly opinion based.


Character: 4

Despite the lovely sound and art styles, the main character was so dull, and we barely see any of her personality shine through. Her dialogue was monotonous and made her quite forgettable - luckily her character's design was splendid, however I'd prefer if the tables turned, because it was painful to watch the amount of time's she said 'um' etc.  (Except for her shoes, them shoes were lethal)


On the other hand, others may find those character types quite intriguing, so if you enjoy shy characters who aren't very dominant then you will like the protagonist. I have to admit, she's not a bad character, just a boring one.


The guys and practically everyone in the anime had interesting art designs. Perhaps a bit too colourful and mystical, but it was aesthetically pleasing to watch. Then again, clothing and characters are all subjective things, so characters are mainly down to you - however there's barely any depth to the characters in the story. And as soon as you start to become attached to one of them, their arc is over and you rarely see them in much detail again. 


Enjoyment: 6

Depsite it's poorly executed story and monotonous personalities, I got too much enjoyment out of the art style and music. The second half of the anime is much more enjoyable and I understood more of the story. Not once did I skip the opening, and not once did I feel like the music was ridiculously out of place - which is a good thing. The opening is also relevant to the anime, emphasising the mystery feel to it.


Overall: 6


If you're into anime which doesn't go into too much depth, has some patience and enjoys  mystery aspects of anime, with visually pleasing characters, music and landscapes, then this anime is very much for you. (Especially if you are into otome games.)


Even if you don't like it - give it a go. The story isn't anything groundbreaking but it might amuse you how many time's the girl says 'um'. (she doesn't even have a name - I just realised this. Probably because it's based off an otome game)


Thanks!

I was somewhat intrigued with the first few episodes; the whole story had an interesting premise. I quite like stories where you have no idea what is going on and then answers are slowly revealed, but there really wasn't any answers in Amnesia. It was confusing-ness the whole through and then a big info dump in the last episode. It had a really lack luster and unsatisfying ending for me. 
None of the characters but Ukyo had any real depth, but at the same time there wasn't enough time spent on any of the characters for me to really get attached to any of them.\n\n
This anime has gorgeous art, it was very visually beautiful, but the story was a disappointment for me. Overall I didn't really enjoy it very much.

Move over Bachelorette, because Amnesia has something a whole lot better and with a twist! 
Plot/Setting: 
I'm going to say straight up that I was severely confused 90% of the time. But there is a reason behind this, and don't start saying this show sucks because of it. It's quite interesting. Think of this as a third person limited POV or a first person POV story, we are only in one person's head: Heroine, and whatever is happening around her, we'll get the same reaction: confusion. I mean what else do you feel when you get amnesia? We don't understand everything is going on becausewe aren't in the other character's heads. So all of those jumps, plot holes, etc. is all because of being inside Heroine's head. It's jumbled, confused, and very fuzzy. Nothing more. Just think about that when you watch it. 


The setting is a bit strange. The synopsis says fictional place, fiction time, etc. But is it really? There is a sense of realism, but also a dreamscape. It has this Alice in Wonderland feeling too it with the confusion. And leads me to several questions: Was this just a dream? Or a trick of the mind? An illusion? Or is there something deeper going on in Heroine's head. The creator's of this story did a great job putting some sort of mental illusion into the watchers head and making us think of these psychological possibilities. 


Art:


Very colourful. If someone was high, this would be the colours they'd see. The eyes did do it for me. They were strange, unnatural, and just plain disturbing. However, the animation was, as usual, very clear, but seriously can someone please do something about these character's choice in clothing! 


Sound:


The music was fantastic! A very catchy opening and some very good background music. However, the voice of the character's were horrible. I started watching in dubbed and switched over to subbed half-way though because I couldn't take it! And even then, it was still horrible. The voices barely had emotion to them and often were very boring and monotonous. There was no passion in the actors that played them. 


Character:


The characters in this was very interesting, and like I said in the plot, very Alice in Wonderland. Heroine is like Alice, confused and disoriented. But she didn't have a lot of emotion to her. She didn't react to things other people would react to. She was very static. Orion is like the Cheshire Cat. He's there to guide Heroine's way by not telling her everything that will happen. The rest of the male characters ranged from Queen of Hearts to the Mad Hatter. They were all psychos. 


The characters did seem to have hints of several mental illnesses. There was Amnesia (obviously), Schizophrenic psychosis, Multiple Personality Disorder, Obsession Compulsive Disorder, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, and a few more others. This not only created something totally brand new, but it showed what people could act like with these illnesses. Very interesting. 


Enjoyment/Overall:


I'll be in the list of the people who gives this a relatively high rating because I'm thinking out of the box and away from what I saw  obvious in this show. I wasn't all that into it though and found my confusion leading to boredom very quickly. There was no tension, no suspense, and I often found myself predicting what would happen and being right. Everything was too predicable. However, this is based off a  VIDEO GAME, not a manga, so I have to give the creator's credit for doing something a lot of people don't do despite not creating a great plot.  This show is hard to understand and the viewers really have to over think what is going on, what we are seeing, and why we are seeing it through this perspective. What does it all mean? I'm going to say this to everyone who watches it: Be prepared to  get confused. But remember it's all for a reason. 


I give this show a C or a 64% on the what-did-I-just-watch scale.

I love, love, love this anime. It's right up my street and immediately became one of my favorites. The artwork and animation are amazing - not to mention incredibly detailed. During the months of it's airing, I eagerly anticipated each episode as they came.
Oh, and it also has the most EPIC OP song. Love it.
The storyline can seem a little confusing to some - however I don't find this to be the case, as I read a review of the otome game (that the anime was based on) before viewing. It didn't give too much away, but I did have some kind of idea wherethe anime was headed, although the ending was a little surprising... :3


The one small downside I can possibly think of (personally, anyhow) is that the Heroine is very. VERY. QUIET. She isn't exactly your most headstrong heroine in the anime universe. I say give her a chance - she just got *SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER* and now has amnesia, I really think people should give her a break.


I'd class this as a typical reverse-harem shoujo, but it's far from your typical cliché shoujo anime. Guys might like to give it a go - if any of them are into that kind of thing... :/


Overall.


What I liked: Beautiful artwork and animation, five of the hottest anime guys I've ever laid eyes on, gripping entertainment, and an OP I actually sit through without opening another window tab. The series made me both laugh and cry.


What I didn't like: Heroine's inability to REASON.

Heroine doesn't have a name.


~

Tags: Shoujo, fantasy, bishies, psychological


Recommend to: Shoujo, romance, visual-kei, reverse-harem fans

Amnesia.. Something nobody ever wants to come into contact with.
I generally ignore low ratings and watch everything for myself anyway, so I'm glad I did with this too.
Honestly, no, it's not the greatest. But trying to adapt an anime from a game with multiple routes has to be really difficult in a small amount of episodes. But it tried, and that's what matters, right?
Heroine, since we don't find out her true name, faints, and when she wakes up, is being watched, or cared for by Orion.
Toma and Shin, who she assumes are friends of hers, come and pick her up to walk her home.
As themales of the series are introduced along with the female staff members, you notice they're all different. They dress fancy, very individual styling. With really colourful eyes and features on their clothing. It's a nice art style, but it can feel a little out of place at some points with Heroine not being so prominent looking.\n
One thing is for sure, the males are very handsome and easy to swoon over.\n
In each route there is one constant appearance; Ukyo. \n\n
At first, it feels a little dull. There's not much to learn about somebody in the beginning who has no memories. But as it continues, things start triggering small memories.\n
It can get a little monotonous, the routes restarting and Heroine learning about herself, and others. But it does keep some interest.\n
When you get to the end, the flow of the routes changing starts to feel normal and the story is coming together. It's definitely a season where you need to sit through 90% of it until it starts flowing properly and makes it worth watching. \n
The last 2 episodes are what makes the whole season worth it.\n\n
In the end you're left with some questions, which is kind of annoying, but since there's so many possibilities it's understandable.

do NOT watch this anime! now you might be thinking, why would you give a score of 8, to a show that you're telling people not to watch? well let me rephrase that, do not watch this anime UNLESS you've played all five routes of the original game.
 This anime is honestly just meant to be fanservice for those people who have completed the original game, and as such there are a lot of things that you will not understand or enjoy, unless you have played through the game before. the plot of this show is that the heroine starts off in a world thatis more or less the prologue, and through some or other plot device, she beings route jumping from one characters route to another. the way this works is that one minute she could be on Shin's route, then the next minute she "dies" and gets transferred to a new world in which she is on Ikki's path, and so on going from Shin, to Ikki, to Kent, to Toma, then finally ending up at Ukyo. If you've played Ukyo's path before, it explains the whole world transferring thing in more detail, and the circumstances which led to those events, while the anime just gives you a generalization of some of the the key revelations, that you should already know from playing the game. all of the original voice cast from the game reprise their roles for the anime, so that's another treat for those who have played the game. however, this anime has a dub, which is strange because the original game didn't even have English voice acting, only Japanese. the dub is sub par at best anyways, so I highly recommend you stick to subs if your planning to watch this anime.\n\n
 all in all, if your watching this anime after playing the game, I believe you will enjoy it. but if you're going into this anime having no prior knowledge of any of the games routes, you will definitely hate it, as most of the negative reviews on this page with attest to.

That was surprisngly good. I didnt expect much from this anime, I was only after the bishies but twists and the ending is actually better than most "shoujo romance" animes. I haven't played any dating simulation game but this anime gave me a very good "view" into the game. Im actually very interested in playing it now.
In most reverse harem manga/anime, I always tend to have some sort of dissatisfaction regarding the main male character, in this case, Ukyo's sacrifice really touched me and his willingness to endure so much pain and suffering really proved that he has the greatest love for the girl. I'mreally glad that (spoiler alert) he's the main character's true and original bf. Its pretty obvious that the girl will pick Ukyo's world (or at least, thats what it seemed to me), my only wish is to have another episode just to see them happy together and to see how the main character acts when she have her memories with her.\n\n
Though there were boring and dull moments in this anime it had a really nice ending. I think that a decent story, though with stereotype characters, and yet had a good twist and ending, deserves a 7 noh?

Ok first off, the over all consensus in the reviews before this are the heroine sucks. And ya know what, she does, but she's not AS bad as some people made her out to be.
Second, this review is a rating of the anime as a whole for it's genre not necessarily for an anime in and of itself seeing as shounen and shoujo are not the same, I don't know why the rating wouldn't be based on the genre or what the anime is setting itself up as.
And lastly, I've watched the entire thing. Many people who wrote bad reviews didn't watch the full series,so honestly, I'd pay attention to those who've seen it all the way through, because believe it or not, it's more then just hot bishies and a wooden heroine.


Story: 8

The story is mediocre at first, but when you think about it, the idea kinda works. At least for the purposes of an Otome game (in which this series is based off of) it makes more sense then the whole "All these guys love me and I don't know who to chose. Oh darn" and fixes that dilemma in a simple yet kinda brilliant way, again for an Otome game. However this also becomes a little bit of a downfall because of how that plot that allows the simplistic brilliance (again, for an Otome game) drives the MC down to possibly the most boring heroine I've ever encountered. All that aside, I wrote part of this review only watching up to episode 7, but after that ... well the story gets quite a bit better, hence the higher rating. Also,------ Mild Spoiler----

It kind escalates quickly and takes a rather large turn from what you'd expect in an Otome game and/or shoujo anime.


Art: Solid 9

Awesome actually. I know it's a bunch of bishies and a wish fulfillment heroine, but really the art is fantastic for the purpose it fulfills. THE EYES is really all I can say. I love their design, unique, yet still akin to the whole anime style. Each one is totally unique too, both in colors and in design (such as the outline/eyelash styles) I really enjoyed seeing new characters just to see what their eyes looked like. This is not to say it's the best art ever in the history of anime, because it's not, but for the purpose it's designed as, it does the best job of any anime in its class.


Sound: 8

Everyone seems to love the OP but I for some reason liked the ED more. For me, sound is not much of a maker or deal breaker beyond what I hear in the intense or happy or sad (if their are any) scenes in anime. With that, the sound during the show didn't really catch my attention, but it also didn't feel out of place. I mostly didn't notice it. But for what it is, the OP and ED are really pretty awesome in themselves.


Character: 6 and half way through, it goes more to a 7.

This is where the anime falls drastically short. Whether for time constraints or just Otome games in general, the character, specifically of the heroine is totally lacking. To get it out of the way, let's review the Heroine who couldn't be more aptly named. So she's lost her memories and personality decided to jump ship along with it. Given the story line though of HOW she lost her memories, I suppose this could explain why more then her memories went with her. However, when that part of the plot is revealed (pretty early on in the show too) they never say that's also why her personality is that of a wet match trying to light a damp piece of wood. It just doesn't work, nor make sense. That being said however there WERE times she said no, stood up for herself or questioned things. Sure, it's not much, but she wasn't totally submissive when the guys were all up on her, she definitely tried to run or push them away or said no. She's too quiet though and given how everyone says she was before, it's just more proof that her personality for some reason went out the window. Also, just a few small but prominent tripes, what is up with her outift and her hair? She never changes it and honestly it doesn't fit either the lack of personality nor what seemed to be her previous personality. I know some think it's cute, I just think it felt out of place. Especially her hair. Just wear it normally please, why one braid and one rosebud and bangs with shoulder length? That would look stupid in real life and it looks stupid here.

----Mild spoiler alert----

The guys start out having cliche personalities, the mathwiz who views everything as a calculation (we totally never see that in anime) the playful fun but caring guy (I've just never seen that before) the lone wolf and the popular guy. However, this isn't totally what it seems (except the lone wolf, he had about the least character of any of the guys) The popular one actually has some story as to why he's popular and how he also feels about being popular. The math guy is not as cold hearted and as calculating as all characters with the genius trait tend to be, in fact he was probably me favorite and even made me go "Dawww" at times. And his route (how that works is a spoiler, so you can just sit there and be confused as to how that works in the anime) is only one ep long. WTF? Both the popular and the lone wolf guy and the playful guy get 2-3 eps for their routes, why the hell does in my opinion the best guy get the shortest time? That really rustled my jimmies. Meh. The playful guy (who's blonde, because all playful fun people are blonde, right? And no, this isn't a spoiler, because just looking at him and you already know his stereotype) however he's quite a bit more then that if not a little too much more, but since it's anime, you can see why he does what he does as it wouldn't apply in the real world at all to act that way.

I also liked that the manager changed personalities based on the route. His serious face all customers suck one made me LOL. 

Orion was ok, he fit pretty well for what his character was accomplishing

Ukyo makes the plot interesting, I'll leave it at that.

Also ALL the guys have really awesome and intricate outfits that are attractive for the character and pure eye candy. My personal favorites were Kento's and Ukyo's. The girls looked smashing as well. I really liked both Hime's and Sawa's design, outfits and personalities. 


Enjoyment: 7

I actually wanted to find out what was going on in the series, but there were times I wanted to completely forgo it and put it in the "Never finish because it sucks" list here on MAL, mostly because the heroine drove me nuts. STOP FREAKING FALLING. Seriously. However, the plot is actually interesting enough to make you wonder what is going on and I was no exception. Also, the math guy, I kept watching to see his route and he made the entire show more enjoyable just for that (sure, the fact that he believes and understands what is going on with the heroine is farfetched, but I suspended disbelief the minute I saw the popular guy hanging with the heroine. That said, the my enjoyment and interest escalated after episode 9, so if you can stick the series through (which honestly isn't THAT bad or that boring) you're in for a small, but nice treat. The pay off is worth it given what the anime is going for.


Over all: 7-7.5

Over all, it's not too bad of a watch if you're into eye candy, rather interesting/new plot and nice art. Again, this rating is based on what the anime is trying to be and it's really not as bad as others have said, so long as you know that it's shoujo based on an Otome game and has lots of bishies and a plain boring wish-fulfillment heroine who's personality decided to call itself dead, because it killed it. That aside, give it a watch if you like pretty boys and have already seen Ouran High School Host Club (parody/comedy) or Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge (comedy) or Brothers Conflict (srs face) which all deal with great bishies and the reverse harem trope. So in conclusion, despite its glaring flaws, it's honestly not that bad of a show. In fact, the twist kinda made me go "well ... damn! 8O". The ending is a bit rushed, but it seems the entire show was rushed period. At least most everything is explained though, if not all said in about 5 minutes during the last 10 minutes of the episode. Give it a shot, at worst it's mediocre and boring and at best, it's actually rather interesting and fun to watch, if not for just the art or wanting to know what goes on in the plot.

This will be a short Review. This is a terrible anime, when it comes to plot and story line.  Remember this anime was made from a game and they tried to keep the aspect of 'you get to choose' unlike other anime like 'Clannad' that follows one relationship, this tries to put them all together and give you a sort of ... 'I choose my own ending'. The main character is your typical 'RPG' type of character meaning, she has no outstanding qualities. There is nothing special about her and she is rather bland.
 Now the real reason I watched this show is becauseof the art and the style that they drew the 4 (5) boys. I am an art freak, although I can't draw I love good art and will enjoy it no matter what which is why I am 'okay' with giving this anime a 6 instead of the 2 it deserves. The art details the eyes to pop out at you as well as their hair that changes at the tips to their clothing which has never been seen before. 


Don't watch this show if you are looking for a great story line, this is just an anime for you to literally enjoy the looks of the 4 (5) boys in the show, they give little description about each character but I made it work and liked the guys. 


In conclusion don't watch it for the story, watch it for the art.

At first I thought I was going to like this anime. After watching the first episode, I thought the show had potential - I mean the premise was interesting after all. I wanted to know more about the Heroine and Orion. More importantly, I desperately wanted to find out what happened prior to August 1st. Did I get to find any of that out? No. Well, I did in the end, but the ride to get there was anything but enjoyable. 
Now I understand that Amnesia is an adaptation of an Otome game. The format for these games are as follows: you are presented withmultiple love interests, you pick one route, you complete the route, and you move on to another route. That's essentially like Amnesia, expect shorter, uninspiring, and frustrating.


The pacing of the series felt rushed, but jarringly slow at the same time. What do I mean by that? 


Well, the Heroine only spends a short amount of time with each guy. Most of that time consists of trying to find out who her current boyfriend is and what she must do to pretend that nothing is wrong. There is little opportunity for the Heroine and any of the male leads to connect, and if there was it felt shallow and fulfilling. Each boyfriend the Heroine had was unmemorable. I can't remember any of their names for the life of me. That's not a good sign. The only thing those guys had going for them was their character design, which was comprised of mismatched articles of clothing, patterns, and colors. Once a key event has happened in a route, the episode ends. Seriously. Each episode has a cliffhanger, and the viewer is just left there with so many unanswered questions. In addition, the following episodes does little to answer those questions. When you think you've pieced some pieces of the story together, it all just comes to grinding halt. You are back at square one. All of a sudden, most of what you learned a few episodes ago did not matter and in fact had no significance to the overall plot and its conclusion. This lack of overall plot development is what I meant by jarringly slow. It's so slow it's like nothing happened.


On to character development.


There was little character development with the Heroine. She showed little motivation to seek the truth and would have probably done nothing if it wasn't for another character guiding, pushing, or influencing her to do something. She only redeems herself somewhat towards the end when she displays some sort of free will. Usually the protagonists in VNs have don't have too much character and/or back story. This is so that the player can live vicariously through the protagonist. When adapting a VN into an anime however, the protagonist needs to have substance. It's really hard to cheer on a character you don't care much for, or worse, are ticked off at.


I guess the Heroine and I are suffering from Amnesia. We both don't know what's going on most of the time, but we just go with the flow in hopes that somehow this story will end.

This was one of the first animes I've watched and I regret even laying my eyes on it. It totally ruined my appetite for anime for awhile.
Story; 2; A teenage girl who loses her memories and even her own name. All while trying to regain her memories, boys flock to her and try to make her swoon over them. The whole amnesia card is cliche anyways but the way the story was put together was dreadful. 
Art; 5; Alright, I'll give credit to this anime for having somewhat average art. I believe this is what caught my eye in the first place. Not an spectacularartstyle, nor a terrible one.


Sound; 2; I really didn't like the opening and closing theme songs at all. Not my type of music taste.


Character; 1; This is what killed this anime. The main heroine was pathetic. She legit had the same lines throughout the whole episodes. The way she acted and spoke could drive anyone nuts. The boys were generic. No one stood out in a good way.


Enjoyment and Overall; 2; I'm not rating it a one due to the art and that it's not the worst anime I've watched. There is a few animes that could totally make Amnesia look somewhat alright. But, if you're looking for an anime to watch, please don't watch this horror.

I am someone who has played the source material, the otome visual novel, first. I thought that it was absolutely amazing which is why I had very high expectations going into the anime. However, the low rating and episode count on MAL concerned me, since I knew a majority of otome visual novel adaptations fail to be good due to the studio trying to condense 40+ hours of gameplay into a short episode count. Amnesia, sadly, did this mistake. 
Story: 
The story sounds quite interesting at first, being an anime about a woman regaining her memories and uncovering the mysteries of her circumstances. The genresalso intrigued me, being josei, mystery, romance, and fantasy. Sadly, it seems the anime didn't know what to do with its plot. It initially wants to be a tale of uncovering the heroine's memories (yes she has no name) but she doesn't really uncover ANYTHING...? She occasionally gets a fragment but most of the time it doesn't do anything to progress the plot. Another thing is that alternate worlds exist in the anime, with the heroine being a certain character's girlfriend in each different world, but unlike in the visual novel, it's never explains the importance of these worlds (I will not spoil the reason they are important since it's actually very important in the game and I'm trying to keep this spoiler free). Furthermore, it seemed the anime wanted to push the "romance" aspect as its main focus but it ultimately fails in this. This is because when the heroine supposedly "falls in love" with a character in one world and gets transferred to another world and then "falls in love" with someone else the love never seems genuine, especially since she seems to remember events that happened in previous worlds (which does not happen in the game). The pacing is also absolutely terrible and the story is just confusing because it doesn't know what it wants to focus on.


Characters:

Compared to the game, the characters were just... bland in the anime. In the visual novel, since there are multiple endings and routes, each character's pasts and personality traits are further explained and have more depth. However, in the anime, all the characters fall into typical tropes and have nothing special to them whatsoever other than their character designs. Toma is your typical nice and caring type. Shin is just a tsundere, Kent is a calculating and glasses wearing ikemen, and Ikki is a playboy. Ukyo, another bachelor for the heroine, was just a train wreck. He is supposedly the "cannon" interest and acts as an antagonist for the duration of the anime but his motives are never clearly explored. Ukyo is seen to have two personalities but the anime never explains why, which, again, is explained in the visual novel. Many of the plot holes involving the characters or the story are always explained in the visual novel, but as an anime, it shouldn't have to make the viewers confused and need to play the game just to find answers. Adding on, all of the love interests have only like 1-2 episodes dedicated to them, which gives me no attachment to them and know absolutely nothing about their characters to make me love them. Don't even get me started on the Amnesia heroine, she is a legit doormat and is there for the sake of self-insert. Heck, she doesn't even have a cannon name. Characters in the anime always refer to her as "you" which is pretty awkward. The heroine in the anime just lets the guys do whatever they want to her and her only lines of dialogue are lines such as "um" or "ah." In the visual novel the heroine has some defining traits to her depending on the dimension she is in which makes her more interesting, an example being when she has a love for music in the heart world and is a great singer. Did I forget anyone in this anime? OH WAIT! The side characters! Completely forgettable. Sawa, Rika, Waka,Mine, and Orion only appear very few times and when I ask people if they remember any other character other than the main ones in the anime most of the time no one remembers them. Orion is supposed to guide the heroine and help her regain her memories but a lot of the times he doesn't even show up in the anime. He keeps disappearing, for again, another reason that is never explained (and it doesn't even happen in the game).


Art: 

The art was one of the only redeeming aspects of this anime. I am not an animation specialist so I cannot nitpick anything too major, but in just the eyes of an average watcher, I found the animation to be pleasing. Brain's Base did a wonderful job with the backgrounds and interpretation of Hanamura Mei's art style and I found the eye candy to be great. It was in no means perfect, but I still loved the animation.


Sound: 

Amnesia's opening theme was outstandingly good! I found the music to be catchy, and when I first watched it I was excited for the contents of the anime (to my later disappointment). Ending was also pretty good and was fitting for the ending of an episode but not quite as memorable as the opening. The background music and other soundtrack weren't quite as memorable but was pleasing to hear. Overall, sound was pretty great.


My ending thoughts? If you want to see some handsome bishounen then go ahead and watch, I won't judge. But if you want a riveting story then pass this anime and just play the visual novel. I said this a lot, but compared to the anime the visual novel is just better, character and story wise. This anime adaptation was an absolute mess, and I just hope for better otome game anime in the future.

☆This is a spoiler-free review☆
Amnesia was an interesting watch. 
To really grasp the concept of what Amnesia is about, you first have to know where it comes from-originally, the story was developed from an otome game, or dating simulator. The main character of Amnesia, otherwise known as Heroine, is the focus of both the game and anime. 
Story [8]
Amnesia had interesting concept for story; a girl with-you guessed it!-amnesia is lost and confused, and goes through multiple versions of her life, trying to figure out which one is real, which boy she belongs with, and which reality she can live in for the longest,with only a fairy named Orion to help her along the way. 


Art [9]


The art, in my opinion, was positively beautiful. I loved the vibrant colors and playing cards theme, and how it all tied together to its roots as a game.


Sound [8]


The soundtrack was pleasant to listen to, and the opening song becomes catchy after a while. Voice-acting was fine, nothing shabby.


Character [7]


While, admittedly, each character was slightly bland (with only a slight bit of deeper character traits) and very obviously based off of a dating simulator's stereotypical selection of boys, it does have the Heroine develop a bit throughout the plot and throws a good twist in the end. 


Enjoyment [8], Overall [8]


Overall, if you're okay with pretty bishi boys and romance, this anime may be something that you can enjoy and experience through all twelve episodes (plus the otome game!).

Okay... I'm going to make TWO review parts based on two things. 1st review for those who HAVEN'T played the otome game, but want to see the anime. 2nd part for those who HAVE played the otome game, but haven't seen the anime yet.
(1st -For people getting into the anime without the knowledge of the Otome)
Okay, here's the deal. I watched Amnesia before I played the otome game and that was a while ago, so my views on this part might be a bit cloudy, but let me just tell you this... most of you... are going to be VERY confused with the plot. Thepremise itself is simple, you got a girl with amnesia, who doesn't know whats happening in her life or her own name (you won't get to know her name).


However, the actual confusing part will be that she will end up in different parallel/alternate worlds. This anime being a reverse harem, the story will revolve around her coming to know a love interest in each world with a different scenario to face. The heroine just goes about this all, not really being too alarmed by the fact that not only does she have amnesia, but she's world-hopping also. The heroine herself is somewhat monotone, rarely talks, and will lack a personality. I know some people HATE this in a MC, but this was done purposely to keep the Heroine like a blank canvas for the viewers to easily paint her as something they want or even picture themselves as her. 


Anyway, the Heroine doesn't go through this all alone, she'll have a young spirit guide to help her. But to be honest, besides telling the Heroine of her situation at the start, he provides zero help. He isn't seen by others, he can't even touch her or anything else around him and is mostly there for moral support... or be the shotacon of the series... xD


But talking about characters now, in each world, the heroine is paired up with one guy.


You'll see some harem tropes, especially character wise.


We have a tsundere who is a calm silent type.


We have the hot and everyone adores type.


We have the smart and cool type.


We have a big brother type.


Then we have... a "mysterious" type.


Like the MC characterization, some will be put off by some of these tropes. However, when the main character dives into each of these worlds and gets to know each guy, you'll see that each guy has a problem/scenario that you normally don't see with these kinds of characters. Some might actually surprise you.


By the end of the anime, some of you will be scratching your heads or cupping your chin theorizing what this all meant in conclusion. For me, overall my enjoyment of this anime was mixed, most downsides being that I was so confused that it prompted me to actually play the otome game to see if it would answer some burning questions I had. But the anime did have me glued to the screen in interest. I really fell in love with some of the characters and was actually upset when the Heroine jumped the next world, leaving the said character behind. So don't get too attached.



(2nd -For otome players wondering if this anime is worth the watch)' *DON'T READ THIS PART IF YOU HAVEN'T PLAYED THE GAME. POSSIBLE SPOILERS!*


After I played the otome, a lot of things became a lot clearer that's for sure. However, I've noticed things in comparison in the anime.


The anime adds and doesn't include certain things.


With the 'adding' thing, the anime basically added plot and scenarios that don't hold true to the game. In the game, you don't swap worlds with your Heroine having the knowledge that she swaps worlds, only you as the player know this. In the anime, she ACTUALLY knows about the different worlds and casually goes through the 'get to know the guys process' without considering her past worlds and associations, despite the fact she knows of them. She basically, in a way, has as much knowledge about this as Ukyo does, excluding some facts.


Orion isn't with the Heroine 100% of the time like he is in the game. Orion will disappear and reappear at random times, leaving the Heroine alone in different situations. 


The anime will have a favoritism towards certain love-interests. I'm just going to flat out tell you now, that any Kent fans will most likely be disappointed. Speaking of the love interests, all of them will have their same voice actors, so you'll feel right at home about that.


The story progression and plot... well... since this all is in a span of 12 episodes, you see very different things in each world in the anime. Some will end abruptly, some will keep the same premise as the game's stories but end on a different note. You won't get a lot of time with the characters, and the story goes at a fast pace, to squish in as much of the game's story into a 12 episode anime. As a result, things will come off... differently. 


So basically, to any of you who played the game, but haven't seen the anime, expect a number of changes. Some of you may not care about this, some you may be irked about it. Personally, if you are a big fan of the game and fandom overall, I'd say go for it and watch the anime. However, if you are not adapt to change, then maybe the anime isn't for you.

This show - based on the otome game - is about an unnamed girl (indirectly known as Heroine) and her journey through different universes where she is dating a new guy in each after she "dies" in the last universe. 
The anime itself was amazing and I loved the originality in it. The art style of the character's eyes and hair was absolutely beautiful. If you're slow to catch onto plot, this anime may be difficult for you to watch. I had no idea what on earth was going on until it was thoroughly explained (halfway through the show), and while I like mystery andslight confusion, I did NOT enjoy being this confused. 


As for the characters, there just wasn't enough development. Heroine spent about 2-3 episodes with each guy before dying and moving onto the next one, so it was hard to get attached to anyone before they were cast away.


Like most anime I've seen (especially the romance ones), the show ended very abruptly with no clear vision on how the characters were going to live their lives after the show ended. That to me is a major let down, and always one of the major reasons the show gets the rating that I give it.

I feel like everyone who reviewed negatively missed the real point of the anime. 
This anime is clearly reverse harem, but to me the romance factor of this anime and her having multiple different boyfriends is secondary to the true plot: the multiverse theory.
If you go into this for the romance plot, it's no wonder you're disappointed, but however, to me that's secondary because it's not just a cliche romance-only anime. It's also got fantasy and a bit of science-fiction because it's an anime that surrounds the multiverse theory. 
The multiverse factor is mentioned pretty early on in the series by Orion, so I don'tunderstand how it's not understood that that's the main focal point of the story: how and why this girl keeps going back to the same day over and over again without any memories of what happened before then. The mystery that surrounds this is definitely what makes this series so interesting. 


It's not about the fact that she has multiple different boyfriends, it's about how and why she seemingly does. And the reason why she does and is seemingly stuck in a loop but with different guys in different worlds isn't truly revealed until later on. 


It can move a little slow, but I think that's because she was instructed by Orion to, at first, not say anything to anyone, but in each world they figure it out on their own that something isn't right. 


The girl isn't even a bad character, she's doing her best by trying to figure out what's happening to her and why with very little guidance. Show some compassion, people. Anyone with continuous amnesia, especially in these circumstances, is going to move a little slowly and be confused, awkward, and scared. And she definitely has character growth by the end. 


There's a wah wah part in episode 9, but other than that, I think the personalities of the guys (even throughout the multiple worlds) are pretty considerate. 


The overall explanation of what and why the stuff that happened happened, comes in the last two episodes, and it honestly ends up being pretty sad. 


In that case, I enjoyed it and would love to watch more mystery multiverse animes.

I guess my review is a little bias since I am utterly obsessed with this otome game when it was released. YES this anime was based on an otome game where you play the main heroine and you get to choose a guy's route, win his heart and live happily ever after with him.
With that said, this show is definitely not for everyone and if you have not played the game I doubt you will understand this anime nor even continue to watch it because it'll just get confusing as each episode progresses. Also, I believe this anime was adopted mainly as a game franchiseto satisfy its overwhelming fans. 


Alright so MC character is supposed to be you. They didn't gave her a name in the show because in the game the person playing it names the MC as herself. I noticed some reviews were complaining about this, and although it is a little frustrating this is just how most otome games are. Deal with it. 


The Plot is a helluva topsy turvy wtf moments but again, if you play the game, it all makes sense. I respect that they followed almost every single thing that happened in the game in each guy's route. In the game the MC is definitely bland and doesn't talk much, it's because Orion does most of the thinking for her, and her dialogue are mostly choices you pick on how to respond to the guy youre playing. It is definitely interesting how they put together all the scenes that are exactly on each of the game's route so I do commend the animators for that.


Music was great, the intro and the bg music are fantastic, even Ukyo's theme got me mesmerized. All the characters are on point and I'm glad they used the same voice actors as the ones they have in the game.


My only gripe is that they did almost two episodes for each of the guys except Kent, which only has one! where is justice on that?! and they sort of cut Orion in most of the scenes. It could have been better if he's with the MC most of the time to avoid the annoying blandness on MC's reaction each time she goes to another parallel world and restarts her amnesia.


OKAY SO OVERALL, I definitely enjoyed this show only because I played the game and enjoyed the game to heart. BUT IF YOU ARE NOT AN AMNESIA GAME OTOME FAN, this is probably not for you or you would probably hate this so much your eyebrows will unify to one. It's confusing af so for better viewing I recommend playing the game first before indulging on the show. ^^

This started so well, why did it end up like this?
As you can tell, my scores for this series are very fluctuating, and for a variety of reasons. To begin with, I only started watching this series years ago because my friend said that she watched a few episodes a while ago and that they were good. At the time, I watched whatever she watched, so I watched an episode. I got bored of it and put it on hold for later. Now, years later, I came back to it because I simply can't deal with dropping or putting shows on hold. Consider it acharacter flaw. Either way, I came back to it without very high hopes. 


I am a major fangirl, so it's no surprise that I play otome games. From popular ones like My Candy Love and Eldarya to ones nobody has heard of buried in someone's Deviant Art or the App Store, I've played so many that anything otome barely surprises me anymore, so I suppose I thought I was ready for this. Despite my otome addiction, until recently, most of my anime choices were considerably shonen, but I suppose that despite my love for gore and mystery and action, somewhere in the midst of it, I didn't get my fix of romance, so I found myself here. 


The story was alright, I suppose. It starts off pretty interesting, but as it goes on, it just gradually gets worse. (SPOILER ALERT) Around about episode 9-ish, I really stopped enjoying the show. It started to drag on. And Toma? And the fucking cage? What the actual fuck? Why wasn't the heroine reacting at all? Why was she acting like a lifeless doll? Why was she trying to embrace Toma afterwards? How does she not feel anger towards him at all? I was pretty pissed about the handling of that.  At first, I was super excited because none of the arcs had turned this dark. Shin’s arc had been the typical bad boy x his childhood friend arc where we was trying to be ‘nicer’ and all that shit. Ikki’s had been the typical playboy x girl who doesn’t fall for him right away. Kento, on the other hand, was completely different from the others, and not even that cliche. I was excited for Toma’s, expecially since he’d seemed to be so nice in the first episode. 



The whole cage and drugs deal was definetly frightening, but it added some dark color to the anime, so I didn’t mind it very much and thought it interesting, but by the time it got to the heroine FORGIVING Toma for all that shit and saying she was in love with him? Claiming that he’d done all of that to ‘protect her’? And he went as far as to threaten to rape her, said that he’d ignore her pain, but she just pushes all that aside and confesses her love for him? 


In addition to this, they later show some semblance of days passing, but since the heroine looks the exact same and everyone wears the exact same clothes every single day, it’s impossible to tell the difference. 


The last few episodes take on an ‘Another’ feel, with the main character trying to avoid her death at all means possible, but knowing her survival will kill Ukyo. I find that while this plot could’ve been interesting, it’s completely dulled by the fact that she’s completely unlovable and she makes so many stupid decisions and falls in love so easily that should already be dead. 


However, I really liked the art. I had a problem with the outfits. While most of the characters were stunning, the way they were presented made it hard to take them seriously. They were dressed like circus performers, opposed to all the other people in the background who looked normal. Also, can I point out that the heroine has terrible fashion sense?


As for the sound, the music is phenomenal (the opening and closing themes) so I’m willing to forgive some of the shitty voice acting and the unfitting background music sometimes. 


The characters, however, I can't forgive. Putting aside the cliches of most of the guys (I'm willing to exclude Kento and Ukyo because they're at least a little different, and as much as I hate to admit it, Toma is too, he's just a stereotypical rapist and stalker) the heroine was terrible. I thought I was prepared since I was so into otomes and shojos, but by god I wasn't. The heroine’s entire dialogues are comprised of 90% “uh”, “what”, “huh”, “yeah”, and “okay”.


On top of this, she was just STUPID. Even in episode 11, after explicitly being told “dont trust me” and “dont go near the shrine” by Ukyo and suffering at the hands of his split personality, the stupid heroine goes ahead and meets him anyways, after which he tries to throw her in the well and she doesn’t even struggle but instead just stands still like a doll. 


I also had a problem with how terrible and awkward the dialogue was. 


For example: “You talked to the manager about photography. Do you take a lot of pictures?” 

“Yeah. You better believe it. I take a lot.” is the response in monotone. 


Even worse: “...I’m your true love.”

 Pause. Heroine looks up. “Ukyo… you’re my boyfriend?” 


I'm not sure what strikes me as so terrible about these dialogues, but they honestly made me cringe. 


When I started this series, I honestly didn't understand why the ratings were so low. I had started off and even gotten to about episode 6 expecting to give the show about a rating of a 6 or 7, but as soon as it hit Toma and Ukyo's arc, it was all I could do to not give it the lowest score possible.


All in all, I would recommend this if: you like otome games, you don't mind a bland heroine, you're the type of person who doesn't like committing to loving one fictional guy, you want to try out different stereotypical guys, you want all the guys to be attracted to you, you want to watch an anime where you can just insert yourself into the story, you like bright colors and death and psychological twists 


I would NOT recommend this if: you are looking for a heroine with substance, you wanted a finality in the ending, you are looking for something to be obsessed with, you want a developing love story, you want any character development at all. 


Hope you have a great day everyone!

I'm starting to watch this just because I am pretty much masochist and I was looking for another plotless anime just like Diabolik Lovers, an anime where there's no reason why in actions and speechs but just sexual harassment, with a girl defenceless and stuck in a reverse harem. 
I was listening to the opening and then I saw the scene where all the boys kiss her and I understood: it's a sort of the Diabolik Lovers 3 I was dreaming of!!
Being masochist is something you regret at one point in life, but if you have some spare time and you're looking for plotless animethis seems good (and plotless, worthless and in a word: horrible).

This review will include spoilers!
I'll admit, Reverse Harem anime's are my guilty pleasure and every so often I watch one on a whim and I usually walk away feeling disappointed, both in the show and in myself but sometimes the feelings I'm left with are anger and disgust. 
Amnesia is the latter. So let's break this down. 
Story: 3/10 
The story is honestly one of the more disappointing aspects of this show. The premise is interesting and the caveat of the protagonist having to try and figure out which new timeline she's in in order to avoid completely messing everything up is probably better utilizedin the original game as here it simply results in her looking confused 90% of the time and being totally useless the other 10 percent. 


None of the individual time lines are fleshed out before the protagonist invariably finds herself near death and in a new universe again. 


There are many much better Time Travel/Alternate Universe hopping anime out there. 


There was only really one relationship covered in the show that felt rewarding or good at all and it ends well before it reaches any sort of satisfying... well anything. 



Art: 6/10 


The Art is pretty but nothing to write home about, the boys are inevitably attractive enough. Really nothing to report here. The only aspect that stands out at all is that the female protagonist's design is at least marginally different from most generic otome game girls. 


Sound: 6/10 


Again nothing to write home about, honestly I don't remember much of anything about the music or sound design, which can only mean it wasn't horrible enough to warrant remembering. 


Character: 1/10 


The characters are bad, worse than usual reverse harem fair. Our protagonist is generic, has no personality so you can project yourself onto her, reverse Harem girl. A trope I wish, quite frankly would die. She's also useless, helpless and probably going to die by stupidity. 


The main boys are, frankly, horrible. Only one of them (Kent) seemed to care at all about what the protagonist wanted and was willing to work with her to better their relationship and his is the shortest story line. 


The least offensive of the remaining boys are boring at best, and irritating at worst. They include a boy with a fan club that he just lets harass main girl, in Ikki and Shin who is a childhood friend and is protective but mostly leaves our protagonist to her own devices to die by literally everything. (Unlike his older brother whom I will touch on in a moment.)


The other two are, well, abusive. This is a trope I see gaining lots of traction in Reverse Harem/Otome game animes and it's frankly angering and very very terrifying. These boys are never called out on it and indeed garner their own fanbases. 



Toma (Shin's older brother) Literally locks our protagonist in a cage, against her will, for her protection. But not before he drugs her into sleeping for two weeks straight. AND THE PROTAGONIST IS A-OKAY WITH ALL OF THIS! 


Ukyo is the last of the potential love interests and unfortunately the one the anime tries to convince us is the best choice in boyfriend. Ukyo suffers from split personality disorder, that he gave himself, by dying multiple times over trying to save our protagonist. This second personality tries to kill our protagonist at literally every turn. Which is (warning, incoming sarcasm) soooo romantic. 


Orion is the only remotely interesting character and he gets sidelined so often  the show just gives up on ever doing anything with him. 



In summary: Amnesia is bad, it's worse than bad, it's disgusting, pro-abuse, and definitely harmful to young girls. The only thing it made me feel for any of the boys is how much I wish the anime was about her and Kent only. 


Skip it, and for the love of god, don't glorify Toma!

P R E M I S E
To begin with, Amnesia is an anime adaption to the otome game series of the same name. I love fantasy stories that include cards and their symbols, Wonderland-esque appeal, and the surreal feeling of wonder and mystery. However, having it come from an otome game, you must expect that the anime won't have the heroine romantically paired with any of the number of guys featured. Anime adaptions to otome games also normally have a "main guy" that is more leaned towards him, and there is one in this anime as well. 
A few years ago, I was obsessed withreverse harems because I loved the designs and art most of the time. Plot-wise, they're usually not very good, but great seiyuus are attracted to reverse-harem anime like they're magnets. The OP and EDs are a lot of the time top-notch. If looked at in this light, Amnesia fits into the typical reverse harem you'll find and expect. I've watched this anime twice, the second time dubbed, and I'll have to say that the dubbed version is better because the protagonist has more of a realistic personality.


S H O R T C O M I N G S

What I dislike about the Amnesia series as a whole is the heroine. Yes, the heroine. For one thing, she doesn't even have a name, and the whole time the supporting characters don't mention her name once. Not in the anime, and not in the games. It's absolutely ridiculous - and on top of that, "Heroine" has a personality equivalent to a wall. Well, maybe you'd expect that, considering that she's lost her memory in the beginning. But she's just nonsensical - how? Whatever she's whisked into, she just GOES with it. She doesn't resist to a single thing, seemingly, and doesn't question things like she should. Granted, in the English dub, her personality is slightly more bearable, as she almost is a different person with the lines she says and the questions she actually asks. However, I love the Japanese voices for the guys, so neither version is perfect, unfortunately. The animation is also choppy, something that can be expected from a reverse harem. The guys aren't very appealing to me, except for two of them, and sadly 12 episodes isn't enough to get me attached, as Heroine moves onto another world before I can get to know each guy better (you'll understand what I mean better if you watch it). Though, I'm very used to this by now.


P R O S

As for practically every other reverse harem, the art is visually appealing. The OP and ED are very fitting and nice too; it feeds you with a dose of mystery, like you're immersing yourself, and it gets you into the mood enough to put up with the crap afterwards. Perhaps if you're used to otome game anime adaptions, Amnesia wouldn't be that disappointing story-wise, as it's rather interesting. It's not set in a school, and it's like fantasy fell onto reality. The color choices are colorful, and the character designs are detailed and beautiful.


C L O S U R E

I apologize if I sounded like I was ranting in the "shortcomings," but I forgot to mention something else about Amnesia that could go in that section. Plot-wise, it took me two rounds of watching this series for me to truly understand what was happening. The first time... I don't think I understood a thing of what was happening. It was the second time - and it had to be in dub - then did I comprehend that whenever the Heroine died she was transported to a parallel world and such, which explained the changes in situation and some characters' personalities. Don't worry, that's not really a spoiler; it's better if you have that knowledge before watching if you plan to.

Enjoyment: 6/10

Overall: 31/50 ~ 62% ~ 6/10
