Amnesia: the Dark Descent. No? Wait, wait... wrong title! Amnesia, the... no, just Amnesia! Sorry, sorry... Seems like I want this anime so desperately to be something more, than what it actually is, that I've started to mix the titles together! My bad... let's start over again, shall we?
Girl has an amnesia. She doesn't remember a thing about herself or anything even slighty interesting about anything, but thank god she knows how to use a bathroom! She has this reverse harem-thing going on, and in every episode, we get a whole new "love"scenario with another unattractive bonesack-of-a-man, until the thrillingtale of "a brat that barely said a word", can finally ravel itself into a one, final deciossion, of which guy does she hate the least to love! Be just as excited as a dog that's about to get his balls cut off, to whitnes minute after a minute of this god-awful mess, that even a twelve-year-old would write... possibly even more succesfully, than this!


Since this is - yet again - a review of an anime, that I obviously digest, I guess I'm supposed to be all butthurt, and angry, for wasting my time into this. Surprisingly... I'm not. I was given some great reviews over this anime, and granded, the start was overaly decent - not great, but decent enough, for a reverse-harem. This one wasn't so overly and disgustingly hyped and dripping of fanboy-goo - like so many other titles out there - so I wasn't really expecting anything special, and guess what... lucky me, because I wans't disapointed! This anime has absolutily nothing else to offer, but some pretty colors, nice animation, and overal decent music... nothing else!


I guess I'm really not supposed to review somehing, that I dropped, since I haven't actually seen the story itself whole way through - that's actually one of my most important rules, to be honest! But, since that mold was already broken with Dragon Balls, I really shouldn't beat myself over for it too much, now should I? 


The story - if you can even call it for one - is very straightforward and bland. Nothing stands out, and all is like this disgustingly gray, shapeless mess! Same can be said for the characters. They're all this weird, strange-looking variety of seemingly good-looking males, and this one, blander-than-bland- heroine, who's supposed to be everyones one-sided love-interest... because she has a amnesia, and can't remenber, who she bones, if any of them - they all seem to be some sort of deviants or rapist, which as in a fetish-stand-point, isn't really my cup of tea. Also, she seems to be really keen to be pinned down against a trees, walls, or overaly harassed, in the most sweet and innocent ways possible, because... hey, she's a girl, and girls like that sort of things, right? Right?!


This anime, is a perfect example for an so-called "airballoon-anime". It's nice to look at, and that may be more than enough for some, but once you realize, that what keeps this anime together, is just some hot air, you'll loose your interest very quikly, and like me, dropped it, or just... let it go. No matter, how you look at this anime, there's really not much to look at. The heroine is just some pretty-looking, shallow puppet, with no personality, nor anything to say - she can't form even one single sentence, without some umm's and ahm's - and the harem of these "hotties", are just as bland as you would expect of them to be... and not even that good-looking, for that matter! I personally can't stand this japanese stereotype for a hot guy, who looks like a girl and who's thigh is as thick as my arm, but when you're a leading girl, who herself has absolutily nothing else to offer, but some nice-looking, passive yet fragile object for any of their rapefantasies, I guess beggers can't be choosers. In the end, there's really nothing more important for a boy, than be this cold yet cool, antisocial jerk, who pins me down against anything standing against my back, or a girl to be this passive, submissive puppet, without any other merits, than looking pretty, now is there - according to a this anime, anyway!


I really don't know, what to make off of this... this mess of an anime! Colours are nice, and the animation is good, but what's the point, if the story sucks, and the characters are as interesting, as the chewed-up bubblegum?! This was originally a dating-game, turned into a anime, so what does anybody really expect anyway, when looking at this?! My recomendation is, that if you like reverse-harems, and don't like to confuse your brains with stories, or actual characters, go ahead, and give this one a shot... and gimme another, since I'm gonna need all the vodka, to sober up from this one! 


Better go play some Amnesia: the Dark Descent know... oh, my Me!

The drawing style of the anime wasn't that bad. Sure it was a typical girl anime and that stuff which I actually don't like to watch. But I liked the style of coloration and most of all the eyes of the characters. Only thing I hated about it were those ridiculous clothes of the boys. Which guy on earth runs around in half ripped of clothes and leggings? (despite an fashion designer)


The sound. I can't say that much about it. I didn't take care of the sound that much. Except one thing: how much does the seiyuu from the heroine actually earn? What the hell was her payment for ''speaking'' the girl? She wasn't talking a single word in most of the episodes. Only things like: uh? huh! ah? I almost flipped out because of that.

I loved the Art, they done the characters well and there eyes were amazing, specially since anime eyes usually are the thing that sets their emotions across. I understand its hard to adapt a otome game but still...They could have explained the characters better. They missed out on some of Shins background, missed A LOT on Toma and missed a lot on Ukyo too. It kind of hurts since people who wont play the game will have a permanent opinion on the characters just by the anime when the otome game itself explains better...\n\n

It depends really, I understood the anime that's why I enjoyed it a fair amount.\n
Toma's route is all about him and his jealousy towards Ikki and his protectiveness so more of the jealous route.\n
Shin's is basically Sherlock Homes thanks to his route being a mystery.\n
Ikki's route bases on the whole fangirl theme and its more in depth with Rika\n
Kent's is more logical and inexperience.\n
Ukyo is the truth route, more of a fantasy theme then all of them\n\n

Amnesia is an anime based off an a otome game made in Japan. While the anime is separate from the otome game, it still feels more like an advertisement to play it, then an anime. It contains 12 episodes, and is a reverse harem. This is shoujo so keep that in mind before watching.
Story: 8.98/10 (*Review Begins)
A girl wakes up after having collapsed with no memory of who she is with a spirit that only she can see for company. No-one can know that she has amnesia is it made evident that it has not been caused by her body or mind. The heroine, surroundedby handsome gents in the cafe she works at, must piece together her life with the help of her spirit companion. *While the anime is focused on our herione recovering her memories, the romance plays a bigger part. The mystery is intriguing, but the epsiode pacing is very awkward. The first half is dominated by the romance and the men she is dating in the alternate universe, so when she does figure out how she lost her memories, it is in the last two episodes. Having all this information being thrown at you in the last twenty minuets makes the ending seemed rushed/forced. The layout epsiode is predictable and same every two episodes (each boy gets two episodes). They meet, depressing back story, kiss, and then boy changes.


Character: 9.13/10 (Note: Each boy is based off a card suite in a deck of cards)

Heart: ♥

The Heart is Shin's route. He is our Herione's very sarcastic boyfriend. Apparenly they were childhood friends and he was family zoned, and they finally started dating. Shin still feels stuck in the family-zone, so now he does everything to get out (forcefully making out when she says no). Heroine also helped him in the past.

Spade: ♠

The Spade represents Ikki's route, and he is mega super popular with girls. When he was younger, he wish on a shooting star to be more popular with girls, and it came true. After 3 months the girl leaves him, and now dating is a game to him, seeing the next victim he can't seduce. The only problem is that Ikki can't seduce our herione, and usually he can just by looking the girl in the eyes.

Clover: ♣

The Clover shows Kent's route, and let me say, he doesn't get his fair share of episodes! He only has one, and his actions are very intellectual and calculated. He doesn't have very much experience with dating, so there relationship is so awkward, that it's hilarious. He is the only boy who realized he wasn't with the right herione. 

Diamond: ♦ 

The Diamond is Tomas's route. He is the creepiest by far, he loves our herione so much, that he drugs her and puts her in a cage so she is 'safe'. Yandere much? Anyway he does love her and though I was like wtf? when watching, it was a really good route.

Joker: ?

The Joker is the oddball of the family. His route is so confusing, I had to watch it twice just to absorb it in. He has been following her the entire time (stalker) and is the only character I can say that truly loves her. It's hard to explain, but you have to watch the anime. Anything that I say about him in some sense is a spoiler.

Herione: *

She is the probably the biggest let down. The fact that she didn't have a name didn't bother me, it's her lack of personality. She didn't speak much, and she didn't move the story along whatsoever. The boys were even started to get fed up!

 

Sound: 9.98/10

The opening and closing of this anime is the best ive heard yet (it's on my iPod). I loved the opening, modern, catchy, and eye popping. The voice acting for the guys were awesome as well, each voice fitting the personalities of the character. The herione barley said anything though. She usually made sound of confusion/ disbelief. She also did the long, melodramatic pauses where she uttered her bf's name in a wisper. Those are annoying as heck. 


Art: 10/10

The art was the saving grace we needed for this anime. For what the story is lacking, this makes up for it. The color scheme is beautifully done, each character designed differently. The herione is dressed uniquely and so are the men. The eyes are AMAZING. The eyes pop and are animated in an original way, as I haven't seen them that way before. The boys in her harem are attractive and overall this was beautiful. If you want to see top quality animation, this is a must see. A+


Enjoyment: 10/10

This anime was a great watch, the story was captivating, and I adored the opening and ending theme. I watched this anime 3 times and each time I was still captivated by the beauty of the art. 


Overall: 9.73/10

This anime is very well done, the art, sound, characters, and sorta story is very unique. Overall this anime did have its flaws, but for an anime based off an otome game, this did a great job. I reccomend that you are a person who prefers to watch reverse harem before watching, as the genre doesn't suit everyone. The mystery is good, and the romance factor is exceedingly prominent, and that is good or bad, you decide. Enjoy!

When I started watching this anime believe it or not I confused it with Dusk Maiden of Amnesia, and actually had expectations of this show being good. So, I continued watching this anime like a fool expecting something extravagant to happen. Well, from my tone you can probably guess that didn’t happen at all!
So, without further ado I’ll start my rant… sorry I mean review.
Amnesia is an anime based of a visual novel series and was released in 2013. It centers on a girl who wakes up in a café to discover she has amnesia. She later with the help of Lily, I am sorryOreion needs to get her memories back. And for some reason after two episodes, she continuously travels back in time where she is in a different dimension with slight changes. Oh yeah, that and the fact that she gets it on with a different guy in each new arc! 


Well, ain’t that quality entertainment!


That is pretty much it to the plot of Amnesia. And let’s be honest it is below par and was obviously targeted towards a female demographic like most reverse harem anime are nowadays. Now, what Amnesia suffered the most was from its characters and pacing.


The show never seemed to go anywhere and none of the confusion hardly seemed to get cleared up. Instead of trying to make some goddamn sense out of the show, they would instead make our main female protagonist either get man handled by what looks like a bunch of Greek adonises. The romances had some cute moments, I will give it that, but after she was with one guy in one dimension, the show would completely forgot about that character after she was done being with them. Instead, they would move on to another guy, and the cycle is simply repeated.


Oh and after she is done dating one of these guys, she dies! If they were gonna rip of Higurashi couldn’t they have at least made it brutal for crying out loud?


The reason why she dies after a certain period of time is because the dimension won’t accept her existence, in the world. Then again, it’s not like the anime community would value her existence either way. The female lead has no personality and her having Amnesia is no fucking excuse, because characters like Tada Banri from Golden Time and the Black Haired woman from Death Parade still have wonderful personalities. This chick on the other is as bland as cardboard.


But, I will give her credit for not being as intolerable as Julie from Diabolik Lovers. I’ll give her that. However, what is interesting about this bitch is that she doesn’t even have a fucking name. Which doesn’t make her a badass like Clint Eastwood but it just goes to show, how boring this Mary Sue of a character is.


Now, the guys on the other hand are all are clichéd and do fall into certain reverse harem tropes. You have got the hot headed one, the play boy, the trap, the kuudere and the yandere! The only two characters I did like were Shin and Kento, well mainly Kento. But, none the less it seems as if none of the guys did anything to make the plot of the show interesting, and was there for the manservice I guess. They were just as useless as our heroine, even if their clichéd personalities were entertaining sometimes.

Oreion on the other hand reminded me too much of Lily from La Corda D’oro and the two basically have the same personalities and looks. I like Lily more but I guess I enjoyed Oreion too!


Now the animation on the other hand wasn’t that bad, it was actually pretty good for a reverse harem. The character designs were unique but their wardrobes made me question what kind of a world they were living in. Like seriously, who the fuck where’s a belt around their neck? Does Shin have any idea he could strangle himself with it?


It seems like as if Lady Gaga became ruler of the world and made it a law that people must  dress like runaway models! Like why?


However, the thing that made me almost flip my table over was its BS ending. I can’t believe I sat through 12 episodes for such a lame conclusion to this crappy series. Plus, we never even get to see her get her fucking memories back. You could have given her a personality for at least one minute couldn’t ya? Even Bella got a personality towards the last Twilight film!


However, the opening of the show was that one silver lining among the large gray cloud which was the show. I freaking loved it and the animation for the opening is outstanding. The opening actually makes the show look like it is worth watching, and I wish the creators of the show would have put much effort into the plot like they did with the opening. The song too is an earworm and what can even after many days or months later I still don’t get seem to get tired of this song! So, this song is like a reward after having to deal with this show.


So, in case you are deaf let me make it clear that you my friend should not check out Amnesia. To summarize what I said in a nutshell, the show has a shitty plot, shitty characters and a shitty ending. That should be reason even to skip these twelve time consuming episodes! However, if you don’t care about a good plot, memorable characters or a lame ending then go check it out if you only want a show for the hot guys manhandling a lame ass girl.


The rest of you with decent taste in anime don’t worry, you guys won’t leave empty handed today because I will provide you with some recommendations. You can check out Higurashi, a horror gore anime with different arcs. Or maybe you can check out Amagami SS, if horror ain’t your forte. It is actually a harem but unlike Amnesia the dude getting it on with different characters is worth watching. Or you check out Golden Time, which also deals with a guy getting amnesia and his journey to get his life together while struggling to deal with his past and present. They are in my opinion all worth checking out!

Story (8/10): Amnesia has quite a beautiful story line. The story itself is unique, eye catching, and I could even say mind blowing. There are a piece of every genre in this anime, including mystery, romance, reverse harem, and event some elements of horror. There are fragments of memory given in every episode, and at some point in the story, you will piece them together.
Art (9/10): The art is probably one of the strongest points in this beautifully draw series. The clothing designs are unique andeye catching. The characters are beautifully drawn. 


Sound (7/10): The sound of this anime is average, from the voice acting, to the theme song. 


Character (8/10): I am impressed by the characterization in this anime. Being a short anime, with only 12 episodes, and made from a game, the characters are amazingly well brought out. Though a bit cliche, each of the characters have a different personality. Since there aren't much information given for the main female protagonist, her shy and frightened personality helps hide the flaws in her character. Everything is cool except when you want to punch her in the face for her stupid decisions.


I loved this anime. I finished it in one go, and it was a fascinating and mind blowing journey. I enjoyed every single element about this anime. This is all my own opinion and preference.

Now, when I heard of Amnesia, I was excited. So, so, SO mind blowing-ly excited. My first thoughts? 'LOOK AT THAT ART UGH NOW I HAVE TO WATCH THIS.'
I still contemplate whether that was a good idea or not. Now I don't mean to just ramble on about the negative parts of this anime, because really, it does have it's redeeming qualities, but there simply wasn't enough there for me to give it more than a 5. 
Story: 3/10
Of course since this is based off a visual novel, an otome game to be specific, I wasn't expecting anything perfect. I love reverse harem as muchas the next girl/guy, but animes like Uta No Prince-Sama taught me not to expect anything much in story, just a lot in art. The reason I'm giving this a 3 is because, well... I quite like stories that give me bits as I go on, so I stay interested. So I want to know what happens next, so I can keep forming the puzzle in my head, steadily, even if it's creating the wrong picture. This anime? I suggest you watch it if you like to be confused for practically the whole anime. Everything is pretty much revealed in the last two episodes, so sometimes I feel like I could have just watched the first episode, then the last two. To be honest for half the anime I was convinced that every time the Heroine died she revived with a new boyfriend but er... That wouldn't be the best plot, would it?


Despite this being a reverse harem, which of course means, awh yeah, romance, it actually didn't hold that much in the romance field. Yes, there were the basics of like, kissing, and etc, but it made me feel near nothing as it felt like I was just watching strangers kiss. I felt no attachment to them, half the time. The ending was not satisfying to me in the least, and left me with a mostly bitter taste in my mouth, honestly. But I can't tell you I wasn't interested in the least, of course. Sure, this story wasn't completely immersing, but it wasn't completely terrible. I managed to finish it after all, due to that little bit of curiosity in me. That curiosity was never sated, but er, I'll give them credit for trying. 

---


Art: 9/10


This had to be the absolute best quality of this anime, actually. I could forgive it's plot sometimes just because of it, after all. The colors chosen were lovely, and the style was just so crisp and pretty. This is what pulled me to watch the anime in the first place, just how beautiful the art was. The eyes have to be my favorite part though. LOOK AT THEM. They're absolutely stunning! I know some might definitely beg to differ, as they might make you think there's something special about their super amazing eyeballs, (which there really isn't, they're just nice to look at.) All those pretty close ups gave me more time to admire them soooo... Yeah. The art definitely pleased me. 


The only qualm I have is the outfits. WHAT. No, seriously, WHAT?! I can't believe no one on the streets gave those guys weird looks. Sure, your steampunk/gothic clothes are pretty sexy, but what?! Everyone is wearing normal clothing, even the Heroine is wearing fairly normal clothes... But these guys? Man, are they fashionistas trying to give out a message. Perhaps the reason no one questions their sense in fashion is because everybody is completely used to it? I don't know. You tell me.

---


Sound: 7/10


Okay, so I was a bit iffy on the sound. I don't have much to say on the voice acting, I quite liked all their voices. They suited them quite well, so no qualms on that. I have to say, I fell in love with that little music box track. It's a sweet little thing, it makes me think of a curious child, or something like that. It suited the anime in that aspect, I suppose. The opening and the ending definitely were memorable for me though, as I really liked them. (especially the ED with that whispering and intense background) The only problem for me though is that I felt as catchy and amazingly awesome both songs were, Zoetrope and Recall did not suit this anime. It made seem way more action packed and tantalizingly laced with mystery than it actually was. Sure there was action, kinda, (though most of it was near the end), but it seemed a bit too crazy for such an anime. The OP was a little better but still... Dat Jrock. (Is it Jrock? I don't know.)

---


Character: 3/10 


My biggest problem with this anime might've been the Heroine. Why am I putting an uppercase for Heroine, you may ask? Well, other than that, she has no name. I guess since this is off an otome game, (I'm assuming it's the type that lets you change her name), they decided NOT to name her. That definitely was a new one to me, but not necessarily a good thing. It didn't bother me too much that she didn't have a name, as none of the guys ever needed to use it apparently, but it definitely made her feel way less like a plausible character. But never mind that, she never really felt much like a plausible character in the first place. 


This was pretty much the Watch Boys Hold A Conversation With Themselves anime. Yes, she spoke, (thank heavens), but usually every person who talked to the Heroine, minus Orion was pretty much talking to themselves. I was actually surprised in the last two episodes, with how much speaking she did. When people talked to her, especially the boys, her main reactions would often be a tiny gasp, little noises or just plain staring, as if she has no clue what's happening. Which is true for the most part half the time, but really? I just could not sympathize with her, and by the end of it she just made me want to sigh and hold my face in my hands. Most characters had little to none in backstories, and character development was pretty much watching them flirt with the Heroine. Wow, so much development. They're not completely terrible though, at least they speak. 


My favorite character definitely had to be Toma, really. Ukyo pulls in a close second, though. Why, you may ask? Because there was character development to speak of, yay! They had to be some of the only characters I didn't actually feel nothing towards, because as lovely as Shin's face is, and as much as I wanted to make him my favorite, I couldn't. Though Toma didn't choose the appropriate methods of expressing his love, at least he had reasons. Sorta kinda lika. 

---


Enjoyment: 4/10


I can't say much for this. There were times when I mildly enjoyed it, but there were never really 'WOW I NEED TO REWIND THAT' moments. I definitely watched episode nine with happiness due to the fact that... Er, well spoilers. Just... plot was happening, and I liked it. Or well, side-ark. Whatever. Something. (Still need to work on my review language)

---


Overall - 

Story + Art + Sound + Character + Enjoyment x 2 

3 + 9 + 7 + 3 + 4 x 2 = 52

52/100 = 5.2/10


Overall score: 5


My advice, watch Amnesia if you just want to be immersed in pretty boys. To fully enjoy this, er... Perhaps don't ask too many questions until near the end, it will save you a lot of headaches because you probably won't get those answer anytime soon. I feel bad, because I know this review might be really on the negative side, and this anime isn't completely unwatchable... But, good luck to those of you who wish to watch it.

I just finished Amnesia and since it was recently aired, I decided to write a review and share my opinion. This is my first review! 
STORY/PACING: 6.5/10
This story contained traveling between parallel dimensions, amnesia, and struggling to recover the main character's memories. And of course, a whole bunch of guys the main character could choose from (Since it was adapted from an Otome PSP game). It may sound cliché but it isn't as predictable as it sounds. It held a lot of suspense right to the last episode and plot was somewhat unique. 
The pacing could be seen as either good or bad. Bad becauseof the fact that you didn't know much of what was going on until the 7th or 8th episode, and good because since you didn't know much of what was going on, you'd want to keep watching. I am one of those people who like to come up with theories on what's going to happen which is why I didn't find the pacing bad. But there are others who prefer to know more about what's going on.

I was just not satisfied with the ending. The first episodes held a mysterious mood to them, but the ending was too magical and leaned more to the fantasy side. It just didn't really fit.


ART: 9/10


The art was absolutely BEAUTIFUL! You'd definitely enjoy the amazing and unique outfits and eyes. Not to mention the fact that you'll LOVE the guys too!


SOUND: 8/10


The opening and ending themes were one of the best two I've ever heard. Zoetrope (By Yanagi Nagi) had a very unique beat while Recall (By Ray) had a mysterious mood to it, fitting the anime perfectly. I'd usually skip the openings and endings but this anime had me listen to both all the way to the end.

The voice acting was good. All of the voices fit the characters pretty well. 


CHARACTERS: 5.5/10


Not all of the characters were stereotypes, as some people put it. Sure, there was the lone-wolf, Mr. Popular, the childhood friend, the mysterious guy, and that super smart guy with hardly any emotion. But first of all, Ikki isn't all full of himself like what the Mr. Popular stereotype is actually like. And Toma is not that normal 'childhood friend'. Locking the one he loves in a cage to protect her, you'd think he was a Tsundere.

The main problem was the Heroine. (She doesn't have a name.) I also agree that she has the personality of a wooden board. Of course you would be quiet and shy if you had amnesia, but that doesn't mean you'll have no emotion at all. You barely see her smile, and I don't even think she laughs, though I may be wrong. She hardly talks, just stays in one place and does the occasional 'ehhh' and stares. When she gets kissed, she's frozen like a statue, eyes WIDE open. Oh, and the Heroine never makes a move to tell any of the guys her real  feelings and her opinion. She gets pushed against a tree, forcefully kissed, and forgives them right away. She never gets angry.

And I really think Orion didn't really fit into this. Sure he's there to help the Heroine, but he just seems too... magical.


ENJOYMENT: 7/10


Seeing that I finished this anime in two days, I think I really enjoyed it. When I started, I just couldn't stop. The anime starts off pretty confusing, but that's what I liked about it. I didn't know what was going on, so I wanted to keep on watching and let the mystery unravel.


OVERALL: 7.5/10


Overall, I'd give this a 7.5. I rated it a 7 on my anime list because you can't do 0.5's. 

This anime was really good in my opinion. This has just the right amount of romance and mystery combined. And the Heroine had scenes with all the guys so everyone's happy!

Let me start of by saying 1. This review is done by a female and 2. Yes I do particularly like anime's filled with a lot of good looking guys. But no, I do not just watch certain anime's for that reason.
I don't write very many reviews either... So I can't really say this is going to be a good one.
When I first decided to watch this, I had no idea it was an Otome game. Plus, I didn't even realize the main girl didn't have a name. Fail on my part twice. Around the third episode I was really confused and began looking atcomments seeing if others were confused too, but no, most of the people watching it knew it was a game. Knowing that, I understood why she didn't have a name. So there was one less thing to bug me.

Now onto the different parts of the story.


Beginning:

We find out she has amnesia. Kind of obvious since it's the title. At this point in time it doesn't seem like she's dating anyone. She's just really confused and trying to trigger her memories. What would any typical person do if they lost their memories. How was she to know if she truly did know those people? And then the part where I became confused happened.

Each character has their own tragic story. One of those typical "you saved me from myself" kind of things.


Shin:

Didn't really care for this guy. He's young, brash, smart alec, and acts superior. You don't really know what's going on at this point, and the Heroine is trying to piece together what happened in the beginning. 


Ikki:

From this point, things could either get really confusing or they start making sense. I liked Ikki, a lot. Though I must say he has one of the scariest fan clubs I've seen in anime yet. ._.


Kento:

Genius, kind-hearted but can't express himself well, awkward, not really sure about human emotion. He's so smart, that he actually explained what was going on just based on what had happened so far. However, that can't be the end, that had to be some sort of twist. 


Toma:

Crazy Ukyo appears when it's Toma's turn. Which is fitting because we find out that Toma is... well.. kind of a psychopath himself. ._.

Why he's the favorite of a lot of girls I will never know. 


Ukyo:

My personal favorite. Split-personality. But his actual self is really amazing, not the other side. We had seen him previously often, both personalities. So it wasn't hard to put together he had a personality disorder. During Ukyo's turn, all the action happens. This part would have to be, in my opinion, the best part of the anime. Here is where all the suspense happens if there were to be any.


End:

At first, I was kind of mad at the ending. I mean, how could you end it without resolving where she ended up? But then I remembered it was an Otome Game and that she actually had a choice. And since she is the viewer, that meant the choice was ours to make. So I couldn't really knock of points for the ending.


Lost points:

Story: 

They could have given each character equal time. It wasn't fair that most had two episodes whereas Kento only had one. 

Art: 

Though I liked the colors of the anime, and the use of the card symbols, the art itself felt too... how should I put this... plain. For an anime geared towards girls it was just kind of plain. 

Character:

This goes back to how little time she had with each person. There wasn't much character development. The Heroine had practically no character at all besides agree and disagree based on what answers one probably would have given in the game.

Enjoyment: 

I didn't really like all the scenes with Orion. They could have been shortened. 


Overall: 7/10 but of course you probably already knew that since it shows.


Review aside, if I were to play this game, personally, I would have probably either chosen Ikki, Kento, or Ukyo. Most likely Ukyo because I really liked him. :)

I typed more than I thought I would. o.o

[SPOILER FREE FOR THOSE WHO WANT TO READ BEFORE WATCHING]
Yes, I know what your thinking. "I can't believe you gave this anime a 10/10!". And yes I know a lot of people really hate this show, but I mostly understand where they are coming from. However, I have to be honest with myself and say I REALLY liked this anime. First let me start out by stating that I am not a big reverse harem fan (even if I am a girl), so for me to say that I enjoyed this is pretty weird. Anime like Brothers Conflict and Diabolik Lovers are the type ofreverse harem that I cannot stand. "Why?" you may ask. Simply because there are TOO MANY BOYS. You probably think I'm crazy for saying that but I am not one to enjoy the company of 30 of people, let alone 30 cute boys. So that makes up a big reason why I enjoyed Amnesia so much.


Now I'm going to explain why I gave each section the rating that I did. I gave the plot an 8/10, and this is where most people gave a really low rating on. I honestly do not understand that. Some of my favorite shows are ones that have unique plots and don't throw in some of the many anime cliques. Amnesia did a very good job at staying away from that. I also saw very little fan service which made me feel comfortable watching the show. Now that I think about it, thats probably the reason why those who hated this show just loved anime like Fairy Tail (which is riddled with fan service).


Now of course I had to give the art a 10. It held up to the video game's AMAZING art and I really liked the way they were drawn. Not only that but (Of course I have to mention this) their eyes were almost hypnotising to look at. Unlike the otome game, the two different eye colors for each character were more emphasised which made them slightly resemble pokeballs. The art for Amnesia will always seize to amaze me.


Time for the characters. This is another BIG reason why so many people disliked the show. "OH the heroines doesn't react enough!" or "Geez that Shin guy needs to stop being so rude to her". These are the things that make people angry. So if you've made it this far and have thought the same things then this is what I have to tell you. SHE HAS AMNESIA! She is not going to react much to situations since she has NO clue what anyone is talking about. The heroine also has to hide her amnesia from everyone so they don't take advantage of her. So I don't expect her to trot around with a smile on her face trying to greet every person she meets on the street. In fact, if that did happen I would think she is weird. I tried to put myself in her shoes and think if I would react the same way. Honestly, I could see myself being exactly like her. So the heroine's lack of emotion is not a problem for me. The 5 main guys are not problems either because I think that they were written well for they each have a different "-dere" personality. I like how they even threw in a yandere to make those masochist girls get mega nose bleeds.


I don't need to explain enjoyment because I think I have already expressed my mass amount of enjoyment for this anime already. With this said I gave Amnesia a 10/10. I definitely recommend this to people who enjoy mysteries and romances. If you like reverse harems then I don't think you will get your full experience of "hot guys doing hot stuff" when you watch this. Of course there is kissing (and a lot of it) but that is about the most fan service you will get. If you made it this far then well done. Here is a gold star. I made this review longer because I feel strongly about this anime. I think I have defended it and the otome game and little to much so I'll end it on that note. Now go and enjoy the show!

If not because of the art you would drop this anime. My goodness! The story is a mess, given it is based on a dating game, the story did not even try to make a creative plot. Although, it did well in portraying each scene on guys. It started on flashback, but as you go through the episodes it would not even try to drop hints or explain it so it tends to become a confusion. The art design of characters is stylish but as you watch the entire episodes there are no variations in the dress. The sound is so-so. About the heroine, sheis passive through the whole episodes. Her emotions are stiff. I mean no reaction, she's just going through the flow. If you are a fan girl, you would enjoy the art of guys. I'm not satisfied with how the anime ends.

I admit I looked at "Amnesia" a long time ago and for this reason I didn't remember all the events and the names of the characters accurately.
After watching it I was so baffled by how badly a visual novel in anime could be transposed that it simply went by the wayside; and then when I tried to remember the title I had to squeeze the whole brain to find the keywords that allowed me to find it in the research.
The protagonist is extremely shy, silent, does not talk much, does not fight against what is happening in an active way, which certainly makes her theworst character of this beautiful anime but allows her to identify herself very easily, and enjoy the wonderful journey that happens to her: every day a different parallel life, in the arms of a different boy, and each of them loves her differently and for different reasons. Every time he has to understand how the plan in which he finds himself works, learn about the relationship with the boyfriend, but when he becomes fond of it, it is time to jump into another life. Incredibly romantic, I fell in love with every episode of a different guy, and in the last episode all the threads come together, the story takes shape and ends in beauty. Full marks.\n
"Amnesia" is an anime taken from a video game, precisely an otome game (and already from here ...), which sees as protagonist a dude and mute chick who does not have a name, and who already begins the series faints, like I miss Dante Alighieri in "La Divina Commedia". She has no memories and has a spirit with her, Orion, who helps and advises her (but in reality it is really useless), and in twelve episodes we see her that every tot is in a different world where she is with a different type from the other world. The four boys (Shin the tasteless, Ikky the languid, Kento the mathematician and Toma the psychopath) plus Ukyo, who is the unbalanced par excellence and the darkest character of the whole series, are one more crazy than the other and all in love of our protagonist (it is so very beautiful ^^)

The story in my opinion, is pretty creative. A girl suddenly got amnesia, and goes to different worlds to romance with different boys. I really adore the art style, it's very pretty. The characters on the other hand...weren't developed really well. The main character had no character development whatsoever and was very bland and boring. Even though I think the story line was pretty okay, the way it's presented in the anime, was boring and I almost fell asleep while watching it. Honestly, I recommend playing the game rather than watching this rather boring anime. Overall I give this anime, a 2 out of 5.

The anime is based off a graphic novel, just in case you didn't know. I was so pumped when I found out this show exists because I truly enjoyed the game when I played it - years ago, by the way. Unfortunately, after watching the whole anime, including the OVA, I felt like my time was wasted. 
Story: 5/10
The premise is pretty ok: the lead character has amnesia and she has to learn who she is and who she can/can't trust as the time goes on. But every time she dies, she goes back to another world where things are different, so she must findout what's going on. Although the concept itself is kinda interesting, the plot gets worst every minute it passes. Every episode is the same thing over and over. I understand that is based off a game but the adaptation SHOULDN'T BE EXACTLY LIKE THE GAME. 


Art: 10/10

The art is the only good thing about this. The characters are beautiful, as you should expect of a love story anime, and the background is absolutely outstanding. It does fit the story pretty well, but this just goes to waste as you can tell.


Sound: 3/10

The whole show is strangely and disturbingly quiet. Although the intro and outro is pretty cute, the episodes almost doesn't have any sounds besides the character's voices and some of their action's sounds.


Character: 1/10

All of the characters are way too basic and our main character is WAAAY too submissive and shy, even in her thoughts. She can't do anything for herself and relies on the fairy/ghost that's following her, which is also not an interesting character at all. The only characters that you can say it's decent (in relation to the other characters) is Ukyou and maaaybe Toma, and you won't see Ukyou in most of the episodes. All of the characters are basic and empty and you can't see any progression. 


Enjoyment: 1/10

I truly had a tiny bit of hope that this could turn out a good anime, but sadly, that's not the case. 


Overall: 3

You hope that the OVA has some explanation about why the fuck you have more questions than answers at the end of the show but nope, it has more 22 minutes sucked in from your life. 


Please don't watch it, just play the graphic novel instead.

Art-7

Sound-8

Enjoyment-5

Overall-5

an extremely boring anime with the quietest, most passive and irrelevant MC. I know this is based off an otome game so the MC doesn't talk that much but seriously I swear all she says is "ah" "no" "ok". The most bland and tasteless character ever but at least the art style was pretty to look at so that made the whole experience somewhat bearable. I would have actually liked this if the MC had an actual personality, the other characters weren't too bad.
