Amnesia is not an extraordinary anime, yet it has that catchy thing that makes you watch it until the end. Personally, I enjoyed it very much ( that is why I believe that my enjoyment rate was around 8/10). As far as I know, Amnesia is also an otome game, and the anime is probably made after it. 
Story: 6/10
6: because it says ”fair” 
The story isn't such a big deal, but it is rather cute: the plot goes on smoothly and it keeps your attention alive, even though you might guess sometimes what is going to happen. It's not about that, but about thefact that it has something in it that makes you wish to watch it until the end. And the story  has this sparkle of un-namable something. The story in itself, I have to admit, is not extraordinary (as I said before, neither the anime is). The plot revolves around a confused girl who slowly, but surely, starts to understand what is going on - from there on, all the so-called-problem begins, and we understand that she travels through parallel world involuntarily. As I said, it's nothing to get surprised about because the story is so constructed that you can fairly understand it is not about the story, but a strong correlation between everything that's going on. A fair correlation that doesn't demand greatness, just the mere essence of being. That's why I believe the story is fair: it doesn't demand more than it has to offer, and that is why the story seems good enough to me.


Art : 7/10

I guess the art is pretty good. For those who are interested (or fascinated) by attractive guys with interesting eyes, you might find the art pleasant. As for myself, I liked the art except some several details: I didn't like their eyes, they crept me out ( the colours weren't right). Also, everything seemed rather sparkly and unreal (even for an anime), which makes you understand immediately that the anime might be ...the anime version of a game. All in all, for those who like these types of details (sparkle, colourful environment -and eyes, and clothes), then you might as well enjoy it very much. I objectively rate it 7/10, but -to be entirely honest - I was really abashed by those eyes; eventually I came to get used to them.


Sound: 8/10

The soundtrack seems very good to me. Also, I guess there's nothing much to comment here. It matches the atmosphere and the anime in itself perfectly.


Character: 6/10 ( but if we talk about specific characters, I'd give Toma 10/10 :3 )

As I said before, the anime is a very strong correlation between everything that goes on in it, the characters included. There is no main ...thing, no main detail put in the spot of the light. It's everything there is, it demands that and nothing more (which I came to admire very much). That being said, even though the characters are not the main thing that's been underlined as most important in the anime, I still liked them. They are nothing out of common, they are common characters with very common personalities (and also looks). Being a reverse-harem, the boys are, obviously, very attractive. Every each of them becomes charming at a point or another, and taking them ”as a whole”, someone would be rather inclined to underline the fact that they are a bunch of really attractive hotties. The ”main” character, the girl, is also very cute (I liked her personality very much; as it is supposed to be, she is very kind, for those who have  a ”thing” for honest-kind girls/personalities, I suppose you might get a like on her). I believe the characters are also ”fair” to the anime in its entity because as well as the story and everything above, it doesn't demand more than what it can actually give. They are appropriate to the state of being.


Enjoyment: 8/10

I couldn't sleep until i finished the series (Thank God it were only 12 episodes). I had a lot of fun watching it: I cannot rate this in any possible way objectively. It is rather personal: I had ”fun” watching it, I was always curious to see what's next and what kind of reactions she'll have. Actually, it is rather predictable what's going to happen. Even so, it is enjoyable because it makes you want to see HOW exactly are all those things going to happen. I loved that about the anime. 


Overall

I had fun watching it; but I have to give warnings: This is not a great anime. It's average. Made after an otome-game, it doesn't gave a great plot, neither great characters, there is no main point in the anime and even though it has a very nice way of presenting everything, you will not get the feeling you get from those masterpieces. It's just average: an anime you might possibly enjoy to watch some night when you feel like watching some random anime. I, for must say, believe it's fair in itself. It doesn't offer much, but it doesn't demand much either. If you regard this anime as something like that, something that gives only that and nothing more, demands what it demands and gives what it promises to, if you do that, you might as well enjoy it. The art is okay, the sound also - the story and the characters synchronise perfectly, the enjoyment might be great if you like those blurry atmosphere with kissing coming out of nowhere (but nor really), fast romances (but nicely constructed), interesting characters (but nothing out of common)... overall, I believe some might give it a try. It is NOT a waste of time. It's enjoyable.

If you're expecting a comedic and happy atmosphere from this anime, I'd say you've come to the wrong place my friend. The idea of Amnesia originated from a H-game, where you set flags on routes and achieve a certain ending.This anime is target at young female viewers so if you're a guy, you might have a hard time following. Amnesia is told in a first-person view which, in other words, you basically have no clue what is happening throughout the story until the very end. I enjoyed watching this anime not because I love the mystery genre, but because of it's originality/plot.
Firstly, lets talk aboutthe making of this anime. The reason why I started this anime was mainly for it's art. I was interested in how each individual character was drawn to be significant to the symbols of a card game such as hearts, diamonds, clover, etc. Other than the artwork, I was also impressed by the opening theme song of Amnesia, which I believe was sang by Yanagi Nagi. It helped prepared the right mood in the beginning of each episode mainly because its catchy, but thats my opinion after all.


Now that we're done with the artwork and sound production, lets move on to the creation of the characters. The main character of this story is the heroine, which was never given a name throughout the ENTIRE series. If I had to describe her character, it would be plain, weak, inferior, clueless, airhead, doesn't have much of a personality at all. But that's acceptable once you forget who you are. The fact that she's lucky to experience dating with four attractive dudes won't change. Throughout the story, the heroine is always clueless of her surroundings. The background given to the heroine was that she was childhood friends with two boys named Shin and Toma. As the story progresses, you'll notice quite a few changes with this heroine, well technically to be more specific, she's able to communicate more comfortably with her surroundings.


The very first arc of the anime begins with Shin. I'd say that Shin can be compared to an ice cream, because he gives out a cold impression and yet he's sweet and kind. He is mostly shown at the exposition of the story and seems to have a deep relationship with the heroine. Nearing the end of his arc, he becomes more forceful and impatient with the heroine. His symbol is the heart.


The second arc leads on to another male lead, Ikki. Ikki is more of the idealistic boyfriend and is perfect at everything, especially on the looks. The heroines first encounter with Ikki is when he helps her make some kinda ice cream thingy (iunno what its called). It is rumoured that every girl Ikki dates with always breaks up after 3-months because of the competition between fangirls. His symbol is the diamond.In my opinion, this was the most BORING part of the story, reason being it was dodgy and unreliable to the main concept of the story, as if it was there to take up three whole episodes for no reason.


After Ikki's arc is Kent's arc. Kent is definitely not the ideal boyfriend and shows no emotion/affection towards the heroine. Throughout the story, Kent becomes more 'open' to the heroine and is able to express his affection towards her. His symbol is the clover. I really liked this part of the story because I liked seeing the character development of Kent.


The next arc, which was my favourite, is Toma's arc. The reason why I loved this character is because he was the first yandere male lead I knew. The behaviour Toma takes whenever he's near to the heroine is quite over-protective. Throughout the story, Toma shows his affection towards heroine is by confining her in a cage to protect her from "antagonists". Nearing the end of the story, the heroine discovers her true feeling for Toma and eventually forgives his actions. This arc in particular was the start of the rising action of the story, holding up a tense feeling.


Lastly, the Ukyou arc, which is the climax of the story. Ukyou is first seen in the anime when he saves her from what could've been a car accident. What specifically interests me about Ukyou is that he has a split personality which is quite a mystery throughout the story. One that wants to kill the heroine, and one which wants to protect her at all costs. Ukyou seems to have some knowledge of why the heroine is passing through parallel worlds (spoiler). Ukyou is known to have interest in photography, but to be honest, I don't see what this has to do with the plot at all.


After watching this anime, I can tell that a lot of effort was put into making this anime. I was always looked forward to what would happen in the next episode. I really recommend trying out this anime because you don't know what you're missing out on!

Basic Info for the anime:
1 It's based on an Otome Game.
2 The main character or the "heroine" has Amnesia.
3 There are a LOT of cute guys
If you've ever played an otome game then you know main characters, or heroines, are really dull with no personality this so YOU can get into the synch of the story. Amnesia tries to be the closest it can to the game, and that includes dull heroines, if you consider this then the anime does a pretty good job. Well it SHOULD! But they didn't take advantage of this fact and unintentionally made the main character REALLY annoying, I meaneven if you have amnesia you should have some personality, don't you think? Well the heroine doesn't and whenever she shows a bit of personality it's of a whiny, kinda dumb, girl. I think this was the major setback of the story if the main character had been more easy to symphatise with it would've been great. \n\n
Other than that it was pretty neat. The art was absolutely gorgeous and mesmerizing probably one of the best I've ever seen! Music was good. The story was reaaally promising but wasted. I enjoyed watching this especially because it's the first completely girl-only fanservice anime I've ever seen and I think that's good, We girls are finally are taking in consideration and I really hope this increases.\n\n
Maybe Amnesia will be the start of this, not the best star, but a start nevertheless.

Do I recommend this anime? No
If you are new to the reverse-harem genre (one girl who has a million boys to choose from), DO NOT let this be your first one. If you have watched tons of reverse harem, and have become tired of the cliché storylines, watch it. However, don’t get angry at me if you hate it!
Let’s start with the characters:
All of the boys are one dimensional. From the very get-go, I already predicted who the heroine was going to end up with...luckily, I was wrong (since it was open ending). Nonetheless, that does not mean the story was completely original. Even whenthe story progressed, the characters are still very bland. You have the nerd, the popular one, the one that cannot express himself, and the boy next door.


Furthermore, there was a tendency of the men saying a line similar to this: I’m a man. I have temptation. Don't come near me or I'll do something to you!" Uh, do guys in real life really say that to women? Do women really like it when that is said? ‘Cause if that was me; I would kick the guy in the nuts and run away!


Despite how annoying the boys were, if you like a certain type of male character, there will be an episode satisfying your romantic set-up. I’m not going into details with this because the little spoilers can ruin the slightest enjoyable/intriguing content this anime actually has to offer.


On to the heroine!

I did not notice this until I read it, but her name was never mentioned! The whole show was like a video game, so I wouldn’t be surprised if the viewers were supposed to feel like the main character (I didn’t though…). Anyways, she was BORING. No personality whatsoever! I wanted to punch her because of how ridiculously dumb she was. If any character could raise my blood pressure, it’s her!! Also, she did not even have real dialogues/monologues. She went with the flow of life and rarely cared that she had amnesia even when it was negatively affecting her and the people around her. She was unique, but a show should NEVER have a main character like her! She really dug her own grave in each episode. So sad…NOT!  (Also, I think they went with the Amnesia story because it gave a reasonable excuse for her to get to know the guys individually; a perfect reverse-harem setup, am I right?)  


Honestly, I was about to give up on this show, but episode 7 explained why she was the way she was. The storyline became interesting. However, it went downhill again after that. I only continued to watch it because the main storyline/plot was original. I have never seen a reverse harem like this (I’m refraining from saying the spoiler). Yet, the originality of the show was overshadowed by the unoriginal and boring characters and dialogues. Not to mention, the storyline did not unfold nicely either. I guess the only thing that was okay was the open ending. Oh yeah, the art was different and nice too. Personally, the dichromatic eyes and hair looked beautiful. Also, I’m still wondering why the heroine had two different shoes. Can anyone answer that?

---

As I mentioned, this show was absolutely boring and ridiculous. I only gave it a high rating (yes, 7- 6 is way too high for it) because I’m just tired of the typical reverse-harem, and I do applaud people that shed original content into a show (even if it is done poorly). Soooo, watch this show at your own risk.

Ah, Amnesia..probably one of the most boring shows that I have watched.
Before I start, I must say that I do indeed know that the writers for this anime had basically nothing to base this anime on; after all, it was an otome game, which can sometimes be quite superficial in terms of plot. However, they basically did nothing with it.
Plot:
When I first started watching Amnesia, it was because my guilty pleasure is watching reverse harem anime. Shows like Ouran, Kamigami no Asobi, and Free!! (if it can be defined as anything other than sports anime), which are on the more decent side of the spectrum.However, had I known that Amnesia had such a useless plot such as Diabolik Lovers, I wouldn't even have started watching it.


I thought this anime was going to be about a girl getting her memories back. That is not what I saw. What I saw while watching this anime was a girl going from boyfriend to boyfriend, staying clueless the whole time. After all of this idiocy, the writers suddenly decided to cram a strange psycho policeman (??) into the mess and then try to pretend that the anime had a plot the entire time. I stopped caring completely about the anime around episode 5, but I forced myself to continue so that I could find out why she had amnesia. When I finished the anime, I thought to myself "they explained it a bit...but I still have no idea what was really going on in that anime." Because her ex-boyfriend has magical powers or something that make time repeat itself. And people get thrown in a well. To this day, I haven't bothered to rewatch the abomination that is amnesia. 


Art:

I have to say, the art for amnesia was really nice. The artstyle in general was very appealing, and one of the reasons why I picked up this anime in the first place. Only, the dudes all seemed to have the color scheme of "one unique color plus black". 

Sound: 

The opening was catchy, but all the other soundtrack didn't really come to my attention.


Characters: 

Okay, I know that the heroines of reverse harems often have really weak personalities. And 'nameless protagonist' is a prime example of a weak personality. We know literally nothing about her. She's just this ultimate doormat that doesn't stand up for herself when people assault/bully her (like being attacked with scissors and being locked IN A CAGE) and doesn't seem to have a conscience when she is, in a weird way, dating 5 (??) people at once. The other characters are just plain old strange. I don't find any of their personalities attractive. I didn't even bother to remember their names. Yellow is too obsessive/super creepy, white/blue dude can't seem to decide if he's the supportive wingman or the ladykiller, red is just....apathetic (??), and green...green seems like a tsundere, but they focus on him a lot less than they do on, say, yellow, so it's kinda hard to tell what he's all about. Orion is almost as mysterious/shallow as the protagonist. He's a spirit...but he does basically nothing but tell the protagonist "oh hello you have amnesia" although it might be pretty easy to tell if you have no memories whatsoever. And then there's psycho cop dude...I can't even talk about him. I don't get him at all.


I didn't enjoy this anime. It's not as bad as some, but it really is one of the dumbest things I've watched.

After watching Amnesia, I don't understand why so many people condemn it so much. The only reason I can find is, they are either getting confused by the story, or are guys who find this anime too "girly". (I'm a guy too and in the first few episodes I've been tempted to drop it because of this; Now I'm glad I didn't give in) 
Story:        While the idea is at the base fairly good, it's they way they present it that makes this anime excellent. I didn't experience this sensation "What the hell is going on here?" sinceI watched Steins;Gate, and I loved it. Now then, given that this sensation is the reason many people drop this anime (or the excuse, depending on how you look at it), I do not understand how this anime is so low while Steins;Gate is no less than no.2 in the list. Do an experiment and watch the two in a row. I'd be most honored if you could send me the results so I can post them here as well.


Art&Sound: One word: Beautiful. That's all there is to say to it.


Character:  The protagonist is indeed pretty much blank on backstory, but there's a good reason for that. She's a sweet girl any way you look at it though. 

                     Then the four "cards": Shin-Hearts (Cups); Ikki-Spades (Swords); Kent-Clover (Clubs); Toma-Diamonds (Coins); 

                     Now let's get ezoteric. Look at the description of these tarot cards:


-Knight of Cups: Passionate, Profound, Calm on the outside but fiery in soul. In a relationship, it represents a beginning.


-Knight of Swords: Rational, Brave, The one who valors victory above all else. In a relationship, it represents break-up. 


-Knight of Clubs: Intelligent, Noble, Speaks his mind regardless of situation. In a relationship, it represents uneasiness.


-Knight of Coins: Persevering, Sure in own forces. in a relationship, it represents stability created in time. 


                   Sounds familiar? Thought as much. I also saw some connection of the episodes to the first 12 major arcanas, not counting 0 The Fool. I am quite an amateur though in the matter of tarot, so if you are more skilled and find something, tell me. (Pretty please?)


Enjoyment: Start to Finish. Reason is obviously the storyline.



Overall: 10/10. I'm open to discussion if you wish to.

This show is bad. Bad with a capital B. It's only redeeming quality is it's art and the ending, which I liked quite a lot. This is a case of the destination being worth more than the journey. Because the journey is bland and it sucks. 
The core story has so much potential. I really love the premise of what is happening to the main character and the world. If the anime only revolved around the 'true lover' and the baseline plot, while leaving the other guys as support characters instead of trying so hard to be an otome, I think this could have beena very good show. \n\n
And just because a character has amnesia it doesn't mean they have no personality.There's a right way and a wrong way to write amnesiacs. Most people write them the wrong way and treat them like stoic blank slates. This show is a prime example.

This is a little bit unusual anime to be honest. I never watched an anime that involves "time travelling" so it was interesting to watch.
Story: The story was made really great. It kinda had like this mystery theme to it. At first I couldn't really understand what's going on, but after couple episodes it became clear.
The end was kinda sad though. I wish it was a better end. And everyone's back round  story was amazing too...
Art: I really liked characters eyes, hairs, cloths. It was something you don't see in every anime. The art in general was good. 
Enjoyment: It was fun to watch*SPOILERS* because the main girl kept waking up and not remembering anything what happened. And every time she woke up she was with another boyfriend. So it was really interesting to see how will it end.\n\n
After all anime was great, I liked it, but I wasn't a fan of the end. In my opinion it could of been a lot better and it made me ask some questions about her past. I would like to see them make a second season where it would tell all about her pass and what actually happened to her after it...\n\n
But I do suggest to watch it.

I'm so and completely annoyed with this show. Like the MALE characters in this show seemed so interesting but should have had more of a story to tell. Then don't get me started on Heroine! She had no sense what so ever! I mean i know she lost her memory but DAMN!! Also I had much higher expectations for the meaning of the cards. Like I understand what they meant in the very but you dont see which one she picks. ( I feel like it was Obvious who she picked) and i also i wish they showed us just a little bit of theworld she picked as well. Over all this anime was a disappointment from all the anime's I've completed.

I stumbled upon this on Hulu and I really enjoyed the art from the picture so I decided to watch it.
I was beyond confused during the first two episodes but then I started to understand. I figured there had to be something important to the date and why she kept going back. At first I thought I had it figured out, in which she could only spend 3-4 days before she was knocked back. I was wrong. 
I enjoyed the characters, I found them interesting. The story I wish they would have worked on. After watching it all the way to the end and thinkinglogically, I understood the storyline and appreciated it a bit more but I don't think it had totally been executed to the fullest. It seemed her personality changed with each new storyline so even the person she was the begin with wasn't the girl that was in each of the worlds. 


I did enjoy the open endedness of the ending. 


I wish they had fleshed out Orion and why he was there a bit more. I feel they needed a scape goat with him as to why she was going through time. 


Overall, it wasn't the worst series I have watched but I'm probably not going to watch it again. I may but only if I run out of other things to watch.

perpetually confused girl cycles through color coordinated edgy clowns because a dude done did a homura on her
So, imagine you have a serious emotional story. You have beautiful art, atmosphere, music, making this dreamlike and calm setting. The gimmick isn't too original, but it is portrayed funkily, leading you on with a sense of mild confusion. The art and setting makes it bearable, even if the plot itself fails to interest you. Then you dress up all the love interests like edgy clowns, and give them exaggeratedly poor/fuckedup/asshole behaviors, and spin them around, and suddenly it becomes a circus of dreamlike weirdness.
See, the real mysteryof this show is between its characters. The main heroine is so vapid that her dulled responses to even the most abstractly abnormal weird-ass dudes that she cycles through, is just so out of place and dumb that it overpowers the setting and plot itself in terms of surrealism.\n\n
It is truly a unique experience, and i rather enjoyed it.

So if you looked at my rating of the anime, you'd notice that everything is 10 in my book.
Why? Well it's simple really. Amnesia is an outstanding anime that will literally blow your mind in the end. I know that in the beginning it seems like a simple plot, and the title doesn't really help at all in that aspect, but this is seriously a complex anime that fools everybody until the very end. 
As for the story line, like I said earlier it doesn't seem like much. The heroin of the story apparently looses her memories, and goes on a journey to recover them.Now that right there sounds simple right? Really? Well it's not. For this anime, I highly advise you not to be fooled by the so called 'cliche' because this anime turns that concept into something so intriguing, and I guarantee that you will be hook by the third episode. The suspense is killer, and will utterly break you in the end. 


It is very difficult to come across high definition art these days. I believe that the style this anime has completely enhances the story line. Sure you look up pictures on google and think the art is utter booty but you don't know how wrong you are. The art is amazing and completely helps the story line. Just go to hulu and do yourself a favor. You can get a free account, the only thing you would have to pay for is hulu plus, but you don't HAVE to get it. Amnesia is free on there, and that I promise you.


Now as for the sound, I believe it's on point. The heroin's voice isn't so shrilly or high that it makes you want to kill yourself, and the voice actors did a really good job matching their voices to the scene.


This leaves us with character, and let me tell you now that each and every character is developed so much that it's scary. Each character has a different personality, and I guarantee that in the end you might be rooting for them to be the Heroin's boyfriend or intended. Heroine unlike most female anime characters is very likeable, and throughout the series I found myself crying in some parts. Just imagine me, the fiercest Firediva of them all crying because of some anime named Amnesia. It's the feels people, the feels. 


I'm going to do enjoyment and overall in one paragraph because I feel like I enjoyed the overall series. The characters were on point, and the plot was too. Even now 1 year later, my mind is still reeling from shock, and i'm about to watch it again on hulu. Just know that you will LOVE amnesia, and if your mind is so blown that you just NEED to talk about it, feel free to contact me. I know what it feels like.


In conclsion, WATCH THE ANIME!!!

Okay so my review will not be extremely detailed but then again, this anime wasn't very detailed either so I don't feel it deserves it.  
Story:The idea of this show seemed interesting to me because I, like many people who are probably reading this while trying to decide if they should watch it, love reverse harems! However, it is hard to get into the many romance partners the heroine has when the main girl herself doesn't know much about them and doesn't seem to gain any information about them(which you think would be important especially because maybe just maybe it would help her gether memories back...which she doesn't seem to concerned with).   The story jumps every time she dies.  This means that she could be the super hot dude one minute, end up getting killed and wake up in her bed to find out she has a whole new relationship!  So you don't like the blue haired guy? Not your cup of tea? Just jump in front of a bus and you get a shot at another guy(this isn't a spoiler I am just throwing it out there I promise).\n
Art: All I can say is that the eyes are godly and this show is beautiful eye candy.  The men are all amazing and the art almost makes up for the heroines lack of personality(and name)!\n
Sound: Meh no complaints, I wasn't as amazed as I was with the art but it really isn't bad.\n
Character: Okay so the guys can be considered the "typical" harem group but then again there is more to them then just that.  They are attractive, seductive, and most importantly just want to throw themselves at the Heroine.  I mean that is all that really matters right? Right? Q.Q\n
But anyway I digress.....the main problem I had was with the Heroine....who would've probably been better off if she was mute.  She wasn't very interesting and if it weren't for the guys I would've dropped this show way sooner than I had.\n
Overall: Hey it is a bunch of hot guys throwing themselves at a girl with no name!  Guess it makes it easier to place yourself in her shoes when the guys aren't saying her name every second...I mean come on everyone knows that ruins the moment!  Okay but seriously, you can find a much better reverse harem somewhere else but if you really want to try it then go for it! You may actually like it so don't let everyone' s negativity(including mine) stop you!

Okay so this is a tough one to enjoy and if it wasn't for the AMAZING artwork I would have stopped at episode 2 or 3. But no I pushed though and actually learnt to love this.
So the story.. 
.. Without going too deep the protagonist which was kept nameless. (Often referred to as Heroine) has been involved in an accident and guess what? Yeah she has amnesia.. You didn't see that one coming did you?
Throughout the anime she is continuously pulled back to the day august 1st and to her discovery! she's with a different man, the personally of her friends has changed slightly..


I've only given this a 6 because there is no real story until later into the anime but because she has amnesia a real story would not work so yeah. 


Art!


Well then. Amazing.. beautiful colours and contrasts the best part in my opinion.(10)


Sound!


Can't think of any qualms here. The soundtrack is nice and matches the style of the anime. I can't complain. (10)


Character.. 


Now again like the story character development is lacking but yeah, She does have amnesia and as the writer wants you to be in a state of confusion much like heroine. 


Orion the fairy has to be one of my favorite anime character personalities of the year! Herorine has no real character she spends most of the anime confused with very little input. This perhaps could have been worked on so for that i will only give this a 7.


Enjoyment.


As I've already stated at the start of this review I found it very difficult to continue watching at the first few episodes, later in the anime it starts to get repetitive but then as the story starts to unfold i really couldn't wait for next weeks episode. In terms of enjoyment for spring 2013 it's pretty much 3rd place. But then again the competition this spring was kinda lame anyway. (8)


Overall.


Trying to be non bias as possible I'm considering how others would feel watching it and honestly I don't see everyone liking this. If you like beautiful artwork then give it a go because that really made this anime for me. So for that I have only given it a 7.


Thank you for reading, This was only my second review I hope I'm improving comment on my profile if you feel like leaving feedback. Good bye!

A mi punto de vista, me pareció interesante... aunque al principio esta algo confusa y difícil de entender la historia; pero por los últimos capitulos se va entendiendo toda la historia y el porque sucedieron las cosas, es recomendable verlo para las personas que les gustan los géneros de shoujo, romance y fantasía. 
Otra de las cosas que se me hicieron interesantes de esta historia, fue el estado de la protagonista en el que se encontraba ya que, sufría de amnesia y esto a su vez le ocasiono algunos problemas que tenia que afrontar; pero por el lado positivo se encuentran todos los momentos quevivió con cada uno de los chicos! :) \n\n
Sobre el final, me pareció muy buen final aunque un poco abierto, fue lo que no me gusto mucho del anime; en fin... hay mucha drama al final :)

TLDR; For actually understanding the story and characters, the otome is more recommended. The anime did a poor job of expressing this making everything fall flat. Art and music are good however.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 I originally watched the show first. I thought it was interesting and I really liked the music and art.
However, now I decided to read the otome and seriously? The anime leaves so many gaps and what made the story in the otome interesting. The anime just flounces around not really getting to the point with any of them. It is just confusing. 
Art:
The art is probably the best part of the entire show.I love the gradients for coloring and the interesting eyes. 

As for animation though.... What is going on with their walking?

It gets very shaky, making it very hard to look at.   9/10


Sound:

Thoroughly enjoyed it. The opening is still one of my favourites of all time. It is very catchy. The ending not as much. 


Character:

In the anime they ruined majority of them T m T In the anime Shin never get better and showing how caring he is, they just make him this very forceful character and it's just bad. A lot of his story that was in the otome is never explained nor does it explain any of the character's story version of how she got amnesia -,- 


The characters are rushed through and almost as if they anime creators didn't bat much of an eye to the otome.


They totally left Kent in the dust. There's so much they could have done and they barely gave him screen time.


The most closely tied to the otome would have to be Toma.  He's also the only one where they went through his whole story but very fast...


Everyone else was screwed over  very badly and it didn't help they tried to rush each character's story into 1 1/2- 2 eps -,- And they didn't even get their full story either... Like the first maybe 10 mins of playthrough of the otome...


Then there's the fact that in the anime Orion just pops in and out? Like what is with that?  Orion is supposed to be around majority of the time..


Overall to just put it quickly the anime killed the characters making them more bland. 


Enjoyment:

Ukyo's story probably was the most engaging episodes for me.

Before I knew about the anime, I was intrigued. I found the characters interesting all in their own ways and the art style really brought me in, but not having read the otome... oh boy... how did I like this anime?  After reading, it became less appealing and making me question thoroughly why the anime cut out sooooo much. No wonder everyone finds it super confusing and hard to follow.

Amnesia is a Japanese visual novel series by Idea Factory with a total of six games. The anime is from the studio Brain's Base and has twelve episodes + an OVA. Now, I liked Amnesia and thought it was pretty well paced for a twelve episode anime. Though one thing that pissed me off is that we never found out the main characters name. 
Story line: Amnesia's story line was very intriguing. The thought of a girl having lost her memories and jumping from parallel worlds is very interesting. Personally I liked the plot for this anime. It kept me going and keeping me invested.Not knowing what's exactly going on and being on the same page as the main character was very exciting. Also stressful.  Now the how Neil thing did randomly come up, there suddenly being this man who was the one who caused the main character to jump from world to world was random but did give us answers. 


Characters: The characters weren't my favorite part of this anime. The two I think stand out the most would be Ukyo and Shin. Shin is the first world we get and he is very interesting. From his style of clothing to his personality really made me invested in his story line. I never got bored when he was on screen. Aside from him we have Ukyo who takes the cake. A guy with a two part personality, one good and one bad was amazing. One time he was nice and next thing you knew he was threatening the main character with a knife. He was my favorite character in this anime and kept me liking him until the very end. Kent was a pretty interesting guy as well. The way he talked and thought was very interesting, though I was pretty angry that he only got one episode to talk about him and the main character. Ikki I personally hated but his story line was interesting. While the story about his eyes were weird, it was also very cool. Don't even get me started on Toma. At first I liked him and then his story line came along. I'm not even gonna talk about it go watch the anime if you haven't already. Now the main character who I personally call Chloe, since she looks like one to me, was what I think you'd call dumb but smart. At times I wanted to punch her and knock some sense into her, but at other points I was on her side. I never hated her though, since she went through pretty tough stuff.


Animation: The animation was normal, like what you'd find in lots of other animes but what really got me was the character designs. Each character had a distinctive look to them. From the way they dressed and talked, it gave them all memorable ways I'd say. Now the eye designs really remind me of the Diabolik Lovers eyes, did anyone else feel that?


Music: The soundtrack was average. My favorite piece of music would have to be the instrumental version of the opening. Now don't get me wrong, the opening was really great and catchy, but the instrumental version has you going with feelings especially with the final scene between Orion and Chloe. 


Overall, I truly recommend this anime. If you like mystery and romance, you'll like Amnesia.

Five Guys, One Girl a Fairy and Amnesia.
Pretty much this sums up the whole story. 
Story:The story starts with a girl that wakes up and remembers nothing. The story is the typical I don't remember things so I say yes and agree w/ everything trying to act cool but you can clearly see that I don't remember basic things bout myself. Care you find the Heroine (we don't actualy get our heroine's name so we just call her that). Every time a loop happens and we find ourselves on zero starting from scratch, trying to undestand what will happen. Note that each time a newguy is interested in our heroine. 6/10


Art: The art in this anime is pretty amazing. The characters have very nice looks and exceptionaly beautiful eyes. Just watching this anime's art makes you wanna give it a try 9/10


Sound: Not sth to be amazed at except for the OP sung by Yanagi Nagi, Zeotrope is a rly amazing OP that'll be stuck in your mind for a little while. Now the OST in the anime is nothing to be amazed at, fairly good, nothing better but nothing worse though. 7/10


Character: Charter Development is sure not the strong point of this show. We get to see a little on the guys backstory but not so that you can like them or feel sth for them. Our heroine though get zero charcter development, as I said we don't even get to know her name. In each story she starts growing some feelings bt after the loops takes place it's like nothing ever happened. 5/10

Overall: It's worth the time to watch this but not to go crazy about it, you'll watch it, like it for the moment and then forget about it until you hear the OP or see a character and remember everything. 7/10


Hope this helps you out. HF.

Amnesia is what you would call "self insertion romance" I suppose, except don't go in without protection.
After watching Spice and Wolf for the first time, I was pining for a good romance fix.  This was not it.  :(
As a lonely alcoholic 30-something chick, it's normally easy for me to live and love vicariously through the characters in these kinds of shows, but this one was different.  Maybe it was the thought of being surrounded by oddly dressed emaciated youths.  Or maybe the guys just weren't all that great.  Maybe it's the fact that they never gave the MC a name,poor girl.  (That's analogous to not drawing the eyes in hentai, by the way.)  Either way, this one just didn't draw me in.  She is totally unrelatable to me.  Besides, I'm not half as cute as she is.  And that hair of hers---always perfect, always in that perfect little flower bun.  She can sleep for days on end and still looks fucking perfect.  Bitch.  Also, those socks do NOT go with that dress.


The only guy I didn't find any hangups with was Kent.  He was really weird, but adorable.  ("Adorkable?")  I would totally hang out in his office all day just because.  By the way, that boy is no grad student.  That is a young professor's office if I've ever seen one.  All he needs is another 20 years of refusing to be moved out of the same office, and things will begin to take (lose?) shape.


I gave the story a 2 because they managed to get the structure right for one of these kinds of shows.  i.e.: Establish a "blank slate" MC as a substrate for insertion of viewer's self, enumerate all of the boys, and then contrive a situation where the MC gets to learn more about each of them individually---their fears, flaws, secrets, heal their hearts, whatever.  It's almost forgivable if the overarching story doesn't make any goddamned sense, but in this show there are some really glaring plot holes even within the span of a single scene that made impossible the suspension of disbelief.  And honestly, this kind of thing works way better for otome games than it does for anime or manga.


Art gets a 4, because the cards motif was a passable (but likely) metaphor for all the plot shuffling this show does.  However, the delivery was kind of messy, almost like they weren't confident in their idea of what playing cards actually are.  Hmm.


Sound gets a 4.  I watched the English dub, which was...well, I don't want to call it "bad" because I respect the work of the VAs on this project.  It's almost like the dub was an independent satire of the original work.  It was hilariously bad, because the characters were bad.  It was like watching Samsung's video on how to return your exploding Galaxy Note 7.  If you are an English speaker then I recommend that you watch the English dub, or else you will be missing out.


Characters get a 2....Kent scores a single point here for the whole team.  I really liked Kent.  Minus him, everyone else makes it a 1.  The ones who are supposed to be likable are creepy or insane.  Everyone else is bland.  This series is way too short to have this many characters.  I would prefer to see more depth with fewer characters.


Enjoyment gets a 4, in the same way that terrible movies can be enjoyable to gawk at.


Overall, I think the story and the characters create the maximum score for this show, in spite of the somewhat more amusing things going on with the art and the voice acting.


If-and-only-if you're the kind of person who's into watching bad movies or shows just to make fun of them, then I would recommend Amnesia.

One of the things I like to point out before judging anime that is based off of an otome game is that potential viewers/readers should realize exactly what I just wrote: the anime is based off of an otome game. That said, there are certain conventions that usually follow, which explain why certain parts of the story function the way that they do.
For an otome anime, I would say that Amnesia wasn't terrible. I have watched much worse. I thought that the art and the music was quite good, so in that respect we can at least say that it isn't complete garbage. 
I liketo defend otome anime because I play otome games and I don't think there's anything wrong with creating an anime for people who can't/don't want to play the game(s). I see anime based off of otome games as a way for people to be introduced to the general plotline and characters (notice that I said general). So I'll go through what people complain about with this anime most often.


The protagonist/heroine has no personality: This is a convention of otome games. The protagonist (unfortunately) usually has weak personality so that the player (or viewer) can project themselves onto the character. It's difficult for players to relate to a heroine that has a very strong personality because the heroine might otherwise say/do things that is unrelatable to the player. 


The plotline is confusing/doesn't make sense: Unfortunately Amnesia has a generally confusing plotline AND the anime is trying to give viewers a general idea of the game while cutting corners. I think you can understand where the short-comings arise. That said, I have not actually played the games (yet) and I understood the plot perfectly fine. In most otome games you won't understand what is going on in situations like Amnesia until the very end. I play a lot of otome games, so I understood this convention when I started to watch the anime and I accepted it. I understand that it irritates other people who don't like to see this in anime because obviously anime isn't the same thing as an otome game. 


The other characters/guys are boring/weird: These characters also follow certain conventions. If you play a lot of otome games, you will notice a general pattern with the kind of characters/guys available for the heroine/player to date. I thought the guys in Amnesia were fairly standard. This doesn't necessarily mean they aren't "boring," but I thought a few of their personalities were to be expected. 


Sexual harassment in the series: This is probably a controversial point for me to make, but it is difficult to apply Western feminism to anime because Japan does not conform to these ideas. I'm not saying that particular things in the series are NOT sexual harassment/problematic, but I think that many viewers forget that this anime was not created with Western ideas in mind. For example, many people complain about (SPOILERS) the part in the anime when Toma puts the heroine in a cage. He is basically holding her hostage. Have the reaction you want to this information - but in Japan, this is serving a certain demographic of people who like very problematic/forceful love interests - even delving into the yandere genre. I'm not ready to police the production of games/anime/entertainment on the basis of those fantasies being problematic, but that's just my opinion. 


Concluding thoughts: I think that as an anime, Amnesia is fairly mediocre. Taking into account that it is made based off of an otome game, I don't think it's that bad. I think that there are some better ones, but it isn't the worst. It follows the same conventions that all the otome games I have played follow. I don't think it should be faulted for those things.

This anime is meant to be enjoyed by otome fans, if you're not one, the chances are that you won't enjoyed it at all.
I guess the game was really good, but let's have in consideration that otome's adaptations never fullfill fans expectations, since it shows all routes, or none
From an otome fan perspective who already knows all of the above: great story, handsome boys, mystery in it's athmosphere. It's mostly of what you would expect of this genre, the main character is quite dull, considering that it's an otome adaptation, where you make the mc's desicions. The art, character design, music and animation are reallygood, I enjoyed it.

Okay, so Amnesia. Stumbled upon it from a cool lookin wallpaper. Lets get into my review, and trust me when i say this, i think my view on it is a little bit different from others.
Story 8/10: I am actually giving it a 8/10 just because it has a unique concept and i must say that they carried it out pretty nice. Read the "Synopsis"/discription of the anime. The story is told to the viewer like you are apart of the "memorie loss". Becasue of this story might appear quite slow and you really dont understand that much troughout alot of episodes and alot ofpeople dislike that. I think the studio had a unique concept and they carried it out great. The way it was presentet to the viewer gives you  alot of new/different thoughts, feelings and emotions that no other anime has given me. Therefor my score.



Art 8/10: I'm not giving this a 10 just because i have seen alot of other animes with more appealing artsyles to me. But i think that the small touches that they had i gave it more depth. For example, some characters (everyone but the main character i believe) has different "styled" eyes and everyone has really cool clothes, and i really think that it gave the anime more personality and depth. I really loved that, very different, i have not seen anything like this... yet.



Sound 7/10: I'm giving out one more 7 here, let me tell you why. When you dont care about the sound in an anime, that is when it is just right. Let me explain. The music should amplify the current feelings and situations in an anime, and i think when you dont really pay attention to it and only get "the feels", that is when they get it right. Once again, i have seen anime that has done a better job at this but i think that Amnesia did a great job to!



Character 9/10: Amnesia really gives the viewer time to get to know each character that the protagonist meets, just because that is how the story is written. I felt that they all had their own styles and feelings and relations with the protagonist and i think that they did a great job on this! I also loved their clothing styles, as previously mentioned.



Enjoyment 7/10: Amnesia gave me a bit of everything i want in an anime. Love, drama, psycho, magic/fantasy, it gets you thinking wich gets you even more engaged the story. If i wouldn't have enjoyed it i would have dropped it, and i have dropped a few other "popular" animes out there. 



Overall: I had a little bit of everything i want in an anime and i liked it alot. And that is why i am writing this review, this is the first and only anime that gave me new and differend feelings and that had everything that i ask for in an anime. It was not perfect but it was great! And that is why im writing this review, its one of few i think deserve a little bit highers score than it has! Great work! Thanks for reading and have a great one!

I am writing this review because there are certainly two different sides to whether or not Amnesia will be enjoyable for you, and I would like to offer a little more perspective into it after seeing this argument with 'The game was better, but the anime deserves recognition too.'
I've rewatched this a few times since I first came across it as a newly made anime addict. Amnesia was a lot of firsts for me: reverse harem, romance, or just the first anime I ever watched through completely.
What put me at a disadvantage is I went into the series completely trusting the synopsis that had beenprovided; a show covering an amnesiac and her many beautiful LI? Count me in.

Except the show wasn't nearly as simple as that.


Since then I've played through the otome game Amnesia: Memories it was based off, rewatched the show knowing the source material, and come up with my final opinion.


In this review I will be comparing the game and the anime as a way to explain my reservations. I understand that this might be an annoying thing to do for the fans of the anime, or a casual reader, but I really want to show you that this story is DEFINITELY worth forming your own opinion about because the two types of media are very different in how they present the story and I want you to choose the one that will help you enjoy the story the best.


STORY 3/10


The moment it became clear that the show was going to try and squeeze in hours and hours of character development for each guy's personal route within 12 episodes AND STILL TRY TO MAKE IT ONE COHERENT STORY is ridiculous. You'd need far more episodes to try and pull it off. 

As a new anime fan last year, the idea that the MC was jumping from character to character without really acknowledging the LI that came before the current one made me very baffled, not to mention disoriented.

It is EXHAUSTING trying to keep up with a show that hasn't really explained anything about what is going on - instead leaving us to rely on Orion for random tidbits of information when relevant.


It is extremely frustrating to watch a show that constantly shifts what is true and isn't true due to the amount of parallel universes that are constantly being introduced. It's no wonder, when Shin's route (the first one you'll watch) finishes and the MC is suddenly taken to a completely different world, and takes everything in her stride that yes Ikki is now her boyfriend...? As a viewer, I didn't even realise that the anime included jumping from parallel world to parallel world (although I'm inclined to believe that this could be my mistake as well). I was extremely confused.


Any thoughts of satisfaction you might have had after investing yourself a few episodes deep (and thinking you were actually progressing the plot) is taken away, and suddenly you have to start from scratch, figuring out how this new parallel world works; who the MC is friends with now; who her enemies are; who works at the cafe with her or not... all these things change every few episodes as she goes through each world.

Nothing is steadfast, and when you binge this show like I did, there isn't enough time to process it and hence how I managed to watch a show that made me really uncomfortable and cramped with the pacing. Playing the game gives you a lot more breathing room to consume the story and fully understand what is actually going on.


And there is no payoff.

In the game as you might expect, you choose one single character route, play through it and depending on the choices you made, get a good ending or a bad ending *with that character*. There is a payoff to the hours of reading and playing you've put into the story - you get a snippet of what the MC's life is like after spending so long gathering memories and reforming relationships.


No such luck with the anime.

Trying to keep the spoilers to a minimum, the MC does not end up with anyone. We don't see what happens when she returns to her own world with her memories. And that is the frustrating thing when you end up spending around 4 hours trying to keep up with multiple storylines and the ending throws it all away and tells you that it never really mattered.


ART AND SOUND 10/10


I am pleased to say I cannot utter a single complaint about the art or sound. The OP and ED are GORGEOUS. The OP is something I end up listening to on a regular basis ever since I came across it, and even in the soundtrack there are some gems - Ukyo's Melody for example? I wish it had been in the game because it suited the general mood of the story beyond perfectly.

And you only have to look at the art to realise how wonderful it is. Amnesia probably has my favourite art in an anime ever and I love the style of each of the characters - especially the choice of colours. Aesthetically pleasing? Absolutely.


CHARACTER 2/10


This is where I get into my real issues with the show. The MC and Orion. You're gonna end up spending a lot of time with these two so naturally they have to be strong characters, or moderately okay characters, right?

Did the game do this? Without a doubt.

Did the anime? *laughs*


If you're wondering why Orion is even in the show to begin with asides from plot convenience at the beginning, that's how you know something is wrong. To give you an idea of his role in the game, Amnesia: Memories was very loose with their characterisation of the MC. In the game, Orion is basically the player's window into the world; and is the voice of narration for most of the game. He'd guide the player through scenes, explain the consequences of specific choices, and says his piece when Toma did that one thing and the MC forgives him anyway.

Until the ending has arrived, the MC barely says a thing, which I thought to be a very refreshing idea for an otome game.


But obviously, that leaves the writers at a disadvantage for the anime because they have to try and bring to life this MC character who was basically just a shell for players like me to hide behind to play through the game as.

Problems immediately arise with Orion in the anime - it isn't a game, so there are no choices to be made, and his comments about the current situation are brought to a minimum, making his character suffer dramatically.


When I watched the anime the first time through, I hated Orion. He was completely pointless, and I couldn't understand why he was around when all he did was argue that she couldn't go the hospital (this point is explored further in the game, but there are some routes in the game where even he ends up agreeing that a visit to the hospital for other health stuff would benefit her.) without explaining further.


Then I played the game, expecting to hate him (I literally chose mean dialogue options my first playthrough because I was that annoyed with him in the anime) and I ended up being in tears over him at the ending. It made me more frustrated rewatching to see such a vital character brought down due to the necessity of giving the MC a more active role in the anime.


Maybe it wouldn't have been so bad if the MC wasn't so frustrating to watch.

Her speciality includes blinking cluelessly when asked a simple question and staying silent, staring into space, and asking Orion what she should do for the simplest of tasks. Again this comes down to the idea that she is barely a character in the game, and the writers probably thought they could get away with it in the anime because 'Hey, she has amnesia so what do you expect?" 

She still had more of a personality in the game - emotional attachment to a character (Orion doesn't count in this example) and an incentive to recover her independent mind without constant mothering by Orion.


The guys in question have similarly annoying habits, and I actually ended up making a pretty intense workout routine (non-related but I wanted to hint at the idea for people rewatching anyway)  everytime something annoying happened because something happened every few seconds i.e: Shin brooding for no reason, Orion stating the obvious, Toma and Shin fighting for no apparent reason other than to make Toma look like a nice guy and Shin the broody guy, all the guys acting very patronising (and then kissing them like right after), Ikki being fangirled over, or Kent being an arrogant know-it-all.


The game elaborates on these behaviours, why Toma and Shin fight, Ikki's loneliness, and Kent's obliviousness to the idea that he even said something rude and feeling a little insecure (before offering to fix said behaviour if it was too much).


That's why the short time spent on each character makes the show suffer so much. At the end of the show (with the exception of possibly Shin who I felt had the strongest route in the show) there isn't someone who you'd really want to see again with the MC anyway. They come across as very weak, frivolous characters with no thought behind them whatsoever when in fact it's the opposite.


OVERALL ENJOYMENT 6/10


I was conflicted rating this anime, because it had so much potential and it got reduced to a 12 episode waste of time, yet the game is so enjoyable that I keep thinking that maybe it's just in my head and I'll enjoy it if I rewatch it one more time which never happens. No matter how much I remind myself I disliked this anime, I keep coming back to it which makes me think that it must have done something right.


If you are new to anime, do NOT watch this first. Get some more anime under your belt, so that it doesn't leave you with a bad impression of the reverse harem genre, and try to watch it knowing what you're getting into.

I would suggest Amnesia: Memories - the otome game, for someone who is serious about getting into the story and character plots. 

If you're just looking for a quick non-commital reverse harem anime to get through then you might just be okay.

The best part of this anime was the sound track and art, the rest of it was overall a disaster. Otome games are often hard to make into good anime adaptions, many people already hold a certain expectation because of the game. 
Amnesia is strange in the way that there is no clear plot to the anime and it seems like the creators attempted to include each character's route in the series. With multiple dimensional/time changes, various guys, and no solid plot this was a failure. I have no other way to say it, this anime was just a general trainwreck. I have played thegames and enjoyed them, I have seen a few other otome to anime adaptions, and I still feel disappointed from this. Normally I would write a much longer, detailed review but I honest to god cannot describe to you how poor this anime is. As I said, I played the game and knew the general background information of this anime and it was still confusing.\n\n
Your only hope for understanding this anime at all is playing the games, and even then you still probably won't get it because the creators crammed five different otome routes into 12 poorly done episodes.

To be honest, I only watched one episode since I might have known how this story will go. I really like the opening, soundtrack and the artwork on the characters and backgrounds. I didn't like the story line because it was too much for me. I only survived one episode and then I just dropped it. The main character, the girl, is ..well...I don't really know how to explain it but she just doesn't seem much bothered by all of these guys kissing her on random occasions, and she just lets it happen. That's all I got on this but I won't recommend unless youare into romance or just into these types of story lines.

I did it, I found a girl who is 100x worse than the infamous (to some) Yui from Diabolik Lovers, I wouldn’t have thought such a feat was possible, but somehow this anime managed to accomplish it. Having just re-watched Diabolik Lovers before this, I can say that Yui was a breath of fresh air compared to this girl. I get that amnesia means she doesn’t remember stuff but that doesn’t mean she needs to just stare blankly into space and act dumb. There were so many times where I just screamed at the screen for her to speak!! 
 On a positive note,The boys were very nice to look at, as one would expect with a reverse harem.

[Useless review here]
I don't see why this anime have so many low rates. It is obviously not the best anime of the world but it's pretty great. As an adaption of a Otome Game you can't ask for more,just a view for all the rutes. It shows what It wants pretty well and nothing more. If you don't like simple storys that goes from nothing then this is not your anime. I am very surprised of people talking about the boys sense of style,does that really matter when watching an anime? At reading at all the reviews I wonder if I was the only onewho cry on the last episode,it was full of feelings  for me. There sometimes that I get tired of  storys  that shows basically the same but Amnesia got me there till the end. That I would watch it again? No. I recommend it to you if you're not so demanding.  This is not exactly a shoujo anime so don't watch it expecting romance,just watch it is you want to see a girl trying to remember her past in different worlds with  diferent boys with no really conection between everything. \n

I rarely feel like writing a review, but I wanted to stand for Amnesia. First I watched Amnesia in 2013, didn't really like it and gave it a 5. After four years, I played the game, in shock by how I completely forgot everything, most of the story, the characters, the ending -truly an amnesia right... Then I rewatched the whole show, and now I'm seeing it in a whole different light. Therefore I must say it before I start; This is an anime based on a visual novel, so please bear that in mind.
Story = 9
The part I love the most in Amnesia isprobably the story. It is hooking, it never gets boring and never fails to surprise. The usage of parallel universes in this type of reverse harem storyline is pure genius. It is creative and it gets you wondering what will happen in a different setting all the time, and you could never guess. 


The other side of the coin is how they patched all stories into one story fitting in continuous sequences. In a game basis, every world is different and you go through a character, get to see an ending and start again. It is surprising that anime does not fail in portraying it. Whole anime is connected and open-ended so that you could enjoy it with an unbiased eye.


Art = 6


Art in the anime is fairly bad comparing to the game. I know it is not easy to create good visuals in anime every time, but somehow studios fail to bring the most catching component of the game ~the art~ to the anime (eg. Dramatical Murder) But, the origin is very creative, characters are drawn pretty well for most of the time, but I can't really say it was great. I really wish it could be better, then I could've enjoyed it far more.


Sound = 9


Voices are so fitting to the characters and music is very great in creating the atmosphere. I'm just very happy that they are loyal to the original voice actors/actresses. I would cry if any of them had been changed.


Character = 8


Although the main character, "heroine, you" whatever you want to call her is plain and mainstream to a fist clenching and facepalming level, I couldn't bring myself to hate it, maybe I am just used to it by now. This is not the first time a female heroine has such a character. Well, lucky for us, especially the main love interests are quite the looker and every other character besides the heroine are lively and loveable. I personally love how they come up with the idea of the manager, Waka-san.


Enjoyment = 7


I enjoyed rewatching after playing the game and actually being able to get video remakes of CG's is pure bliss. Again if the art was better it could've been very nice, but that is just my humble opinion.


Overall = 8


Overall I liked it and can proudly say it was very good. It might come as fast pacing and some scenes would have left hanging in the air for the ones who haven't played the game, but I don't think this is something to be that critical about. I believe the raison d'être of this anime is meant for the players, to begin with. I'm feeling quite positive about Amnesia, therefore I'm having high hopes in getting more of this genre in the future.

Let me just say this first: I get where everyone is coming from when they that 1) the plot is slow and 2) the main heroine is bland.  But I'd like to put my own thoughts out here based on what I have felt while experiencing this story and world unfold.
First off, like many of you may know, this anime is based off a visual novel.  More specifically, an otome game; a dating simulator story aimed towards a female audience.  Let me say straight up: the visual novel incredibly enjoyable.  The characters are great, the art is great, andthe story moves in a very exciting way.  Now, what happened to the anime you might ask.  In my own personal opinion, I feel like the fact that the original medium was this particular visual novel, the anime was bound to be less than amazing.  


This is because otome games have multiple men that you can choose and date, different routes.  These routes all have different plots and a different scenario that the heroine is thrust into.  What the anime tries to do is combine all of these routes into one overarching story, and that's what makes the anime appear to move by in a very slow pace, like nothing is happening at all.  By putting her in every route, it adds confusion, unlike the visual novel.  With a visual novel, a player chooses one man/route, and plays it to the end until they get to an ending.  Then they restart and do another route.  With an anime, the main heroine is not played by the viewer, and so picking a specific route for her to go through on her own may upset some who like other routes, so she just goes through them all.  This adds a sense of "I want more, but I guess that's it". 


I appreciate the fact that there is an anime adaptation for the game, but now I understand that it's difficult to make an anime for these types of games.  However, I enjoyed the show nonetheless, especially since I played the game and got to see my favorite characters come to life on the screen.  It brought back memories of the time I spent playing the game, and makes me want to play it again, so I can truly see each individual story in a more fleshed out way.  


Overall, this anime isn't my favorite, but I still appreciate the effort the creators took to adapt this particular otome game in this way.  If you found yourself interested in the story of this world, but were disappointed by the lack of depth, then play the game.  I fell in love with every character and every plot while playing the game, so letting a lackluster adaptation of a nearly impossible game to make an adaptation of make me love this world less, is not going to happen.

As is the problem with most otome game based anime, the protagonist has little to no strong personality traits in order to allow for a harmonious relationship with all kinds of people with all kinds of personalities. Keeping this in mind, I think Amnesia was made extremely well. 
There is a legitimate and believable reason for the protagonist's personality which, as you probably guessed, is that she has amnesia. It makes it much easier to understand the world and the characters because the viewer and the protagonist are both trying to understand what in the world is going on while trying to get to knowthe characters and the setting. 


The story I think is pretty decent and there was a good bit of thriller and mystery. It was pretty well paced and fit the atmosphere of the show itself.


Art was outstanding though I do think it has to do with preference. While I really liked the characters' eyes and fashion, I don't think everyone is of the same opinion. Regardless, I do think we can agree that the art was well done and the motions were fluid.


Sound was very good and the OP and ED fit the anime well. As is a popular marketing tactic, Amnesia has some nice character songs that you may want to check out. 


Characters were unique compared to each other but cliche if you look at the genre as a whole. You got tsundere, flirt, yandere (two actually) and a stuck up smartass. While this doesn't sound good, each of the characters do have a certain amount of depth which I think is appropriate considering both the duration of the anime and what it was based off of. 


As a side note, I highly recommend picking up the game. After watching the anime I became curious and so decided to give the game a try. It allows for a much more in depth understanding of the characters so if you want more background, I recommend the game. 


Overall I enjoyed the series and I think it is one of the most well made reverse harem anime based off of a game thanks to its original concept. It blended in the bland and boring protagonist with its story fluidly, which I think is very impressive considering that has always been one of the weak points for most, if not all anime of the same genre.

So basically you wake up amnesiac and suddenly you have all these crazily hot guys surrounding you trying to get in your pants. A typical reverse harem anime like Norn 9, Diabolik Lovers, and Kamigami no Asobi. Literally, the visual novel is better than this rushed 12 episodes anime.
Story | 06
   It is unique as to waking up losing all your memories with a spirit to help decide your decisions for you. What could've been better is to make each episode a part of every character's road. For instance, first few episodes of Shin and then the next few of Toma. Not jumpfrom character to character wondering who is the boyfriend. I do think, they probably made the anime this way so people would be inclined to purchase the dating sim online [Which I already played through on Steam].


Art | 09

   The art isn't the best, but I enjoyed how cute the main character is. Her outfit choosing isn't bad and the maid concept is kawaii. THE MEN ARE HOT TOO SO THAT'S A PLUS [ Hint : I like Shin, Toma, and Ikki's routes]. The backgrounds are the same bunch and nothing too detailed. 


Sound | 07

   Ohkay the music was mediocre. The opening was fine and I actually liked the ending more than the opening. Maybe some dramatic or soothing music would've been nice.


Character | 05

   The main character will piss you off in the anime. Her character in the visual novel is so much better. She's very weak, which is normal being amnesiac, but everyone just comes to her rescue like? There isn't any character development at all, you just go from guy to guy, very rushed, back story and all, and it's just that.


Enjoyment | 06

   I enjoyed the visual novel more than I enjoyed the anime. I didn't understand anything at all that went down in the anime until I played the game. Literally, from guy to guy, no stable plot nor character development. It's better to get the game, legit.


Overall | 07

   I wouldn't watch this again. Like i've said probably xxx times already, get the game for better story, plot, and character development.

This anime left me confused, and concerned. Throughout this whole anime, I was very confused with the plot and story line, which was smashed into a number of 12 episodes, which included attractive men. Now I have nothing against harems. Harems are simply amazing, but this one I really didn't enjoy as much as the harems I have watched before, Kiniro no primo passo, brothers conflict, glass no kamen, kimi no todoke, skip beat. The list goes on for hours.
This anime was a complete confusion to me. In my opinion the protagonist was a little slow. When she was getting completely hit on, or flirtedwith, she just acted like she never saw what was happening, which made me want to hit the screen and smash my head through my window.


The protagonist made this anime harder to watch. I would have liked this anime to have had more interesting scenes, but because this anime was made in a matter of a few days at the least, everything was built together and slapped on, with a ribbon.


When something actually interesting was about to happen, the main character, was so oblivious to the situation that it ruined the romance, and the somewhat comedy.


When things were actually interesting, It was just falling apart because the characters were honestly retarded.

The only thing I can complain about, is how the protagonist wasn't smart and oblivious.

I understand that she has amnesia, but I think in situations, if I was even remotely in a situation like, being beat up, or getting kissed, I would do something.

But in this situation, she did nothing, and sat like a throw pillow for 12 episodes that never actually ended on the right foot.


This anime is just a bunch of pretty boys, and a dumb, a very dumb, and oblivious main character, whom I don't remember the name to.


The art wasn't terrible, the sound was alright, but the whole situation was annoying, I completely understand not remembering things, but the main character as I said, was very oblivious to the most easiest situations.


Like she just sat there, like my pillow and did nothing but stare for 12 episodes.

Like girl, do something. YOU NEED TO STOP JUST STARING.


It made me so annoyed, that it took me like a day to finish the anime, when It usually takes me a few days, when I really don't want to finish an anime.


Watch it if you like boring animes, But ugh. This anime is NOT SOMETHING I recommend.

A spark of consciousness ignites, and as you open your eyes, the darkness fades, revealing a blurry, out of focus face. As your eyes adjust to the light, you can see concern giving way to relief in the expression of... Who? Who is this person standing over you, and why is she wearing such a funny costume? She calls out to another person in the room, stating “She’s awake,” and you take a second to wonder where you are. This isn’t the first time your mind had to catch up with you when you woke up somewhere unusual... Or is it? It certainly feels likeyou’ve been through this before, but have you? And has it ever taken this long to fully regain consciousness?


You start to think about getting up and going home, only to realize with a sudden shock that you can’t remember where you live. Do you live alone in an apartment? Do you still live with your parents? Who ARE your parents? And for that matter, who are you? Just as you’re noticing that you’re wearing the same funny costume as the girl who woke you up, you hear male voices in the room, and two very attractive guys... One blonde, one brunette... Show up, and begin to fawn over you. One of them acts a little coldly, as though he’s trying to keep his emotions in check. The other starts to worry about you openly, almost as if he’s been in this position many times before. What is your relationship with these strange boys? Why are they dressed like strippers from Wonderland? One thing is certain... You can’t let them know you’ve lost your memories. Because banana.


Amnesia was produced by a company called Brain’s Base. I had not hear of this company until today, and if my Facebook poll results are any kind of evidence, you probably haven’t either. That’s a real shame, because they’re actually kind of amazing. They’ve put out a lot of highly visually impressive shows, such as Baccano, Penguindrum, and Durarara!! One of my favorite ways a company can achieve visual splendor is by carefully and skillfully allocating their budget so that not a single cent is wasted or wanted for. Amnesia is actually a perfect microcosm of their work, insofar as the fact that it has a lot of money to spend on big-budget special effects, intricately detailed and deliberately lit backgrounds, and an attention to detail that carries over to an outstanding sense of quality control.


The human characters don’t move much, but the movements they make are just fluid enough so that no viewer should ever have to complain about them looking cheap. It also helps that the series had a really smart sense of visual direction behind it, and unlike a lot of shows, the 2D and 3D animation complement each other perfectly. One thing people may complain about is something Brain’s Base had no real control over... The character designs. While the art style and the anatomical qualities of the human characters may be pleasing to the eye, this series completely jumps the shark in three areas... Hair, clothes, and eyes.
