I alluded in the plot synopses that each male character in our heroine’s harem is designed with a different suit from a deck of cards in mind. There’s a hearts boy, a diamonds boy, a clubs boy, a spades boy, and even a Joker boy. Oh and there’s also a boy only she can see, who looks like the Homestuck version of Peter Pan, if you can believe it.


If there’s one good thing I can say about these character designs, it’s that if you cosplayed one of them, you wouldn’t be confused for any other show. Unless somebody really thought that Wonderland had a Chip’n’Dales club. Each boy is adorned with the symbol of their respective suit, as well as different styles of leather jackets, including a hooded variety, a turtleneck variety, a too-small variety, and a duster variety. Of course, because reverse harems do occasionally follow the rules a of regular harems, they’re also color-coded, mainly through the artificial coloring in their male scene hair. They also never change clothes unless they’re at work, meaning that they wear these weird get-ups in public, day after day, without fail. Yes, this is common in some anime, but not in slice-of-life anime, damn it!


The music is nice at first, but it can become wearisome really quickly. It’s mostly piano, and as pretty as it might be at a glance, it becomes repetitive, much like your typical visual novel soundtrack... tunes are meant to be played for long periods of time in the background while the player reads through dialogue and occasionally makes a choice, and that style sadly doesn’t translate well to animation. The opening, on the other hand, is outstanding. The song is called Zoetrope, and it’s a ice listen regardless of whether you’re watching the video or not, but combined with the on-pace video does a much better job of making the main character and the main plot of the show interesting than ANYTHING in the actual story does. It goes through the tired cliche of showcasing all of the Harem character profiles, but it does so really quickly, instead spending the majority of it’s time showing the heroine lost and confused in a dark abyss full of phantom playing cards.


The English dub was done by Funimation, and I really want to try to be nice about this, because the cast was obviously trying their hardest with the material given to them. It’s hard to like any of them, not because they performed badly, but because there wasn’t really any room in the show to perform well. Add to that a cast who’s biggest name is Christopher Ayres, and you have to wonder just how many of their biggest names must have looked at the script and refused outright to have anything to do with it(And if this IS the case, God bless Emily Neves and Jay Hickman for having the decency to at least take bit parts). I’m not sure why they bothered dubbing this anime in the first place, since there’s really nothing any American actor could add to the experience.


Maggie Flecknoe is our main character, presumably because she’s the only actor they had who’s bland and easy enough to overlook that they knew a nameless character with no agency or personality wouldn’t make her look any worse. Not surprisingly, she also played the hapless female lead in Diabolik Lovers(She’s also further proof that Log Horizon could get a good performance out of literally anyone). Her role never demanded any big emotional commitment from her, and like a true paycheck-desiring trooper, she didn’t bother trying to give it one. Houston Hayes and Chris Ayres actually got to put some emotion into their roles, even if that emotion began and ended with “I’m pissed off at you.” Shannon Emmerick didn’t do a bad job with the cutesie Ryuksie character Orion, but then again, playing young male voices is kind of her only viable career option, s let me ask once again, “How many A-list VAs turned this series down?”


Considering Sentai has to be picky with which shows they dub and which ones they don’t, and considering how they’re able to take one look at a piece of shit like Detroit Metal City and say “ehhhh, maybe not this one,” I’m honestly surprised they put forth the money to put this series out in English... On Blu-Ray, no less! I mean, I’m sorry, but this is one of those rare occasions when the type of story being told, and the kind of character tropes being portrayed, there really isn’t any real American equivalent to the material. They probably should have released this one in Japanese only, and yeah, that’s also how you should probably view it. One Luci Christian role... Just one... Could have justified it enough for a recommendation.


I’d like to begin the writing portion of this review by running down the wonderful cast of characters that are featured in this gem. Let’s start with the main character, named... She actually doesn’t have a name. When she wakes up with amnesia, she never asks anybody for any details about her life, which means that through the entire anime, we never learn her name, her family status, or even how old she is, which would be unforgivably creepy if a quick look at wikipedia didn’t list her as an 18 year old college freshman. She’s listed in the credits as ‘heroine,’which is a laugh, because ‘hero’ and ‘heroine’ are titles you’d give to characters who are active, show positive qualities, and have some sort of agency in their lives, whereas Heroine-san seems to be the personification of the term “Just go with the flow.”


Much like Mayuri from Steins;Gate, the world is trying to kill her, but unlike Mayuri, there’s actually an in-universe explanation for it(which I won’t spoil.). She dies in each world she’s in, mainly due to the fact that she likes to run out into the street without looking first, although the fact that she can’t swim may also play a factor. Of course there are other possibilities, like Orion’s suggestion that if she doesn’t stay close to people at all times, she may forget how to breathe. A suggestion she takes seriously. Yes, a college student doesn’t know that breathing is an involuntary action that even babies do. Orion also convinces her that it would be a bad idea to tell the people in her life that she has amnesia, because like I said earlier, Banana. The only conscious decision she EVER makes is picking a lock to get out of a cage, and the only reason she does that is so she can get back to her apartment and find proof that she loves someone in order to stop them from raping her. Because that’s how rape works? She has literally no standards for dating other than “must be hot bishie,’ and to prove it, let’s see just how charming her princes are. And trust me, each one is worse than the last.


Her boyfriend in the first timeline is Shin, represented by the Heart suite. That’s actually kind of appropriate, because while none of these guys are ‘best choice’ material, I’d consider him the ‘least awful choice.’ He’s a year younger than the heroine, and he has a chip on his shoulder from society shaming him for the accidental sins of his father. He cares about her, and his main issue is with jealousy... Not a good trait to have, but a believably human one, and one that I actually would have liked to see fully worked through. Unfortunately, Heroine-san falls off a cliff and jumps to a new timeline, where she’s dating Ikki, a much more boring character who’s life has been tortured by what I’m going to call the PG rated version of Dane Cook’s curse from Good Luck Chuck. He wants her because she’s immune to his charm, and the girls who ARE obsessed with him provide a constant source of antagonism for her throughout the course of the series.


Next up, very briefly, is Kent, and if there’s an offensive stereotype for asexuality out there, he’s it. I know lots of women fall for the stoic guy with glasses... Kyoya from Ouran, I feel your pain... But they tend to have actual personality traits, like pride, or condescension, or something. Kent doesn’t have even the most basic of emotions, and every single coupley move he makes on Heroine-san can be drawn back to advice he got online or in a book. I actually AM asexual, and no, we’re not like that. We have human emotions. We understand basic human interactions. Kent is not a realistic person, which makes it extremely hard to not only relate to him, but to figure out what Heroine-san saw in him as a potential lover in the first place.


Then we have Toma, one of the most disturbingly popular reverse harem options ever. Do you remember how in the wake of Chris Brown beating up Rihana, there were flurries of women online claiming it was okay, he could beat them too if he wanted to? That’s Toma’s fanbase in a nutshell, so let me just run down what this hopeless romantic did. There are going to be minor spoilers here. He realizes Heroine lost all her memories, so he lies to her and says their dating. This is already horrible, but we’re not done. He drugs her without telling her, which she has no reaction to, even when Orion warns her about it. He then sticks her in a dog kennel... Yes, it’s a cage, but it’s also a dog kennel... and claims he’s trying to protect her. Her only reaction to this is “This isn’t you... you’re not like this...” Uh, yeah, sure, keep telling yourself that. And then, like I said, she breaks out and finds the diary on her previous self in this timeline, and it coincidentily says she loves him, which prevents him at the last second from raping her.


They make googly eyes at each other, and then in the very next shot, she’s in the hospital with a broken leg, with no explanation offered as to how it happened, and even though I know she has a knack for getting run over, I’m going to assume he broke it to keep her from running away again. Yeah, remember that romantic scene with the sledgehammer in Misery? Something like that. And then we meet the final boy, Ukyo, who’s a literal murderous psychopath with a Jekyl and Hyde style split personality, and... Can we just stop now, and admit that all of these characters are awful? Can we just all agree that this is the most unlikeable cast of main characters since The Devil’s Rejects? Like I said, Shin had potential, but honestly, he wouldn’t look nearly as appealing if he didn;t have the rest of them to compare himself to. Nothing they do registers with Heroine, nothing ever alarms her, nothing ever convinces her to avoid or refute them, and Orion isn;t any better as he just spends the series dumping exposition and giving her terrible advice.


Okay, so if the characters are terrible, how’s the plot? There is no fucking plot. Nothing that happens means anything in the grand scheme of things. As a matter of fact, you could easily skip the first four story arcs and go right to the fifth without losing anything important. The point of this series wasn’t to slowly unravel an intriguing mystery, or gradually learn more about our main character through several shocking plot twists, it was to fit every single story path from the original game comfortably into the series so fans of each one could get their jollies off at some point. It’s like the story structure of Clannad, except in that show, every arc had some sort of central purpose going forward. The only point each arc in this anime has is to make the love interest of the previous arc look more appealing by comparison.


Or maybe the point is to make them more appealing? I don’t know. I don’t understand the appeal of dangerous or possessive lovers. Yeah, Yuno from Future Diary is hot, but I still wouldn’t touch her with a sixty foot pole. Maybe I just don’t understand the whole masochism thing, or maybe I just don’t get the appeal of being controlled, because apparently these characters are considered legitimate sex symbols on Japan. Even the subject of caging, which the Japanese voice actor himself apparently found weird, can still cause half a room full of women to go crazy for him. I guess I can give a pass to this show when it comes to fans who know that what they’re watching is an unhealthy escapist fantasy that would be unsalvageably horrifying in the real world, but because I don’t like to over-estimate people that I don’t know, I’m going to have to assume there are impressionable young viewers out there... both male and female... who may catch a bad message about abusive relationships, and I can’t forgive that.


Amnesia is available from Sentai Filmworks on both DVD and Blu-ray. It was originally really expensive, but can normally be found for low prices at certain Rightstuf sales. There are about six different entries in it’s visual novel franchise, and while I don’t feel like listing them all down, a few of them are available as imports to Playstation Vita. The series can also be viewed on Crunchyroll.


Amnesia is the perfect example of a show that just gets worse and worse as it continues on. I originally didn’t think too poorly of it, as I’d been pre-warned about some of it’s early flaws, and the way it played to popular dating sim character tropes, so I was at least expecting to enjoy it on a so-bad-it’s-good basis. What I actually got was a series that was so devoid of energy and passion that I found myself dozing off through most of the episodes. And yet, as boring as it was, it’s a surprisingly dangerous series, in the same ballpark as Popotan, albeit with a different message and much more commendable animation. Amnesia could easily teach young girls that toxic behavior is forgivable in a man as long as he truly loves you, especially since the main character is specifically designed to be have no name or personality so that any viewer can imagine themselves in the role. I even found out very recently that fans of the original game hate it, and that’s saying something. I give Amnesia a 1/10.

My first review and I feel compelled to do it for Amnesia. I feel like it's not getting enough credit. It really isn't bad! It wasn't just a girl trying to pick between a swarm of boys, it had a story to it. A good one! One that keeps you thinking. I know people tend to not like being confused when they watch a show, but I find it better then your usual predictable romance.  
Story: 6 
The story could have been taken a lot further then it went. I don't think 12 episodes is enough for a strong storyline as well as characterdevelopment for all characters. But considering how short the series is, it did a fairly good job.It had a lot more going for it then your typical shojo anime. The story was fascinating and really kept you guessing throughout the whole thing. Though  at some points one could get a bit lost in what's happening. I really enjoyed how it wasn't just a romance and the concept of visiting all the different timelines/worlds/universes or whatever one could go through.  Though it's far from outstanding, It could have been much better developed, but it is good.  


Art: 9 

The art was the best thing about the show. It was absolutely stunning. a bit colorful, but who doesn't love a colorful bishonen with gorgeous eyes? The character designs were fantastic, I even liked the little card suit theme they had going on. 


Sound: 5 

It was okay I suppose. Nothing outstanding about the music. Typical shojo mood music to go along with the sparkly plot. 


Characters: 6 

Considering this was based off of a dating game, which usually does have overused sterotypes of characters. (i.e= The cool tsundere, The pretty boy, The smart guy, and The childhood friend) The characters, for the most part, were pretty solid. They took stereotypes and sort of added a little sprinkle of uniqueness into them. (Take Toma for example) 


Though the male characters were deliciously bishonen, our poor heroine is sadly a very sorry excuse for a main character. In some ways it's very excusable, considering she has Amnesia and doesn't know who she is, therefor has no real personality to begin with. But some things I couldn't take. Such as her submissiveness, naivety and overly-trusting personality. Amnesia is no excuse for not having a backbone. I really wish they made her stronger of a gal instead of someone who is relying on the men around her and the kindness of some little fairy boy. 


Enjoyment: 7

If you like reverse harem shoujos, this is pretty much what you need to be watching. I'm one of those people, so I really liked it although not so much at the beginning.
The story episodes kind of drag on in a slow fashion in the start and doesn't really make sense for the first half of the show, you will probably start predicting and making assumptions (like I did). Character development isn't all that good, and I wished they described more on each guy and what they do usually, school clubs but I guess they could only fit in so much about each character (becausethere's 5 guys) in the show. You only learn a bit about each boy, but you learn the most about Ukyou. Near the ending of the show though, it becomes more clear what's going on and the story line. 


I didn't like how the main character was so slow. I understand that shoujo girls are usually soft and quiet and then guys like her, but this was just bad. She took an irregular amount of time to respond in a slow, quiet whisper. If she had been a little more outgoing, the story would most likely have been more fast-paced and you'd get to know the guys better instead of waiting for the Heroine to respond. Although this may be because she has amnesia and she's just being uncertain to what's around her, when people that you think you know are telling you things, don't go easily listening to whatever they say. She's very gullible and naive, and doesn't seem to have a sense of danger until it's right in front of her (literally). 


It's nice to see how the guys react around her, what they tell her and what they do for her. It nicely portrayed how much they liked her, especially with Toma and Ukyou. The art is really nice (I don't understand why all the guys sleep with their day clothes on) and their eyes are so cool.


The end of the show was a nice ending, with everything resolved and it ending in a cliffhanger for you to choose what happened. It's wasn't so sad as to cry, though (and I would know because I cry in everything I read, watch or hear about that pulls at my heart strings). I would love to have seen the answer, but then again, I wouldn't know my answer either if I had to choose.


Overall, I thought this was a decent show. It had a reverse harem, cliched romance, attractive guys and most importantly, how much work a guy went through because he liked you so much.

Amnesia is a great anime considering that its based on an otome game.
The Art is good to look at, love the eyes of the characters.
The thing I like the most was that its different as you get to know all the good sides of the male characters.
Time shifts adds a different kick to the regular love stories, its more like guess which boyfriend she's really with.
It definitely leaves you wanting to know the real accident.

To be honest, Amnesia wasn't that appealing to me. I admit, I thought the plot was fairly good, so i decided to watch it; but about the third episode in, I felt it was getting draggy, and had to pacing in the story. The main heroine is so confusing and emotionless, I was ABOUT TO GO CRAZY. She barely has her own thoughts, and most of her words are "oh." or "I see". The plot was good, but it didn't really go anywhere, so the times when she goes to a different world, it makes you go "WTF JUST HAPPENED?" And the characters were fairlyweak, with no build-up behind them (weak to the point where you don't even know their names). Any good things about this anime was that the art was done well, so i can't complain about that. In all, i give it a 5/10. I don't really recommend this anime to people who want to watch it, but if you want to, go ahead, I just don't think you're really missing out on anything. Ok, bye.\n
~ Thanks for reading ^_^

What first really caught me from Amnesia were how unique the eyes were and overall for its looks Amnesia doesn't do too bad. Considering it was adopted from an otome game we know it won't have much depth to it and the plot isn't such a bad idea. 
Yet as i followed the story i found myself feeling just as confused as the main character herself. And what really urked me the most about this anime was infact Heroine. The name hardly suits her when she did nothing about what was going on. At one point shes falls off a boat into the lake andorion tells her to swim and what does she do? The answer certainly isnt try to swim back up. Throughout the story she hardly speaks and sits back and becomes useless as all these events and guys are thrown into her life. Not once did she speak up. (Plus your life is suddenly a reverse harem where bishies left and right are claiming to be your boyfriend this is not the time to run away). As episodes contiously aired i found myself yelling at Heroine to just do something. 


Of course when it came to the end it was left open, and almost left something more to be desired. As an otome game it does well but as an anime it left me terribly frustrated. That's why i could only rate this as fair as i still kept interest in it and it wasn't bad to the point where i wanted to abandon it at all (i suppose because i wanted to figure out where the hell this show was actually going).


From an otome game point of view it makes sense why heroine is so dull, you're the one who puts life into her, chooses the path, and you become part of the game; but put into an anime Amnesia doesn't work out well and leaves you with the question of "what the hell just happened?"

Amnesia is what it sounds like. It's about someone that had an amnesia. This anime is about romance and bravery. For the girls out there, you can probably put yourself in one place where the Heroine was at. As for me, Toma's world was me. And I cried. A lot. You can feel how the characters feel, and this is the most interesting storyline ever. Everyone wants to travel to a parallel universe and see how people around them would be. You get your opportunity here actually! It felt like a dating game every single episode and each episode taught me something. Although I'm curiouswho'd she'd be with... But that's just me.


Character Developement (10): It's definitely a ten for a reason. You see how different the people around the Heroine are as she changes worlds. Especially Toma and Kento. Toma was a cheerful brother of Shin, but in his side of the story, he's a prince who traps Heroine into the cage to protect his princess. As for Kento, he went from a ****, to a timid boyfriend. Toma x Heroine was a great love story though. Until Ukyo ruined it.


Story (10): No fillers! Yay! I love how she never dies though. She was thrown down a building, fell down a cliff, and drowned. But she woke up like it was nothing. MIND BLOWN. XD! But still. I would never expect any other smart idea.


Overall was an eight. The ending wasn't expected. I thought it would be like 'amnesia, then no amnesia', but I was shocked. It wasn't. To those Amnesia haters, don't hate. Cause I bet if you watch this, you'd stay up until four in the morning desperately trying to finish this anime. Which was me. XD! But still... Give it a shot. But if you want action and fighting, there isn't much here!!

I'm not too happy about the constant jumping around with different worlds. However I guess it makes it plausible so that she can be dating different boyfriends. I guess I just want them to get to the point where it comes to light on how she got amnesia in the first place?

Ok so I just finished Amnesia finally! So here is my opinion on the anime.
Plot: Heroine (no name in the anime) loses memory, and trying to find answers as to what happened. But during the story she seems more focused on the romance than on the actual goal. I like the idea of where the story was heading, the mystery did get my attention. But I couldn't follow this story until episode 10 when the story got back on track. 
Art & soundtrack: I gotta admit I love them both, the opening and ending was beautiful and the art was fantastic, the colors as wellthe scenes we're clearly defined. \n\n
Characters: The main protagonist lack personality. Sorry fans but she rarely smiles, laugh show any emotion of any kind. Yes, she lost her memory doesn't mean she lost her personality. \n
For the males in this anime I absolutely adore them, from their dress style to their personalities. \n\n
Overall: Overall I feel this anime is good I like the art, sound, and the boys. If this anime kept to what it say it was gonna do all through the series I wouldn't mind it so much. I don't dislike this anime I just don"t like the heroine and the way she is perceived.

OK..OK... I know... I dropped the anime after watching a few episodes, so why am I writing a review? Well, here's why...
~~ you'll only get to understand the anime if you watch til the end, so,just when you start understanding the anime, the succeeding episodes destroys the plot viewers are trying to build...maybe (accdg to my younger brother) because it was based on a game, however, there are anime adaptation from games that ended up really great.
 The Heroine, just seem so frail and weak, and that she's so confused and shocked.. and every guy is after her... puh-leease!!! ( I am not being mean,but my left brow is arced up), yeah, of course, she lost her memory, and she gets to live the same day with a different story, but, couldn't she be more tough?\n\n
BUT!! I should say the art is great, beautiful anime characters, and I love the opening song of the anime, thumbs up for that. I just hope the story was good\n

Amnesia is an anime that is a hit or miss with some people; you either love it, or you don't. While I can't say I'm in either of those two categories, I do have a strong opinion on this anime, an I haven't decided of they are good or bad yet. 
Story: 5.78/10
The story is very basic, seeing as it is based off an Otome game. The Heroin in Amnesia is reliving the same day, but in an alternate universes', each one having a different boy as her lover. The story is fairly cliché, but this particular anime has strong points that make up forthe lack of story.


Art: 9.45/10

The art is beautifully done, very well for an anime of this genre. Generally romance anime haven't been very well animated in the industry, and this proves otherwise. The characters are interesting and very well designed, the irises are also very lovely to the eyes. Overall it is extremely well done.


Sound: 9.79/10

The sound also is another aspect of this anime do so well; the voice acting and the opening and ending are very nice. The OP is very well done, and remains one of my favorites. The voice acting is nice, but the downside it doesn't have a Dubbed version yet (hopefully!).


Characters: 5.89/10

The characters were lacking originality, especially our Heroin (who actually doesn't have a name in the anime!). The other characters (or lovers) are based off of suits in a deck of cards (Joker, Heart, Diamond, Ace, and Spade). Without spoiling too much, what I can say is that some are very.......possessive of our Heroin. She is not very strong willed, but Otome-Anime games aren't know for the strong female lead, are they?


I personally recommend this anime, but be warned for it to be a hit or miss. This can be highly enjoyable, or you can drop it like its hot. Enjoy!!

It starts out confusing and I gave up on it the first time because I didn't understand it. BUT- keep reading. This is an amazing anime. I gave up on it because it was one of the first anime i've ever seen. I rewatched and watched all of the episodes and it made sense. The art was AMAZING and it had really great romance. I would watch it over and over again, but I'm watching another anime right now. ^.^ 
This anime was well worth my time. Watch it! It was really cute, romantic, and nice art style. :)

I don't really like to give reviews, but amnesia really caught my eye. I've watched many romance anime before and this really got me hooked up. 
Story: 8/10 
The first 3 episode's we're quite confusing too me, but i realised that the genre of the anime is " Romance & Mystery". I totally loved it, The heroine jumping to other boy's lives is quite cool. I've watched plenty of Romance anime where the girls are always screaming at the guy or it took place on a school and i got tired of it! The mind-blowing twist's in the anime is super cool and the onlything that i hate is the ending, it looks like they rushed it and would be better if they made an OVA of it or if they showed the heroine's life after the whole messy problem. 


Art: 9/10


I love the Art! It's just like the art in Uta no Prince-sama. But it would be great if they always change the character's clothes (but i guess, that's a bit normal for anime show) again, the art and how the characters look is simply perfection and i love it! 


Sound: 9/10 


The music's and sounds really suit's the anime! I love the opening song and especially the ending song! especially when the episode ends and you just got a mindblown! :] the best! 


Character: 8/10


I don't like nor hate the heroine of Amnesia, she's too quiet and only say one word or one sentence every time she speaks something. The 4 boys are good. i love their attitudes especially Kent since he's the only "unique" one. 


Enjoyment: 9/10 


Although the story is a bit twisty, i still enjoyed it and hoping for an anime like Amnesia, since i dont like the "too obvious" romance anime..


Overall: 10/10! 


I read the top review's and im a bit dissapointed to his/her review, but everyone who watched amnesia has different opinions. 


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------jenny

I think this anime was not as good as it could have been. It shows great potential in the beginning, given some of the characters background, I think they could have elaborated more on them, (specially the fairy world) and give the story something more solid. 
There are several reasons why I kinda dislike the story, one of the major one is that the main character seem to be out of it all the time, yes, at some point it was necessary and rather funny, but in general she seem to lack any motivation to figure out what was happening to her. 
Another reasonI believe the story was not as good was because, in all the worlds, she worked and lived in the same place, it would have given the story more juice if she had have a different lifestyle in all of the worlds and not just the boyfriends. \n\n
The good thing about this story is that it keeps you interested long enough to figure out what is going to happen to the main character, also it keeps you wondering who was she before all this started happening, was she that different, which makes the audience imagine another version of the main character.

I have no other way to say this but this was the worst reverse harem anime I have ever seen. Wow I'm literally crying from how tedious it was. It bored me to tears and then some! Give me back my time wasted! 
Story: it's got an interesting concept but for some reason it seemed so incomplete. There were heaps of plot holes and it was boring to be honest. If you ask me there was not enough romantic tension, a key part of otome game inspired anime. The relationship between the characters was also a little off, it just didn't feel right. It seemedto be a bit negative or depressing... 


Art: I understand that this was a fan service move but some of the outfits were ridiculous! The Heroine looked silly.... Guys seemed overdressed and over the top. 


Sound: the biggest letdown! Touma being an exception, I missed the usual Ikemen voice actors. I'm a fan of Eureka but what's with the alien voice? Ukyo and his voice actor were poorly cast... Somehow the Image I had was different based on his design. Perhaps the seiyuu tried too hard to distinguish between the two personalities.

Saving grace - op and credit soundtracks are awesome.


Character: the heroine was annoying. I liked Orion only him. The most interesting character was probably Touma even he was mediocre.


Enjoyment: meh


Overall: it sucked.... Writers wtf were you thinking! I wasted precious bandwidth on this crap!

There were so many bad reviews about this anime, that I thought I should wright a review of this anime too, because I really enjoyed watching this.
Story 9/10
Personally, I think the story was great, it's about a girl who wakes up at 1 August and doesn't know where she is. And when she finally is getting used to her life, she awakes again at another place and she has to start all over again. Besides this, she has every time when she wakes up another boyfriend. It was really confusing why she just woke up everytime and it was 1 August again, but I gotreally addicted to this anime, because I wanted to know why it was that way. And I liked the relationships between the Heroine and the boys. And besides all this, I thought the ending was really good!


Art 10/10

This is probably the only anime I can give a 10 for the art, I thought it was really great. The clothes, the eyes, everything, it was done great.


Sound 9/10

It's already half a year ago since I watched this anime, but what I remember of the sound is this: I believe also this was great, I liked the sound because it fitted well with the moments and I also really liked the opening song.


Character 9/10

I'm not very good at describing persons but I will give it a shot:

The Heroine: What is really weird about her is that she doesn't have a name, it is NEVER mensioned in the anime, but I didn't really realise that while I was watching the episodes, altough it is pretty weird. Her personallity, well, she doesn't do much and she let things just happen around her, but what would you do if you were somewhere, and the only one you could kind of trust was a spirit with the name Orion who was travelling with you? I think I would be really confused and kind of scared, so I do understand her.


Well, all the guys, I will give a short description, at least I'm trying:

Shin: He's kind, in his own way, but he isn't very patient and you could say he is a sort of bad boy, but he isn't really bad.

Ikki: He's the popular guy who is a lot of time surrounded by his 'fangirl group', so I think you should kind of know what sort of person he is.

Kent: The smart guy who doesn't know much of romance, but, something you will see in the anime, he does his best to be better for the heroine, and that's somehow funny in it's own way.

Toma: He's a bit obsessed with the heroine and is really afraid of losing her, but he loves her also in his own way, but maybe a bit too much.

Ukyo: In the beginning you might say: Who is Ukyo? Well, you'll see later, because it will be a big spoiler if I tell much about him I will say three things about him: He's very mysterious, but also loving and caring, you will see it in the anime :).


Besides from these boys you have one other important character:

Orion: He's is kind of her guide trough what's happening to her and he tries to help her as much as he can.


Personally, I liked Kent, Toma and Ukyo the most but everybody has his own opinion :)


Enjoyment 9/10

I enjoyed this anime very much. I was really confused and I wanted to know the ending really bad, so I just watched all the episode in one night, so I couldn't get much sleep that night but I was definitely worth it! I also think that the romance part in this anime was quite good :)


Overall 9/10

I think girls will like this anime more than boys, and I think personally that this was a really good anime! (And I'm a girl). So I was really dissapointed when I saw all the bad reviews about this. Before just not watching this anime because of the bad reviews, you have to give it a shot yourself. I was certainly NOT dissapointed, I thought it was great and I liked almost everything of it. Also the aspect of using the figures that you see on cards: (I mean: spades, diamonds, hearts and clover) was a pretty good idea. You might not totally understand the ending of the anime. (Well, that's what I saw in some comments) But if you understand, you'll see that it's actually really good.


For now I will say this: don't skip this anime just because of the bad reviews, just watch it and than you should see for yourself wether you like it or not.

Amnesia was a awesome anime. The characters voices matched their personality and i loved the plot and the way the characters acted. All in all, Its very interesting.  This anime is a romantic comedy  reverse harem with a little bit of mystery.
Here's what its about:
  A heroine wakes up and to her surprise and memory, her identity, was all gone.with a cell phone full of numbers and names she doesn't recognize.  She Meets a young boy named Orion who is a spirit, and only she appears to see. He explains that he accidentally bumped her soul makingit unbalanced. Its revealed that there are 5 boys with 5 worlds. In each world there is a different scenario for the boys in each world. Each boy represents a playing card. Heart, spade, clover, diamond, and joker. With Orion's guidance, she struggles to make sense of herself, a boyfriend she doesn't know and the thousand and one little things that make up a daily life. But with no memories left, the only alternative is to forge new ones, even if that means leaving old loves behind.

Amnesia is quiet a self-explatory anime, but it's sprinkled with elements of fantasy & mystery. In a way, this anime reminded me of Dramatical Murder, an anime that I personally love (except the bullsh!t that happened in episode 3); they both have nice colourful visuals, protagonists that suffer from symptoms of amnesia, animalistic sidekicks & a handful of characters that have their own personal relationships with the protagonists. This anime is a nice representation of what an amnesiac person may experience when trying to gain back their memories. I also like how she is transported into different dimensions & allows the memories to eventually makea complex but nice connection. I know that this anime was based off a dating game & that probably explains the reasons why the protagonist is dating someone new, but I've seen a lot of people moo about this anime & say that the story's a pile of incomprehensible bollocks. I can sort of understand why some people would say that, but overall it takes a bit of time. However, the thing that kind if ticked me off was that nobody told the main character what her actual name was. If a person is wondering who exactly they are, the first thing that someone should tell them is their name. I don't know if the other characters were either like: "F*ck it. She'll know eventually." or they all put on their retard hats & were like: "Duh! She knows what here name is. Her amnesia's not that bad." Despite the few flaws, I did enjoy this anime as it does provide a realistic view on the topic of amnesia. I also love the main theme; if it weren't for that song, I wouldn't have known about this anime :)

If you like something weird,that feels good,shocking,lovely,romantic/serious drama and confusing in a way,this anime is made for you.Okay first of all I totally love this anime and don't know why it's getting so much hate,but for me it was one of the best anime I have watched.The way it plots out is kind of mysterious and makes you want to find out what will happen in some of the cases and I guess that's why you will probably need to watch it.I don't know what els to say.Okay I guess one more thing::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
:WATCH IT

I was half-way through the otome game Amnesia when i found out by a friend , that there's an actual anime about it, being the curious girl i am i stopped everything and started watching the anime. (Keep in mind in the otome i've already finished all endings of Shin and Ikki)
Art-wise i was not disappointed everything , even small bits of details lived up to my expectations. 
What really frustrated me though , was the lack of depth in plot and characters, as i've already mentioned since i got to see how good the plot was in the otome  so  i wasexpecting the same + even greater in anime.


It is however completely understandable if you think about it , such anime/genre wouldn't possibly have a budged big enough to afford more episodes to enhance the plot/char personas.


A lot people were annoyed by the small-talk the heroine does , but honestly that didn't bother me since it was to be expected when you keep in mind that she can't let others know about her amnesia.


Sound-wise , most of the background music/tracks i'd really liked , however considering that according to the world with Shin's plot our protagonist was a singer , we should be able to hear her sing a song or two .



Either way i strongly recommend people to watch the anime and play the otome , since it was still something unique and refreshing to me.

Amnesia in a word is: Hazy 
The reason I say hazy is because nothing ever really gets cleared up or makes a lot of sense, but I feel like that's what the creators wanted. I still enjoyed it though! If you love reverse harem animes, make sure this one makes it on your list! 
The anime style is pretty, the OP is great, and the boys are hawt.
The story is fun, slightly creepy at times, but like most people who watch reverse harem animes, I wasn't watching it for the story ;P
My biggest complaint about this anime (as with most reverse harem animes) isthat the female lead was a complete air-head. It irks me when a character seems to say or do the wrong thing (or do nothing) every time there's a desperate situation. However, I guess one could rationalize it saying "Would you be able to think clearly if you were surrounded by so many gorgeous men?" No...probably not.

This anime is based on an otome game, which I also own and enjoyed. The main character does get to date many very cute boys, and there are a lot of cute moments between her and the boys. I won't get into the details, because spoilers...
I watched the anime, then played the game (it's available on Steam). I think you could watch/play in either order safely, because of the nature of the story. They are similar, and if you enjoy otome games you would probably also like this.
Warning:
The main character is sort of passive in the anime. Less so in the game, because you getto choose what to say. This passiveness gets her into trouble, and may annoy you.

Oh god, what a shame, what a damn shame.
I had high hopes for this anime, as I came from the game to the anime. I truly deep down inside did want the anime to soar because I am really obsessed with whole Amnesia universe, but man ... This anime, was dreadful.
Summary is. Girl loses memory, then wakes up meeting these new, I guess love potentials?
If you're also coming from the game too, you'll understand my rage. But without giving out any spoilers, every single guy here got ROBBED of their story. ESPECIALLY Ukyo, what a train wreck. I'm totally Kent biased, but Ukyo's final episodewas such a load of crap and it unfortunately was the last episode which left me with a bad taste of the whole anime overall. Believe me, Ukyo is my least favourite and even I know he got robbed or at least what could've turned this anime upside down.\n\n
If you're planning on watching this anime, I would probably suggest just to play the game instead. It's a lot more in depth and you really lose yourself in it. I really did wish this didn't go south, such a damn shame.

So this is my first review, I am terribly sorry if I make any mistakes. I have always been a big fan of otome games and therefore of otome game anime. So I have watched this anime in May last year and at first I was very confused by what was going on. Nobody really explains what is going on in the beginning, you just jump right in. Although Orion, the Heroine's little helper does explain some things. Already at the end of episode 1 I started to enjoy myself a lot. The art is beautiful and the music just stunning. It really emphasizes themood of everything. The Heroine is, like most Otome Game/Anime characters a little quiet and doesn't really have a strong personality, although that might be understandable due to her memory loss. In my opinion this is alright because in the first place an otome anime would be to find yourself in the Heroine's place and if she had a certain personality that wouldn't be possible for everyone, also it is described that she has a different personality in every world. In December, when I was already long done watching the anime I played the game and after I was done with it I watched the anime once more. Everything just made more sense and I got answers to questions the anime didn't provide.\n\n
My conclusion would be, that the anime is very enjoyable if you like otome and can deal with weak female characters or not knowing what is going on at first. For me the anime makes more sense as an addition for the fans of the game but it is enjoyable even if you didn't play it.

I don't think this series gets enough credit personally. 
The story is very interesting and in my opinion not very hard to follow at all. It goes from story to story in a pretty fluid way. The art on this show is probably it's most stunning aspect. The way the characters are designed especially the hair and eyes are pretty and they do a more unique sort of thing where they blend colors. One character's hair is yellow but fades into orange at the tips and the cloths are interesting and unique as well. A lot of work went into the character designs and itpayed off because the fact that it looked so nice art wise was why I started watching other then the plot. 


The sound has good quality and so is the soundtrack. The voice acting is also really good quality and done well, you can tell what emotions they're trying to convey and they don't fall short with the sound quality at all most of the time. I also really loved the characters in the show as well. My only complaint was that alot of them would always follow that "I'm going to be cold to you first and nice to you later" pattern and I wish they had all been a bit different in that regard but other then that I enjoyed most of the main characters with the exception of of one them. Even the side characters were nice for me to watch. 


Overall yeah this series is good but it may have been a bit rushed because they tried to fit an entire otome game into 12 episodes, I guess they were trying to advertise the game. If it had been longer though, it would have been better. In the game each characters route takes place over a month and you have more of a chance to get to know them and 4 to 5 endings for each, one of them even has 9 endings! So that's why shoving everything into 12 episodes wouldn't work out and I can see why people would be confused and not get it. For the time it was given though, I think it did a pretty good job. I recommend this anime because it has an interesting and unique plot for an otome game anime and I personally like most of the characters and find them interesting. I would also recommend the game it's based off as well!

Not so bad that I couldn't bear to waste a few hours of my life on it, but bad enough that I wanted to write a review to let everyone know that it's bad.  The entire series basically consists of the heroine jumping from one reality to the next, and in each "world" she's dating a different guy.  The heroine has absolutely no personality--not a personality that's overdone, but just none at all--and the male characters are all the cliched "types" that are done to death.  You've got the tortured soul, the white knight, the brains, the player, and the mysterious stranger.The only saving grace for the series is the ending, where everything is explained, but by then I already hated it enough that I could barely appreciate it.  I'm sure it all worked very well as an otome game, but it really, really didn't translate well to this medium.

>Art------------------6

Amnesia
Story: 7-
The story follows a girl who woke up with amnesia and in attempt to regain her memories befriends Orion a spirit.  The concept was good, however at times it was dull and they tried to build up mystery to a point where it became predictable, other times the opposite happened- it was just too predictable.
Art: 9- 
I love the kind of the art they had in Amnesia it was very similar to No Game No Life.
Sound: 5-
It was average, nothing special.
Character: 6-
The heroine had no personality, although the men in the anime did (the reason why it gets a 6). Like I understandthat she would be quiet after losing her memories, but she had no opinions.\n
Enjoyment: 6-\n
It was okay, I watched it fairly quickly but it's hardly going to be anything that I think a lot about.\n
Overall: 7-\n
I recommend if you have spare time.
Nice artwork but emotionless heroine and monotonous story line. Although you should consider the fact that the anime is adapted from an otome game, Amnesia  is boring and slow.

~A heroine without a name~
The stories were not quite understandable in the beginning. However, gradually 
the series concludes and every audience in a dilemma more or less understood what's going on.
First. It begun with an introduction to what happened to our fellow heroine, who was not named in the series. Interesting as to how the entire series followed up without the main character's name being mentioned AT ALL. Often the character was called upon by a single 'hey' or 'neh, kimi'.
~Art~ Was well drawn and fairly anticipating. Character's clothing however stays the same throughout the entire series.
Overall a confusing anime at first but gradually, allyour questions will be answered.

I've watched Amnesia in.. five hours, I think.
Story(6): Yes, it is a reverse harem but that's not the main idea. The anime focuses on the mystery around the girl. Even so, it wasn't an original idea, but it was ok.
Art(9): The best part of the anime. I absolutely loved the clothes, the hair, the eyes.. everything. It was different, in a very good way. 
Sound(7): It was good. I personally liked the OP theme and there was one soundtrack I noticed at one point and really liked. The ending theme was ok too. The boys' voices are sooo hot, but the voice of the maincharacter may be annoying for some.


Character(7): I give it a 6 for the boys. As this anime is an adaption from a game, I expected the heroine to have no personality but.. GOD! I found myself yelling at the screen at some points "SAY SOMETHING, PLEASE!" She barely talks and most of time says "Yes", "No", "I'm sorry" or "Thank you". I understand that she doesn't have any memories but that's not an excuse.

The boys are almost perfect. They are very different, but no one has the perfect life. Each has his own problems and story.


Enjoyment(4): This anime kept me on the edge of my seat for four hours. And not it a good way. I couldn't stop because the fact that she didn't have any memories bothered me a lot. I can only tell that you have this whole mystery for most part of the anime, not even the ending is clear. I expected a lot from the ending, but then again, it's adapted from an otome game so I shouldn't have expected so much. 


Overall(6): If you want good-looking guys, cute but no-personality heroine and lots of mystery, Amnesia is for you.

If your looking for a sweet story this is the way to go. The main chracter gets amnesia and is sent to what seems like garious worlds where her fate is diffrent in each one. But then there is orion, a spirit that made her have amnesia but how exactly did that happen.
In each area she is with 1 of  4 boys she know. In each world their relationship with one another is quite diffrent. Though i did get very cofused at some points as you watch the last episode it suddenly becomes clear and you understand it. I really enjoyed it a lot,it was quite interesting though to see when she goes to a new place. Although it may not be completely clear with the very last scene think about it and then you will surely know what she decides to do.\n
The overall rating for amnesia: i give it a 9

When I saw the first episode, I thought that I missed one because the viewer is immediately thrown into the story. I gave the story a 5 because it was confusing, but at the same time, I understood why it was called Amnesia. I was unable to get past episode 5 because I was thoroughly confused. The only reason why I got that far was because people kept telling me that it was worth it and a great watch. I lie. Another reason why I got this far was because of the art. It was very detailed and I especially liked the detail of theeyes. Seeing as how this is based off of an otome game, the transition was smooth and it truly felt like a video game. My enjoyment was a 5 because it was hard to follow the story and it got so confusing to the point of which I had to stop watching. Don't get me wrong, the first 3 episodes were great until the story became more definite and real. My overall score is a 6 (based on the episodes I have seen so far). Because many people have said that it is a great series once it is finished, someday I may come back to it.

This anime is kind of like those dating animes, where the girl is with multiple guys. But it has a twist. I honestly felt like I was in the characters shoes throughout the anime because she lost her memories and has no idea whats going on, that was me while watching it. I kept on watching it wanting to find out why she lost her memories and all that. If you like those dating multiple type of anime's you'll probably like this, keep in mind this has  twist to it and you either like it or you don't. I like these type of animes!

After watching this anime, I was still scratching my head. This anime in particular was very moving and had many things going for it; however, there were things within the anime that I found appealing and not so appealing. 
Story- The story line for the show was very well thought of, and it was a great idea; however, the execution was not handled well, in my opinion. This was an anime that I did have to watch again in order to understand. However, it was very well thought out, greatly enjoyed the plot!
Art- Oh my goodness! The art in this anime was amazing!! Everything wasanimated very smoothly, and each character had their own touch that made them their own! However, I will say that for the main character, she was a little plain, but I think that is just because of how I see main characters. Overall, the art style was magical and wonderful!!


Sound- Each of the characters had great voice acting! I will comment that I have only watched this anime in Japanese, and I have yet to hear the English adaptation; however, I don't believe that should be a game changer! Also, the opening and ending for the show were very appealing to the mind! Wonderfully done!!


Character-This show was well thought out; however, like I previously said in the "Art", the main character was very plain, and not just in her art style, but also as a character. Because of the situation, it is clear to see why; however, I think they could have given her more dynamic shaping in her development. However, all the supporting characters were so well thought out!! 


Enjoyment- Other than the comments made above, the anime is actually very well developed! I greatly enjoyed this anime; however, because of the plot, I cannot give this category a higher rating...


Overall- I give this anime a 7/10! It had both appealing and non-appealing parts to the anime, but it was still decent!

In my opinion, this anime is bad.
It has a good opening song, and I quite like the main character's design (although I know that there are others who don't). In addition, whilst I can't really say that they're good per se, the male characters' designs are different from the norm.
Its art and music seem fairly average. I watched it in Japanese, which I'm not a native speaker of, so I can't really comment on the voice acting.
Unfortunately, the plot and character development is bad. The story isn't particularly interesting, and the characters are incredibly boring and generic at best. A special mention goes to themain character who could easily be replaced by a stick of celery. She is incredibly passive, barely speaking when spoken to, and has no semblance of a personality.\n\n
I usually find reverse harems enjoyable, if not particularly good, but I can't think of a reason to encourage anyone to watch this one.

I'm not sure I'd call this a 'Reverse Harem' kind of show...
Have you ever had that 'low self-esteem-ridden' friend who can't live 5 minutes without having to cling to a guy to make their life 'worth living'? Watching this might straighten them out.
'Amnesia' reminds me of a Spike Lee movie: 'She's Gotta Have It', where the lead character, as in the 'Amnesia', has a few guys with potential to pick from. BUT WHO is the guy with the best heart, or isn't so self-absorbed he even knows you're there?
My daughter and I are watching this this weekend, because, not to mention, there are twists tothe plot and the guys are ALL hot, for a cute lil' flower like our leading lady, but with the 4 options almost going through a 'job interview', will she choose, A, B, C or D? What if the answer is 'None of the above'?\n\n
What do YOU make of the 4? Some of their personality 'foibles' might surprise you.

Watched it up until episode three in which I didn't really finish. 
The female heroine didn't make an impact. She was so passive and she doesn't really have a "character". Sure the guys were hot and whatnot, but if you're looking for something more than just the pretty faces then Amnesia isn't really right for you. 
Now what I did was watch the first two episode (watching one episode might have sufficed) then I watched the last two episodes (11 & 12). Sure, I missed some parts but really, I understood immediately what was happening. Or did I just think I instantly knew what washappening. It was a bit confusing though. Nonetheless, I had a clue what was going on. 


I actually liked the ending (don't kill me). Call be shallow, but it did make sense. When I said the ending, I meant the part up until the revelation between Ukyo and the female protagonist. Without the other disturbances and if only the story focused on one lead guy, I think it's not that bad. Yes, I know it's inevitable since it was based from an otome game. Damn the scene after the flashbacks and when she stepped inside the door. I wasn't particularly fond of that scene. Despite of the bittersweet ending, the tragic ending I wish it stayed at that. I was like, DESPITE EVERYTHING CHOOSE UKYO DAMN IT YOU CAUSED HIM ENOUGH PAIN NOW PAY IT BACK. But then again, I haven't watched anything in between and I don't know what's the deal with the other guys.


Damn it, there wasn't an Ukyo road in Amnesia Later (as far as I know). I think I liked Ukyo because I didn't really watch the whole thing. However, I couldn't help but skip everything because it was a bit dragging and because the heroine didn't really stood out despite of being the main character. I don't get it why she can't stand for herself. I mean, if you've got amnesia sure you can be taken advantage of, but she does have the choice of not trusting them (although I think in episode 2 or 3 it was revealed that she has amnesia, but she was so damn submissive. If she didn't liked the kiss or if she was shocked she should have pushed him away).

Another is that they know--knew-- her, the fact that she's acting strange, shouldn't that alert them? It was like nothing changed before and after she got amnesia. It's like she was always spacing out, quiet and whatnot from the start. To give it some slack, I didn't really watch episodes 4 to 10. So yeah.


I would watch the other episodes, but not now, maybe in other times that I don't have things to do or when I'm bored or whenever. I dunno.

Amnesia starts out well enough, with a girl who suddenly collapses at work and is woken up by a boy floating inches from her. The characters each have their own unique style of dressing, using a combination of a signature color accompanied by checkerboard. The sound is so bad that I don't even remember it at all, that is the only reason it has a bad score. Another thing about the story that is aggravating is each time the main character ends up in another world she runs into a man who obviously knows something about what is happening to her but she never onceasks him. So it was more infuriating than anything.

A mystery anime that involves traveling through parallel worlds, in each one where the main character is dating a new cute boy, but as soon as everything seems happy, BAM she dies and is transported to another world. Not many ways you can mess this one up, eh? Will, Amnesia finds a few.
Amnesia is an anime adopted from an otome dating sim of the same name animated by the studio Brain Base and directed by Ohashi Yoshimitsu, his most notable other works being Sacred Seven and Bakumatsu Kikansetsu Irohanihoheto. It tells a tale of our nameless heroine (because, you know, all of the guys shedates just prefer to call her you and stuff like that) who one day wakes up with amnesia. Her only guide is a fairy called Orion, who says that to regain her memories she needs to hang out with the people who she used ot hang out with to regain her memories. Quickly however, she begins hopping between dimensions somehow (whenever she dies she goes to a new one) and in each of those new worlds she is dating a different boy. Thus she needs to hide her memory lost from these boys so she won't be sent to the hospital (you see, if she never talks to anyone, then she will die or something along the lines of that) while trying to understand exactly what her relationship is with the boys so she can act like she knows them, and of course try to figure out exactly what is happening to her. 


So the plot. It is rather good in the mystery area. I mean, while I did guess what was happening, I couldn't figure out how it was happening. And the stories with each one of the boys are rather good enough. Well, okay, some of the events are a little extreme, but more on that later. 


Due to the fact this is an arc-based show, I'll go over each one of them. The first one is over Shin, and the heroine has a memory of him saying “killed a man”. However, that is resolved rather nicely and due to the fact this is the first arc, it's more or less just the heroine trying to get used to her situation. Shin is a decent enough heroine. Sure he's your typical dark boy with a mysterious past, but he's not annoying at all. Then comes Ikki's arc, which is a little worse due to how idiotic the heroine acts (I quickly solved the mystery that bothered the heroine in this arc almost instantly). Ikki is a rather good protagonist though. He's a ladies man and has dated several girls besides the heroine in the previous months before the show started, but he's not rude or annoying at all. Then comes Kento, my favorite boy by far. Blunt, awkard in romantic relationships, smart and actually figures out part of what is happening, so of course his arc is the only one to last 1 episode, while the rest before him got two. And the half of episode he sacrificed goes to the two other heroes, who are both my least favorites. Touma, oh my god, just Touma. Well, going into why I disliked him so much would be spoilers, but just the things he does. While it does make a little sense at first, the extremes he goes to, and how the heroine acts like a total doormat too and forgives him quickly at the end. And the boy of the last arc, it's a spoiler to go into it that much, but it was... Meh. I mean, the ending of this show is awful. Just an dull info-dump in a setting that makes no sense whatsoever. They even leave it in the air who the heroine ends up with. 

Speaking of the heroine, she is terrible. She has no personality at all and acts like a complete idiot. I swear over half of what comes out of her mouth is “Um... Er... Ah...” and stuff along the lines of that. Just some of the decisions she makes and how she is unable to comprehend her situation at all. She's easily the worst part of the show, even with the bad ending and Touma's arc. Other notable characters include the manager of the cafe where the heroine works at, who changes personality every arc for some reason, and the fairy who helps the heroine out, who is eternally cheerful and happy.


The music was good, some of the soundtracks help add to the suspenseful mood. The opening theme is very good, with the ending theme being more forgettable. The voice acting was also good enough, minus for the above-mentioned heroine, though that has more to do with script than anything. 

The animation... Well, okay, so they don't move much, but all of the designs are very detailed and look pretty, and this being an anime where the point is the cute boys, that is sort of needed. Another thing to note is how everyone wears these extremely ridiculous outfits that are card-themed. Shin wears clothes to the theme of hearts, Ikki wears clothes with the theme of spades, and so on. But they all still look really stupid in those decked-out clothes that no one wears in real life. 


Amnesia is far from a bad show. The mystery is decent, most of the characters are good, the music is a plus, and the designs look pretty. However, it is pulled down by a terrible lead character, one of the arcs is terrible, and the ending isn't very good. If you're a fan of bishonen or mystery anime, then check this out. If not, then watch it if you don't know what else to watch. It's a decent show, despite the fact it has several flaws.

From what I've watched, this anime's art is amazing (lots of personality designs)--but I didn't enjoy this very much because it doesn't include a "normal" or omg-such-a-great-story moral, if this anime showed a moral with lots of emotion in it, I definitely think this anime would get alot more hits and votes...
To viewers: This is only in my opinion, so don't take it seriously. I think the game on Amnesia (?) is better than the anime one (role-play, lots of boys/harem).

This series so far is.. huh. I'm not so sure. It's good but not so good at times. I generally like the characters and I like the art but sometimes it gets sorta cliche. I'm also kinda annoyed at the heroine right now. I won't say why because that would be like a spoiler I'm guessing. So far, I give a 8/10 right now. Sorry the review is kinda short.

I was quite unsure whether I should watch this anime or not, given that other users who watched it, have given it a low story rating.
But I'm glad I still watched it.
The story isn't your typical story setting of a reverse harem romance. The first episodes leaves you disoriented but as the story develops, you get the feeling of wanting to know as to why the heroine is in the situation she's in. For some users, the story build-up was rushed to the end, because the answer to the mystery was explained on the concluding episodes, but for me it was just the right timing.If you want to 'savor' this anime, you'd want to try to see it as the heroine sees it. Since it's based on an otome game, it's goal is to let the viewer take the heroine's role.\n
The first episodes really are important for building the right amount of curiosity 'till the end, as it makes you think and make you wanna solve the 'riddle' behind what's really happening. And as for the last episodes, my heart felt what it wanted to convey, I mean I cried myself out when Ukyo was trying to say goodbye and..\n\n
Oh well, you just have to watch this anime if you want to know what I mean :)\n\n
I recommend this for those who want to watch a Mystery/Reverse Harem/Romance anime.

Story: I have heard that this anime is supposed to be shit because it's one of those reverse harems based off a otome game. To be honest, I would expect this anime to annoy the living shit out of me because I don't want to watch the game; I wanna play it. Unfortunately, since I am from the United States, this is the best that I got. I'm just gonna straight up say that it could've been a whole lot worse. As the story went along, especially the last arc, it definitely got more interesting. It gave us more reason about why the story ishappening the way it is. Is it the best? Probably not. Is it shitty? Not as much as haters made it out to be. You don't have to agree with me, but because I don't wanna spoil too much, I would give this a 7/10 just to be nice.


Art: The art style was definitely an interesting choice since they were basing this off the game it came from. The colors were what struck me the most. In such a dull world, each character had a color (or colors) to represent themselves (well, mostly whatever shape was on a playing card). It wasn't as out of place as I expected to be, and because this is a fantasy game, it does seem to fit with the setting strangely enough. Honestly, I love Orion's designs the best. He's just so cute. However, there are sometimes creepy imagery that I feel as if doesn't need to exist, but it's not a huge complaint. With that, I'll rate it 9/10.


Sound: The opening is good. I mean it's on my favorite's list, but it's pretty low on it. It's not bad, but it's something I would skip sometimes. I just skip the ending all together because it never appealed to me at all. Then, there's the inside music. It's over the top for no reason except the fourth arc. I don't understand why. Compared to other anime, it's a bit subpar, which is why it's 4/10.


Character: I think the best way I can explain character is rating every single one in simple phrases.

Heroine: She's not as bad as I thought she would be. She just lost her memory, so what do you expect her to do when she's going through this jacked up mess? There are times when she can be fucking incompetent, but if anything, she's trying her best to get by.

Orion: I just wished that he was more relevant to this story, but unfortunately, he's not. That doesn't make him bad, but it makes him less important than what the anime made him to be in the posters, which shouldn't be true. He is the reason why the Heroine is going through this journey in the first place, but he disappears? Why?

Shin: My favorite out of the boys. He just seems to show the most emotion for our Heroine, and they seemed the perfect fit. I wanted to see more of them together, but you don't.

Kent: His arc is the most boring. This guy is supposed to be the smart one, and boy, is that his only trope.

Ikki: His is the second boring but the side story is the most dramatic. Perhaps too overly dramatic.

Toma: This character pissed me off to the umpteenth degree. This guy was completely over the top in his arc for no reason at all. I can't like this guy at all. I just can't.

Ukyo: This guy was very interesting. He appears a lot, but I can't spoil too much without ruining the anime.

Side characters: They are decent, but they're not really the main focus, so they are the least interesting  of the bunch.

The overall rating for this section would be a 7/10.


Enjoyment: Like I said, this anime wasn't as bad as people made it out to be. However, am I obsessed with this show? Probably not. I kinda used this as background noise to whenever I was doing homework. My favorite arc was Shin's because he was my favorite boy out of the group, so I would say, this part is going to be rated 7/10.


Overall: It's easy to say that I was trying to be nice with this anime. I really tried by best to be fair, but the score is the score after all. That's why I'm giving this a rounded up 7/10. If you are not a fan of reverse harems or anything based off of otome games, this is definitely not for you...or at least it's not the best I've seen. By the way, THE DUB IS ACTUALLY NOT THAT BAD! It makes it more tolerable than anything else.

      Thank you guys if you actually read all of this.

For starters, let's just say that I enjoyed this otome-based anime FAR better than  I did Diabolik Lovers; though that's not saying much.
Ah, Amnesia. What can I say about you? You're not utterly forgettable, but you aren't amazing either. You're just.... average. Maybe that's the worst outcome. This show doesn't have much rewatch value sadly, because unlike a game, you can't go back and redo things or see events from a different point of view.
The story itself does have some clever aspects, but that's mostly due to the game, I feel. I didn't have much trouble following the story until the very end. Iexpect the game explains the plot much better than this show does, but that's  the problem. One would have to go back and play the game to get the full story and experience, I feel. And a movie or show should never be like that. They should be able to fully stand on their own without the help of source material.


Now, as for characters, well, the male leads are all fine, but the female lead? She's a complete doormat. That's the problem when you make anime out of otome games. The main lead ends up having no personality because the main lead is usually the player taking control and making decisions. Oh, sure characters say that she has a personality, but as we all know in the world of the media: show, don't tell.


I didn't find myself hating any characters, though, so that's a plus. Some of them really have sympathetic moments, and of course, being one who has played a couple of these dating sims, I began to expect that not all of the  love interests would be what they seem. It was quite entertaining to figure out who the psycho crazy boyfriend was. But of course, the over-the-top scenarios in otome games amuse me, so some might not find a certain character amusing like I did.


In the end, the major sin of this anime is not that it's dark, disturbing, or even badly presented. It's just bland; average, and sometimes that's worse than being downright awful.

STORY  3/10
------------------
I believe that there was a lot of potential in the plot, but it needed serious elaboration.  I was left very dissatisfied with the ending which, really, didn't "end" anything.  It was much too sudden with an extremely poor essence of finality.  
A girl who is loved by five different guys gets amnesia and has to decide who she's in love with.  That's basically the extent of the plot.
ART   9/10
---------------
When I first saw a review for this anime the first thing I noticed was the art.  I am very particular when it comes to the qualityand styles of the art in both anime and manga.  I have on multiple occasions either dropped or written off anime even before watching simply because I can not stand the art.


The art in this anime is exceptional!  I loved the fresh approach they gave to the eyes and facial expressions.  One of the reasons I didn't drop this anime was because the characters were just so unbelievably beautiful!  The only reason I didn't give it a perfect score was due to the lack of detail in the background.



SOUND  8/10

------------------

The theme for this series was an instant favourite of mine!  I've listened to it almost non-stop since first starting this anime.


However, this show could really have stepped up it's background music.  A good instrumental can really help emphasize the intensity or tenderness of a scene, which is something that I didn't find this anime took advantage of.



CHARACTER  6/10

-----------------------

Once again there was a lot of potential here.  Overall the characters could easily be seen as bland (especially the heroine) or single-minded.  But given the concept of the anime I found them well portrayed.


One of the things I enjoyed about this anime was that it wasn't limited to one person's ideals of the perfect boyfriend.  There were traits to appeal to everyone (similar to Ouran High School Host Club).



ENJOYMENT   5/10

------------------------

It was, all things considered, a good anime.  I personally have ranked it #1 in my current favourites.  But I can see how this one isn't for everyone.


Another one of it's redeeming qualities was that the swearing was kept to a minimal.  As far as I can remember there were only a few appearances of the words a** and d*** throughout the entire series.  It's hard to find a good anime without frequent or moderate language.



OVERALL   6/10

---------------------

I would recommend it to people who enjoy shojo, reverse-harem and, how shall I put it, "multiple choice"?


Some other anime that I suggest you check out if you like this one are:


~ Ouran High School Host Club

~ Fruits Basket

~ Kamisama Hajimemashita

Story: 7/10
The plot was really confusing for a couple of episodes but as I keep on watching it actually made decent sense. Like I said, the mystery surrounding the Heroine is exciting and makes me want to keep on watching. However, it does get predictable later on which slightly degrades the excitingpart. The art in this anime is remarkably beautiful, especially the male characters' eyes. They seem to draw me in Also the characters' clothing designs isn't what you would see on everyday common wear, which makes them unique and important to the story. 


Sound: 8/10

I really like the opening theme of this anime. It fits the mysterious mood of this plot perfectly. The beginning of the song gave me the feeling of emptiness and the questions, "who am I and where am I?" which fits the Heroine's situation pretty well since she did lose her memories. Then during the middle of the song, it suddenly transition to rock music which gave me the feeling of 'never giving up' which also fits the Heroine's personality of not giving up searching for her lost memories. Character: 6/10

People can easily take advantage of her if she doesn't learn how to stand up for herself. It gave me the feeling that she can't do anything by herself. 


As for the hot guys, their personalities are quite bland and predictable. You can practically tell what they'll do next, except for a certain guy...I thought that he was this type of character, but actually he suddenly turns 180 and he's actually this type of character. Overall: 8/10

Have you ever woken up remembering nothing of your past-- not even your name? This is what happened to our heroine. She woke up one morning remembering not even her life, her relationships, her very name—all gone.
Isn't it thrilling to know what happened to her? "What was that all about?" first popped out in my head. All she had was her cellphone with contacts she can't remember who and Orion, a young boy that only she can see. The first episode would really leave you hanging. "Why doesn't the girl remember anything?" "Can Orion really be trusted?"
This anime doesn't focus much on the romance, butmore on the mysteries in the surroundings of the heroine and her memory loss.

"Amnesia" is a 12 Episode series (23 minutes per episode). Full of mystery and will make you watch for more.


The heroine was kinda stiff. She can't even voice out what's on her mind. Also, her voice might be annoying to some. She barely talks at all. And when she does, it's usually single words or sound effects that express her doubt and confusion. Since she can't remember anything-- and she's on a journey to find out who she is, the anime doesn't really give any solid qualities of her.


The characteristics of the heroes were much of a cliche.

There's this bad guy, the extremely-popular guy, the overly smart guy, the social and outgoing guy, and the mysterious guy.

Their pasts weren't highlighted. But I think that's what the author wants. Their "mysteries" is what drives the watchers, what drove me, to watch the next episodes and to finish it ,or so I thought. But until the very end of the anime, I was still puzzled of who they really are and what's their connection with the heroine. Nothing much was stable.


"Amnesia" is an anime that'll filled you with mysteries and will keep you watching until the very end.


But I still hated it how all things were explained in the last 2 episodes of the anime. It came all at ones. So you have to keep still and watch the 10 episodes and find out everything at the last 2. I kind of feel that the ending was sort of rushed-- very rushed (it got me a little bit disappointed) , though I was still expecting for more, all in all.. the anime was great. As for the romance, since Amnesia is a Reverse Harem, the heroine had her chances to be with the guys.


I really salute the artist. The characters were perfectly drawn, very good-looking indeed! Aside from the plot, I was really hooked of how the characters look like. The details were really astonishing! Their clothes are very detailed, their bodies are well proportioned, and their eyes were really interesting. I really love it-- beautiful and smooth. Even the surroundings were great.


There wasn't much of a comedy. Most of the scenes/ episodes were dead serious. But still, like I've said before, the mysteries will keep you hanging-- seriously.


You'll probably like "Amnesia" if:

1. You like Reverse Harem 2. You like attractive males 3. You like Romantic scenes (there were kissing scenes)

"Amnesia". An anime that'll keep you thinking. Its mysteries will keep you going.

Both the artwork and the sound are outstanding. The opening theme of the anime is definitely one my favourite , while the artwork is one of a kind.
Characters :
While  they are really well drawn , the characters lack of a special / distinct characteristic , sth  that will differentiate them from other characters and willmake them remarkable. As for the heroine , she is definitely the typical heroine in reverse harem animes , which is really passive , lacks guts , doesn't stand for herself.\n\n
Overall , from all the reverse harem anime series I have watched so far this one is my favourite , and I firmly recommend it to anyone who is into that kind of anime.
